channel.title: UNSHACKLED! Audio Dramas
channel.itunes:author: UNSHACKLED! - Pacific Garden Mission
channel.itunes:summary: Real people, real stories, stirring dramatic accounts of hopelessness…and the hope that changes everything. These are UNSHACKLED! Audio Dramas, with the award-winning storytelling that's been unique to UNSHACKLED! Ministries for more than 70 years -- but this time, with a behind-the-scenes look. So join us as we dramatize true stories of transformation and share lesser-known details that have made us the longest running audio drama in history.

item.title: 3920 David Hicks Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Self-made, Pride, Emptiness, Insecurity, Drunkenness, Military, Army, Ministry
item.itunes:summary: How does a young black man succeed in today’s world? You’ll hear the answer in the first part of David Hicks two-part testimony, a man who became a two-star general and Chief Chaplain of the U.S. Army. Don’t miss this true dramatization coming soon on Unshackled!

item.title: 3919 Lawrence Durfee Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Greed, Anger, Bitterness, Workaholism, Emptiness, Burn Victim, Near-Death, Evangelism, Inspirational
item.itunes:summary: Lawrence Durfee was fired up to be wealthy when he was set on fire for a different purpose. Don’t miss his compelling testimony, another true dramatization coming soon from the Classic files of Unshackled!

item.title: 3918 Phillis DeWitt (PG)
item.itunes:subtitle: Sexual Abuse, Child Abuse, Foster Care, Hidden Church Sin, Addiction, Suicidal, Shame, Secrets, Rede
item.itunes:summary: Already scarred, Phillis Dewitt entered the foster care system as a teenager, where she encountered even more sexual abuse. Will she ever escape her predators? Will she ever be freed from the secrets she keeps? Don’t miss this powerful story on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3917 Clinton Goodwin Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Crime, Prison, Rescue Missions
item.itunes:summary: Why would a man go from toting a Bible to toting a gun? Clinton Goodwin will explain how he went to San Quentin for armed robbery. Don’t miss this true dramatization coming soon from the Classic files of “Unshackled!”

item.title: 3916 Rigo Dominguez Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Abandonment, Fatherlessness, Addiction, Prison, Discipleship, Consequences, Recovery, Post-Prison, M
item.itunes:summary: Rigo Dominguez was abandoned by his father, and he tries to numb that trauma with drugs and alcohol, which lands him in jail after jail. Will his felony convictions haunt him forever, or is there a path to forgiveness? Hear his true-life story on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3915 Rigo Dominguez Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Abandonment, Fatherlessness, Addiction, Gangs, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Rigo Dominguez is abandoned by his biological father and struggles through life without a positive role model. His friends tell him that selling drugs is the only way to escape his Chicago neighborhood, while his mother suggests a different choice. Learn what path he chooses on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3914 Ben Budde
item.itunes:subtitle: Nominal Christianity, Alcohol, Drugs, Addiction, Pride, Sexual Sin, Music, Performer, Fame, Cancer,
item.itunes:summary: Ben Budde dreams of becoming a rock star, and when he joins a band, he quickly falls into a lifestyle full of temptations. What will save him from his depression and addiction? Find out the answer on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3913 Shawn McGill Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Inspirational, Mission Work, Evangelism, Drugs, Prison, Reconciliation, Peru
item.itunes:summary: A wealthy drug dealer gave up everything he’d earned to follow the Lord. That was easy compared to the real challenge – teasing and threats from his old friends. How did he stay strong when everyone wanted him to fall? Find out in Part two of the true story of Shawn McGill, soon, on Unshackled!

item.title: 3912 Shawn McGill Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Divorce, Theft, Drugs, Addiction, Cocaine, Aimlessness
item.itunes:summary: A man from a broken home vowed to do whatever it took to get rich. Friends envied his sports cars and party lifestyle, but what he really wanted was peace. After years of living lavishly, how could he settle down? Stay tuned for part one of the true story of Shawn McGill, soon, on Unshackled!

item.title: 3911 New Year’s Eve at the Lighthouse Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: New Year’s, New Beginnings, Winter, Shelter, Prayer, Repentance, Peace, Pacific Garden Mission
item.itunes:summary: An Emergency Weather Alert is issued in this “New Year’s Eve at the Lighthouse” Classic. Come join us at our own Pacific Garden Mission on such a night and experience yourselves what occurs for our staff. Subzero temps, freezing people, a suicidal caller, and a woman out partying will all make their way through our doors to bring you this listener favorite, coming soon on UNSHACKLED!

item.title: 3910 Boutique Noel (Santa's Toyshop Classic)
item.itunes:subtitle: Santa’s Workshop (Holiday, Christmas, Depression, Inspirational, Tragedy, Renewal, Family Friendly
item.itunes:summary: It was Christmas all year ‘round for the Snows, who dedicated their lives to running the festive Christmas shop. But were the “magical” trappings of the season keeping them from an even greater miracle? Find out on this listener-favorite holiday classic, The Noel Boutique, coming soon on UNSHACKLED!

item.title: 3909 The Innocents (Christmas Classic)
item.itunes:subtitle: Abortion, Christmas, Self-Determination, Justice, Pro-Life
item.itunes:summary: Holiday songs remind us that Christmas is the most wonderful time of the year. However, for some, it’s also the most challenging, as they grapple with unexpected news and make difficult decisions. Find out what one couple faced on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3908 A Silent Night (Christmas Special)
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas, WW1, Great War, Brotherhood, Fear, Military, Peace, Hope, Assurance, Courage, Inspiration
item.itunes:summary: On the frozen fields of Flanders, 1914, war’s brutality silenced hope—until a single carol broke through. On Christmas Day, enemies became brothers, sharing songs and peace in No Man’s Land. But could this fragile truce withstand the dawn? Discover the miracle of courage, faith, and the light of hope all on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3907 75th Anniversary Special
item.itunes:subtitle: Celebration, History, Inspirational, Evangelism, Mission Work, Faith, God’s Provision, Gratitude, Li
item.itunes:summary: Unshackled is the longest-running audio program ever produced, with nearly 4,000 true stories about people encountering God. Ever wonder why this audio drama has lasted so long when so many other radio dramas have faded into history? You’ll find out why on our 75th Anniversary Special on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3906 Thanks But No Thanks (Giving)
item.itunes:subtitle: Thanksgiving, Holiday, Faith, Freedom, Gratitude, Socialism, Family Conflict, Ideology, Reconciliati
item.itunes:summary: What really happened at the very first Thanksgiving? It wasn’t just corn and kindness — it was a battle of ideas about freedom, faith, and survival. This holiday, one family learns that history still speaks, as their own Thanksgiving table becomes the scene of conflict… and redemption. Join us for this special episode of Unshackled!

item.title: 3905 Rudy Peterson Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Nominal Faith, Trials, Train Accident, Inspirational, Miracle, Mission Work, Evangelism)
item.itunes:summary: Rudy Peterson had a train run over his legs, but that was only the beginning of his remarkable story. Don’t miss the heartwarming testimony of how he helped others even so…another true dramatization coming soon from the Classic files of Unshackled!

item.title: 3904 Troop Train Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: WWII, Military, Death Faith, Eternity, Assurance of Salvation, Evangelism, Inspirational
item.itunes:summary: During World War II, a steam engine barreled across the southern states carrying new cadets. Meanwhile, Greg and Keith ponder what deaths will come to them in the war. Is peace possible in the face of danger? Find out in this classic true story, The Troop Train, coming soon on UNSHACKLED!

item.title: 3903 Horatio Spafford
item.itunes:subtitle: Chicago Fire, Loss/Grief, Tragedy, Healing, Peace, Faith through Suffering, Inspirational, Mission w
item.itunes:summary: Journey with Horatio and Anna Spafford through unthinkable tragedy — and discover the true story behind the beloved hymn “It Is Well With My Soul.” Don’t miss this powerful dramatization of loss, faith, and the peace that passes all understanding… on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3902 James Lebron Lockhart (PG)
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Addiction, Pornography, Sexual Sin, Guilt, Assurance of Salvation, Military
item.itunes:summary: James Lebron Lockhart survived physical, mental, and sexual abuse only to become a slave to pornography and a warped view of women. What would it take for him to be satisfied with his life? Find out on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3901 Joe O'Connor
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Drinking, Loneliness, Emptiness, Co-dependency, Divorce
item.itunes:summary: A young man spent his days playing guitar and riding a train back and forth, looking at scenery. He felt lost, but would he ever reach the destination he was aiming for? You’ll see as we bring you the true story of Joe O’Conner, soon, on Unshackled!

item.title: 3900 Frank Landrey Classic
item.itunes:summary: Raised in a family steeped in gambling and liquor, Frank Landrey learns card tricks at a young age — mastering how to spot the art of deception to win big. But would dabbling in the world of gambling and loan-sharking lead to a life-threatening situation? Find out in this true story of redemption, all on the next episode of Unshackled!

item.title: 3899 Marshall Brooks
item.itunes:summary: He was a drinking, fighting motorcyclist who carried a gun everywhere. Today he carries something entirely different. Don’t miss the remarkable story of the transformation of Marshall Brooks, another true testimony coming soon on Unshackled!

item.title: 3898 Ashley Mariela Kovach (PG)
item.itunes:summary: She was a homeless child that nobody wanted, neglected and abused, yet today Ashley Mariela Kovach has joy and purpose. Don’t miss her inspiring testimony, another true dramatization coming soon on “Unshackled!”

item.title: 3897 Fred Kelley
item.itunes:summary: You've heard stories of people addicted to alcohol or drugs or porn. But what if you’re addicted to food? Do you see it as not that big-a-deal? Fred Kelley’s addiction to food proved to be a matter of life and death. Would he survive? Find out on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3896 Jean Schneider Classic
item.itunes:summary: How does a widow with eight minor children survive when she’s suddenly all alone? And how will her faith in God shape the lives of future generations? You'll hear the answer in the classic true story of Jean Schneider on the next UNSHACKLED!

item.title: 3895 Paul Lapsley
item.itunes:subtitle: Addiction, Boys’ Homes, Loss/Grief, Resentment, Depression, Alcoholism, Workaholic, Abandonment, Sur
item.itunes:summary: Placed in an institution at the age of 11, Paul Lapsley believed his dad’s promise to come back someday and get him. Would he ever be reunited with his father or would he be adopted by the ultimate Father? Find out in this compelling true story coming soon on UNSHACKLED!

item.title: 3894 Gabriel "Dub" Fulton
item.itunes:subtitle: Death, Loss/Grief, Bitterness, Vengeance, American South, Forgiveness, Surrender, Inspirational
item.itunes:summary: Dub Fulton was consumed with feelings of vengeance at the neighbor who took his father’s life. But would exacting revenge end up digging two graves — one for himself? Find out in this compelling true story…all on the next Unshackled!

item.title: 3893 Labor Day Special
item.itunes:subtitle: Labor Day, Weariness, Disobedience, Debt, Addiction, Disabilities, Chronic Illness, Restlessness
item.itunes:summary: In this special Labor Day episode, follow the residents of an apartment building as they wrestle with pain, debt, and despair, searching for an answer to their weariness. Could the simple faith of a young girl’s song be the beginning of hope in the face of their heaviest burdens. Find out on the next Unshackled!

item.itunes:subtitle: Works Based, Depression, Sexual Sin, Infidelity, New Age, Forgiveness, Adoption
item.itunes:summary: She married the prince she’d always dreamed about, but Kay Henderson didn’t know the “Prince of Peace,” and her marriage crumbled. Don’t miss the remarkable story of their restoration, another true dramatization coming soon on Unshackled!

item.title: 3824 Trey Dawson Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Divorce, Addiction, Second Chances)
item.itunes:summary: Trey grew up in a troubled home where his parents divorced when he was young. By eighth grade he was experimenting with drugs, acting out at school, and bouncing from one juvenile detention to another. Eventually his drug addiction lands him in the hospital with a near fatal heart infection. While serving a four-year prison sentence he begins to face the reality of the choice he’s made.

item.title: 3823 The Sinner's Prayer (Jack Farthing)

item.title: 3595 Ruth Ott
item.itunes:subtitle: Divorce, Purity In Dating, Insecurity, Search For Purpose
item.itunes:summary: Dr Ruth Ott was born in a hospital broom closet in Holland. Besides her unusual birth, her home life was full of anxiety. Growing up, she was surrounded by arguments and confusion. Although Ruth knew that God had a plan for her life, the constant changes and turmoil she was forced to endure left her searching for the road map that would show her the way to peace and fulfillment. Hear her heartwarming true story on UNSHACKLED!

item.title: 3587 Rick
item.itunes:subtitle: Depression, Loneliness, Same-sex Attraction
item.itunes:summary: Growing up in a strict household of rules and exact consequences, Rick was often on edge— constantly walking on eggshells. Over time, he developed self-doubt, loneliness, and even suicidal thoughts. What’s more, he was burdened by a heavy secret, buried inside like a thorn in his flesh. Do you think it’s possible for a lifetime of heartache to one day transform into a life of authentic joy? Find out as we uncover Rick’s true story all on the next UNSHACKLED!

Though she struggled through several failed marriages, God was with her every step of the way, just waiting for her to notice the forgiveness and healing available through Him. item.title: 3542 Matthew Burchard Classic

item.itunes:summary: Growing up, Matthew struggled with his self-worth. Because of his insecurities, he turned to drugs and alcohol to help fit into the popular drug culture in the late 1960’s. After an awful experience and run-ins with the law, Matthew hits rock bottom, and turns to a friend who offers a new way to live. item.title: 3316 Art Husfelt Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Religion, Alcoholism
item.itunes:summary: Driving and drinking—they don’t mix. Art Husfelt found that out when he killed two of his own family members in a car crash. Art was eventually separated from his wife and children by a court order. Homeless and jobless, he heard for the first time about the difference Christ could make. It’s an amazing true story, and you’ll hear it all when you join us on UNSHACKLED!

item.title: 3128 Doug & Debbie Kollar Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Navy
item.itunes:summary: Doug, who already lives in fantasy when he goes to college, becomes a drug-addict and drops out rather than flunk. He joins the Navy to avoid the draft and continues to use drugs. But he fears becoming a heroine junkie. A believer witnesses and takes him to church where Doug prays for salvation and quits using. He meets Debbie who has joined the Navy to escape foster care and who drinks to be accepted. Doug leads her to Christ and they marry, called to become missionaries.

item.title: 3127 Robert Cunningham Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Depression, Drugs, Air Force
item.itunes:summary: Bob’s depression starts when his fiancée breaks their engagement. He drinks too much, then smokes pot and begins dealing with a buddy. A jealous girlfriend turns him in and he loses his career in the air force. A lawyer helps him avoid prison but not the prison of despair. He takes anti-depressants until a friend gets saved and tells him about Jesus. After reading the Bible, Bob cries out to the Lord, then goes to Pacific Garden Mission where he serves as a counselor.

item.title: 3126 Scott Stinar
item.itunes:subtitle: Pornography, Jail, Religion
item.itunes:summary: Scott hungers for answers to life’s questions but his father is 40 years older and doesn’t know how to communicate well. Addicted to pornography at a young age, Scott hides his secret until he breaks the law at age 20, ruining a career in the air force. He spends 80 days in jail, during which his dad dies of cancer. A pastor visits and Scott goes to his church where he hears the gospel and surrenders his life – and his addictions to Christ. Now married with four children.

item.title: 3125 Beverly Crull
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Cerebral Palsy, Mental Illness
item.itunes:summary: Beverly’s parents are drunks who don’t want her when she’s born unexpectedly and prematurely with cerebral palsy. Her grandmother tells her about Jesus. Her drunken father beats her and her brothers abuse her also. Strangers violate her and leave her for dead. Sent to a girl’s home, she runs away and plans suicide until God speaks to her heart. A rescue mission counselor takes her in and teaches her about God. Beverly receives Christ, then falls in love with John who stands by her even when she goes to a state mental hospital. They marry and she witnesses to her family.

item.title: 3124 Jackson Chien-Ming Lee
item.itunes:subtitle: Chinese, Businessman, Occult
item.itunes:summary: Jackson grows up in Taiwan, excels in school and goes to Louisiana to get a PhD in chemistry. He starts an import business and does so well that he gives up his research. But his marriage suffers and he and his wife divorce. He moves his business to L.A., suffers health problems and tries Chi, breath-control to influence fate. Spirits of darkness oppress his life and he withdraws. A Christian banker shares the gospel and Jackson reaches out to Jesus, Who transforms his life. Jackson goes to seminary, marries Janeffer and they are now missionaries to China.

item.title: 3123 Charles Svoboda
item.itunes:subtitle: WWII, Atheism, Heroism, Reconciliation
item.itunes:summary: Charles’ father dies of alcoholism, so his mother raises her children alone. Born again when he’s in high school, she persuades him to attend a tent revival where he and his fiancée, Eleanor are saved. They marry and Charles fights in World War II in North Africa and Anzio. After the war he attends Bible school and becomes a counselor to pastors and churches having conflict. He starts a ministry of reconciliation where he still counsels by phone at age 90.

item.title: 3122 Cathie DuLaney Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Promiscuity, Abortion, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Cathie marries a third time, a man who rescues her from an abuser; but she cannot be faithful, and the third marriage ends. She uses cocaine, becomes a dealer and police arrest her. Sentenced to seven years in prison, she has Bible study with a mentor from the outside but Cathie isn’t saved. When she’s released, she goes on a cruise where she meets Christians who help lead her to Christ. Now ministering to women in prison.

item.title: 3121 Cathie DuLaney Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Promiscuity, Abortion, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: Cathie and her sister are late-in-life babies whose parents send them to church but otherwise let them do as they please. Both girls run wild, smoking, drinking and sleeping around. Cathie runs away several times with different boys, marries and divorces and uses drugs. She thinks she’s a Christian but the first part ends as she gets her second divorce and second abortion.

item.title: 3120 Norma Landsberg Sequel
item.itunes:subtitle: Coma, Foster Family, Disabled
item.itunes:summary: Norma is raised by foster parents but sees and loves her blood mother. Mischievous but determined, she goes to Bible college, then visits her dad in Oregon where she is bitten by mosquitoes and contracts a disease that puts her in a coma for seven weeks. Her foster mother cares for Norma, who is unable to speak, walk or even swallow. After 13 years she walks and learns to talk some, becoming a witness for God.

item.title: 3119 “Jennie”
item.itunes:subtitle: Depression, Kidney, Failure, Fear
item.itunes:summary: “Jennie” grows up with recurring high fevers from a bad kidney. She slips into depression after graduation from high school and quits her job. Unable to talk with a psychiatrist, he hospitalizes her and gives her shock therapy. When the insurance dries up, she is put in the state hospital. There she cries out to God who miraculously heals her. She meets and marries Harry, but after their son is born, her mother-in-law’s control makes Jennie ill again until she learns to stand up for herself.

item.title: 3118 Meritan Baraku Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Albanian, Civil Disorder, Radio Station
item.itunes:summary: As a pastor, Tani’s dad carries his sermons to remote Albanian villages that have no radio or TV. He dreams of starting a radio station to reach people. Just as he gets the station started, he has a heart attack and nearly dies. Efti comes to work for the station and she and Tani plan to marry. Tani’s father takes a month-long trip to the U.S. and dies of a heart attack. Tani loses faith in God, but believers help him see God’s plan. Fulfilling his father’s dream, Tani manages the radio station that now reaches remote Albanian villages.

item.title: 3117 Meritan Baraku Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Albanian, Greed, Communism
item.itunes:summary: Tani and his parents live with his grandparents in Albania, suffering under Communism, which falls in 1990. Missionaries come, preaching on the streets where Tani’s dad exhibits his paintings. They give him Bibles in the Albanian language, and Tani’s dad receives Christ while reading the Gospel of John. He stops painting to evangelize. Naïve Albanians fall into financial pyramid schemes that fail, leading to chaos. The first part ends as armed thieves try to steal missionaries’ cars.

item.title: 3116 Ray Comfort Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Atheism, Surfer, New Zealander
item.itunes:summary: After he leads his surfing buddies to Christ, Ray discovers that they are falling away and dying from drug use. Ray writes tracts and books, discovering the all-important truth: knowing God’s Law before grace can be comprehended. He begins a ministry that he still pursues in the U.S.

item.title: 3115 Ray Comfort Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Jewish, Surfer, New Zealand
item.itunes:summary: Ray’s mother is Jewish, his father a Gentile. Ray is ADHD and discovers surfing when he’s 13. He lives for the sport. After graduation he works in a bank where he meets Sue and they marry. He has everything; but death awakens him to the futility of life. A surfer friend leads him to Christ, and Ray enthusiastically makes converts of his mother and buddies. Zeal without knowledge. The first part ends as one of his “converts” dies from a drug overdose and Ray vows to help others.

item.title: 3114 John Wagner Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Rejection, Alcoholism, Skid Row, PGM Convert
item.itunes:summary: John’s mother dies and his mean stepmother beats him so he runs away at nine, linking up with Steve, a hobo who teaches him to drink. At thirteen John goes it alone till age 17 when loneliness drives him to his dad, an alcoholic who rejects him. John spends 28 years on Skid Row in Chicago, till he comes to Pacific Garden Mission where he’s saved.

At thirteen John goes it alone till age 17 when loneliness drives him to his dad, an alcoholic who rejects him. John spends 28 years on Skid Row in Chicago, till he comes to Pacific Garden Mission where he’s saved.
item.content:encoded: John’s mother dies and his mean stepmother beats him so he runs away at nine, linking up with Steve, a hobo who teaches him to drink. At thirteen John goes it alone till age 17 when loneliness drives him to his dad, an alcoholic who rejects him. John spends 28 years on Skid Row in Chicago, till he comes to Pacific Garden Mission where he’s saved.

item.title: 3113 Charles Cravey Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Poverty, Delinquency
item.itunes:summary: Charles grows up on a farm in Georgia. At 13 he and some friends break into places and end up in jail. His probation officer helps him. Also at 13 he and friends form a band. His dad dies of a brain tumor when Charles is 15. One of the boys gets saved and drops out of the band. Charles is bitter but goes to a Bible study, then prays for salvation at 18. He graduates, trains to be a medical technician in Atlanta, plays in a bar then quits the school—called to ministry. Married and still a pastor, he continues to write gospel songs and serve the Lord in missions.

item.title: 3112 Tom Geremia Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Divorce, Religion, Israel Trip
item.itunes:summary: Tom leads his cousin astray, then tries to make amends after he’s saved. The cousin rejects Christ because his parents’ divorce leaves him bitter. The cousin loves to travel and goes to Israel with Tom’s church. There he witnesses the prayers of a parishioner and God’s answer; and he longs for inclusion. The parishioner leads the cousin to Christ and God answers his prayer at the Garden of Gethsemane.

item.title: 3111 Tom Geremia Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Violence, Drugs, Religion, Unshackled Convert
item.itunes:summary: Tom grows up going to church with his family, but his older brother dominates him and he learns to fight. He also has a fascination with fire and firecrackers, setting a dumpster on fire when he’s 12. He has many risky encounters as a teenager … gets a job in a grocery store and steals to buy marijuana, which he denies when he’s confronted. He finally quits his job and becomes a security guard at night. He listens to “Unshackled!” and prays for salvation as the first part ends.

item.title: 3110 Randy Weyeneth
item.itunes:subtitle: Divorce, Marine, Navigator
item.itunes:summary: Randy’s family is prosperous but godless. They never go to church. At 16 he’s invited to a youth camp where he hears the Gospel and prays to receive Christ. In college he is discipled, graduates and joins the Marines where he becomes an officer. He marries and they have three daughters; but his wife commits adultery with a friend while he’s stationed overseas. She divorces him and he gets custody of the girls. For ten years he is a single parent, faithful to God. Then he meets Sandy in ministry and they marry after a courtship that makes their love worth the wait.

item.title: 3109 Sandy Weyeneth
item.itunes:subtitle: Religion, Ridicule and Singleness
item.itunes:summary: The middle child in a large religious family in Indiana, Sandy is mocked for staying pure in high school. Anxious and withdrawn, in college she rooms with a woman who gently leads her to Christ. When she gains the courage to tell her parents, they question the radical change in her. After graduating, she stays with the ministry Navigators, working in Peoria and then Colorado Springs, where she remains single. At 39 she helps the ministry with a conference where she meets Randy and they begin a long-distance relationship. Her story ends as he’s about to tell her his testimony.

item.title: 3108 Rob Rytaran Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Forgiveness, Infidelity, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: After his salvation, Rob throws away the alcohol and drugs, and his wife Gail is enraged. She comes and goes, taking and leaving their daughter, then gets pregnant by someone else, but he accepts and loves the 2nd daughter. Their marriage ends when she slashes his clothes and stabs him. She takes everything. He tries to understand but turns from the faith after the divorce. Finally, he repents and gets custody of the girls, meets “Rose” and they marry. He witnesses to his dad before his dad dies. Rob is still faithful.

item.title: 3107 Rob Rytaran Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Infidelity, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: The oldest of 11 children, Rob learns at age 16 that his dad is not his real father. His mother admits that she wanted to abort him. His parents trick him into working to save money for a car, then take the car he buys. He gets even by exposing their dishonesty at work. He gets his own home, but drinks & does drugs, falls into depression and lives with an unstable girl, much like his mother. When she gets pregnant, he marries her, is miserable but loves their daughter. He hears the gospel at work, and the first part ends as he prays for salvation.

item.title: 3106 Marrion Furr Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Nurse
item.itunes:summary: Marion grows up in Christian home but turns from the Lord as a teenager. She becomes a surgical nurse but begins drinking after graduation and cannot stop. When alcohol affects her professionally, she resigns from nursing, tries counseling and A.A. but cannot quit. Her mother continues to pray for her. Marion meets Jimmy, another drunk and they marry. After five years and nearly dying of alcoholism, Marion prays to Christ. Jimmy surrenders after five months. She returns to nursing at the county hospital that saved her life.

item.title: 3105 Butch Kopak
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Homeless, Blind
item.itunes:summary: Homeless by choice at 15, Butch manages to elude reform school, unlike his two older brothers. His mother tries but cannot help him. His older brother dies from drinking-induced pneumonia. Panhandling, he meets a woman who sends him and friends to a mission. He leaves, then returns nine times. His drunkenness leads to crime, and he is stabbed in the stomach but lives. His mother goes to the mission, is saved and prays for him. Finally, he is given one last chance and surrenders to Christ. While blind, he gets his GED, college and master’s degrees.

item.title: 3104 Karen Noe
item.itunes:subtitle: Abandonment, Alcohol, Rejection
item.itunes:summary: Karen’s father is an alcoholic who beats her mother. He abandons them when she’s four, and she spends her life longing for a reconciliation. He wants nothing to do with them even when he’s dying. Karen’s grandmother loves the Lord and takes her to church, but Karen becomes an alcoholic during a first, failed marriage. She weds Bud and they adopt children. Working at a crisis pregnancy center, Karen gets saved, but her addiction ends only when she surrenders to Christ six months later. By phone, she leads her father in a prayer of salvation. Still at the pregnancy center.

item.title: 3103 Jerry Beaver
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Accidents, Rock Music
item.itunes:summary: Growing up, Jerry comes between his stepdad and Mom when they fight. He becomes a brawler as a teenager, drinking, crashing his car while drunk. He plays the bass guitar in a small band, wants to be a rock star and writes songs. Looking for lyrics, he searches the Bible, then reads Revelation and is scared. He quits drinking, reads the Bible and goes to a coworker’s church, where he is saved. He becomes a soul-winner and goes to Bible college. On a trip home, his mother confesses that she tried to abort him. Now a pastor.

item.title: 3102 Bruce Burling
item.itunes:subtitle: Chippewa Indian, Drugs, Suicidal
item.itunes:summary: His alcoholic mother abandons the family when Bruce is eight, and his dad puts him in an orphanage for two years. Bruce has a speech problem. When he goes home, his sister and he break into churches. He goes to juvenile lockup till he’s 16, where he learns to work hard. Back home he marries reluctantly at 21. His wife and he pray with some Christians, but salvation would come later. Their marriage breaks up because of her infidelity, Bruce swallows drain cleaner. His life is spared but he loses his stomach and esophagus. He consumes alcohol in his feeding tube. Finally, he comes to Christ and now ministers to other addicts.

item.title: 3101 Fenton McCahill
item.itunes:subtitle: Adoption, Rejection, Parental Failure
item.itunes:summary: Fenton is adopted from an orphanage at age four. His new dad abandons them when Fenton is 11. He fails two grades: first and fourth, but he’s saved at camp when he’s 17. He serves the Lord eagerly. After the army he marries Carol. They go to Bible college, have two children, and he teaches and stays busy in Christian service. His daughter turns from the faith taught to her. Fenton resigns from the pastorate but becomes a chaplain. He and Carol continue to serve the Lord in unique ways.

item.title: 3100 Stephen Keel
item.itunes:subtitle: Atheism, Drugs, Successful
item.itunes:summary: Disillusioned with religion, Steve becomes an atheist. He enjoys academic success and moves to Alaska for adventures. Returns home with wife, Nancy, and they have a daughter. After Nancy is saved, he decides to leave but her pastor intrigues him with unusual faith acts, so his plans change. They travel to a retreat to pursue the validity of another one of Nancy’s dreams about an earthquake. Steve drives a pastor to a city near the retreat. On the way, the pastor shares the gospel with him throughout the four-hour trip. Steve resists. But at the retreat he prays for salvation, an insincere prayer. On the third day he yields to Christ, an earthquake occurs in his heart. Served many years as layman; now in ministry.

item.title: 3099 Nancy Keel
item.itunes:subtitle: Occult, Father's Suicide, Search For Truth
item.itunes:summary: An only child, Nancy’s dad commits suicide months after she marries Steve. They are in Alaska as teachers. She has stomach pains and fears death, especially after she has several dreams. Desperately, she prays, and feels that God took away the pain. Wanting to learn God’s name, Nancy studies all the religions, but none of them have a God who talks to His people. A woman suggests she read the Psalms. She discovers the Jewish God who talks to His people. In another dream her life is in danger, and she calls the name of every god she can remember to save her. When she calls out to Jesus, she wakes up. Thereafter, she comes to repentance and faith. The first part ends as Steve prepares to leave because of her love for Jesus.

item.title: 3098 Mark Zinke
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Violence
item.itunes:summary: Drinking is prevalent in Mark’s family of nine children; talking isn’t. When Mark uses his dad’s van without permission, his older brother beat him up. Mark drinks too much and drives his snowmobile into a semi-truck, nearly dying; speech impaired. After recovering he goes back to drinking, his mother uses tough love and he goes to rehab in Chicago. There he prays and Christians mentor him until he is saved. He agonizes about turning in his brother to police for car theft, but his mom insisted, so he does. He becomes an aggressive soul winner, goes to Bible college and marries Julie. Now in ministry.

item.title: 3097 Lurene “Penny” Wilkins
item.itunes:subtitle: Pre-Mature Birth, Murder, Near-Death Accident
item.itunes:summary: Penny is born prematurely but survives only to suffer double pneumonia at six. The family suffers through the Depression, but Penny goes to Bible college where she meets George. They marry, graduate and go into ministry. Four children are born, but the youngest is murdered at 19. After George dies in 1989, Penny serves with missionaries in Mexico. James Wilkins is a guest speaker at a meeting, and she prays that he would desire marriage to her one day. She nearly dies in a car accident with her sister but survives and continues to pray for James. They marry in 1996, and now they serve the Lord together.

item.title: 3096 – James Wilkins – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Abortion Survivor, Self-Pity
item.itunes:summary: After his father dies, James’ mother goes to a nearby church. James goes, then quits, then returns and is saved. He begins witnessing to his family, and a brother is saved. But his brother switches churches, saying the nearby one is flawed. Ultimately, James agrees and goes to his brother’s church where he surrenders to ministry. Before his mother dies, she reveals her abortion attempt, and James struggles to deal with this new revelation. James discovers his birth certificate that says, “Infant Wilkins”. He and his brothers serve the Lord in proclaiming the liberating message of the gospel and also to present the eternal hope of God to other survivors of abortion.

Before his mother dies, she reveals her abortion attempt, and James struggles to deal with this new revelation. James discovers his birth certificate that says, “Infant Wilkins”. He and his brothers serve the Lord in proclaiming the liberating message of the gospel and also to present the eternal hope of God to other survivors of abortion.
item.content:encoded: After his father dies, James’ mother goes to a nearby church. James goes, then quits, then returns and is saved. He begins witnessing to his family, and a brother is saved. But his brother switches churches, saying the nearby one is flawed. Ultimately, James agrees and goes to his brother’s church where he surrenders to ministry. Before his mother dies, she reveals her abortion attempt, and James struggles to deal with this new revelation. James discovers his birth certificate that says, “Infant Wilkins”. He and his brothers serve the Lord in proclaiming the liberating message of the gospel and also to present the eternal hope of God to other survivors of abortion.

item.title: 3095 James Wilkins – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abortion Survivor, WWII, Stubborn
item.itunes:summary: Jim’s father is crippled in an accident at work, and his overwrought mother tries to abort her pregnancy: James. Weeks prior to the accident, his 14-year-old aunt is abused by three men, who are shot and killed by the girl’s brother. Jim’s grandmother prays and Jim is born. The family struggles in poverty until World War II. Jim grows up, stubborn and difficult. He becomes a sports nut. His dad reads the Bible but won’t go to church. His brothers return from the war. The first part ends when Jim’s favorite brother is killed in an accident and he is left wondering what really happened to his brother in death.

item.title: 3094 James Guerra – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Imprisonment, Rejection, Reconciliation
item.itunes:summary: James admits his crimes to the parole board and serves three years of a 16-year-sentence. He reconciles with his mother, works for a non-profit ministry and is promoted several times; but his church doesn’t welcome him, so he reaches out to them. He gets a B.A. degree and then proceeds to get an M.B.A degree and serves with the ministry that helped him in prison. Today he’s a chaplain, married and the Director of Correctional Services for the State of Texas.

Today he’s a chaplain, married and the Director of Correctional Services for the State of Texas.

item.title: 3093 James Guerra – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Parents’ Divorce, Gangs, Drugs, Violence
item.itunes:summary: His parents divorce when James is five and he never sees his father again. Feeling that his mother has rejected him, he turns to drugs and gangs. His mother takes him to a Curandero, a witch doctor but James gets addicted to heroin, burglarizing houses to support his habit. Violence reigns. His mother keeps him out of prison when he’s 17, but after more crimes, James goes to prison at 21. During his second term, he read the Bible to impress the parole board but discovers the love of God and is saved as the first part ends.

item.title: 3092 Richard Frantz
item.itunes:subtitle: Veteran, Missionary
item.itunes:summary: During combat Richard vows to serve God, but afterward slides sideways until his parents’ prayers intervene. He goes to Bible college, meets Jean and they marry. They become missionaries to Indians in Mexico, then start various ministries to Spanish-speakers in Texas. Jean writes Bible doctrine books before she dies in 2008. Richard is still in ministry.

They become missionaries to Indians in Mexico, then start various ministries to Spanish-speakers in Texas. Jean writes Bible doctrine books before she dies in 2008. Richard is still in ministry.

They become missionaries to Indians in Mexico, then start various ministries to Spanish-speakers in Texas. Jean writes Bible doctrine books before she dies in 2008. Richard is still in ministry.

item.title: 3091 “Randy”
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Homeless, Thief, Illiterate
item.itunes:summary: Randy survives several life-threatening incidents as a child; then his father leaves the family of eight children. He works to help from the age of seven, but slips into drinking and drugs. Mostly illiterate, he works hard but spends everything on cocaine. Becoming homeless, he and a friend turn to robbery. Randy is caught and goes to jail where he learns to read the Bible and meets Christ. Released, he graduates from seminary, marries and then slips back into drug use. He’s arrested but God restores him in prison. He is a chaplain and counselor to addicts before he dies of cancer.

item.title: 3090 “Dion”
item.itunes:subtitle: Parent’s Divorce, Bullying, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: Dion's parents’ divorce and his mother takes him to Canada, her homeland. A drunk named Joe moves in and belittles and bullies Dion, who has learned to smoke pot with cousins. Caught shoplifting at 14, Dion is kicked out of his mom’s home at 16. He can’t keep jobs because of his drug use. He’s arrested for armed robbery and is sentenced to a year in prison, then loses his girlfriend. A neighbor gets him to church and Dion prays for salvation at home. He backslides badly because he doesn’t go to church and grow in faith. After seven years the prodigal son returns. Now married and in ministry.

item.title: 3089 Michael Vijayakumar
item.itunes:subtitle: Politician, Violence, Suicidal
item.itunes:summary: Michael goes to a Christian boarding school where he doesn’t study hard and misbehaves. When he is 24 he marries Pushpa who loves the Lord and prays for Michael, especially after he goes into politics, leading a band of fierce bodyguards. Factional fighting leads to bloodshed and murder and jail for a year. After 14 years of fighting, Michael cannot sleep and is suicidal. His wife takes him to a pastor who leads him to Christ. Now in ministry.

item.title: 3088 Tom Ray Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Counterfeiter, Mafia
item.itunes:summary: Tom is arrested for counterfeiting money and his wife and sons bear the brunt of the shame. Hit-men are hired to kill him because he knows too much. He decides to work with federal agents and goes into the Witness Protection Program, exposing the mob. A bomb explodes before one trial but Tom continues to testify against the underworld, bringing 36 men to justice. Tom is given leniency for his help. His sons go into ministry and persuade Tom to tell his story to help others.

item.title: 3087 Tom Ray Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Gambling, World War II
item.itunes:summary: Tom learns the art of salesmanship as a youth helping his father at auctions; but he also learns to drink and gamble. He quits high school to join the Navy in World War II, but returns to finish. He joins the Air Force during the Korean War, meets Bobbi and they marry. A salesman, he is gone a lot and falls in with shady characters. They rig poker games and Tom is nearly killed several times. Then he starts counterfeiting money. Meanwhile, his wife and sons are saved. The first part ends when Tom prays for salvation.

item.title: 3084 Chris Brosnan
item.itunes:subtitle: Fear of Death, Pornography
item.itunes:summary: As a boy, Chris dreams about a grave swallowing him and fears death. His dad takes him to the Catholic church, but he doesn’t understand. Prideful, he doesn’t make friends easily and is accepted by the wrong crowd who expose him to rock music, video games and pornography. His parents divorce. Then a young man at work tells him the gospel and he prays for salvation. He witnesses to his dad, who is saved and his mum who rejects the gospel. After graduating from Bible college, he is now in ministry.

item.title: 3083 Paul Licciardi
item.itunes:subtitle: Juvenile Prison, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: Paul grows up without his father but around a drunken uncle. As a child he hears a preacher talk about hell and is terrified. Still, he drinks and steals and ends up in juvenile prison, escapes and goes to maximum juvenile lock up. He drops out of school in the 7th grade, works and drinks; loses his license to a DUI. He meets Cordie and they marry, but he can’t quit drinking. He keeps seeing a Bible verse in granite on a church and finally calls on the name of Lord and is saved. Now a pastor in Texas.

item.title: 3082 “Ginger”
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Stripper
item.itunes:summary: Coming from a church that was weak on Biblical doctrine, Ginger has no guidance. She drinks, uses drugs and sleeps around. She marries a drunk and she’s unfaithful, takes a job as a stripper and then works as a “dancer” in a men’s club. She divorces, meets Gary and seduces him into drug use. He becomes a dealer. Her best friend, another dancer, is murdered and Ginger quits the clubs and hard drugs. She reads the Bible. Gary is arrested, rededicates his life to Christ in prison and they marry when he’s released.

item.title: 3081 James Blair
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Accidents, Teen Ministry
item.itunes:summary: James, one of ten children, never goes to church, quits school at 14 and learns to drink with his brothers. He has many accidents and nearly dies. He marries Wanda, whose mother dislikes his drinking but takes him to revival where he is saved. He makes restitution for stealing and serves the LORD the rest of his life. His wife leaves once but returns. He and daughter, Jean, start a ministry to teens that is still going strong. After Wanda’s death, James writes Christian articles for a newspaper. He writes until 2009 he dies of cancer at age 96.

item.title: 3080 Jeffrey Schmidt
item.itunes:subtitle: Rejection, Abuse, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: Jeff is the youngest of six, and his mom and dad neglect and abuse him as a child. Poor, hungry and beaten, he goes to school feeling worthless. He works in his dad’s auto repair shop at 14, builds a fast car that helps his self-image. After high school his parents secretly divorce and sell the house. His mom writes a letter rejecting Jeff. He becomes a drunk, wrecks many cars and motorcycles, even hits a train but survives. Finally, he hears a radio preacher and is saved. He marries Jackie. Before his father dies, Jeff and he are reconciled.

item.title: 3079 Robert Saler – Part 3
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionary to India, Rest Homes
item.itunes:summary: Robert supports missionaries in India before he goes there as a missionary, paying his own way. There he builds a prayer tower, a children’s home and digs a well for various villages. On his second trip a cobra bites him, but he continues his preaching and feeding people. On his third trip he gets cholera. His fourth trip is his last. Then he meets and marries Kathy.

item.title: 3078 Robert Saler – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Korean War, Rest Homes, Ministry to India
item.itunes:summary: Robert and three buddies escape a North Korean prison camp. After his discharge Robert runs a catering business that helps when he opens a Christian rest home. He takes in his sister’s children, witnesses to his guests and fends off false accusations of misconduct in the rest homes. The first part ends as he is helping missionaries in India and bringing a couple from India to help in his rest homes.

item.title: 3077 Robert Saler – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Drunken Father, Depression, Korean War
item.itunes:summary: While shoe-shining in Chicago at age 7, Robert stops at a tent revival and is saved. He takes his dad to PGM but his dad continues drinking. A brick-layer, he falls from a seven-story building and is killed, leaving Robert’s mother with 5 children. Robert works to help the family but continues taking Bible classes and commits to being a missionary to India. He’s drafted after World War II ends, serves in Korea where the first part ends when he is shot in the leg and captured.

item.title: 3076 Donna Bossert
item.itunes:subtitle: Neglect, Forgiveness
item.itunes:summary: Donna’s dad suffers seizures, so her mom takes her to California, then leaves her with strangers while she works. Donna is neglected and abused in one home after another. At 15 she finally lives with her mom who drinks. Donna meets her dad who takes her to church where she is saved. She marries Allen and they have two sons. When her mother needs help after having a seizure, Donna overcomes retaliatory feelings and looks after her mother and an aunt. Both are saved before dying, and her mother witnesses in her nursing home.

item.title: 3075 Christmas Special Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Prophecy & Scripture
item.itunes:summary: We go back in time to hear prophetic scripture from the Old Testament that foretell the coming of Messiah according to God’s planning and foreknowledge. Also, the disciples and Mary quote passages from the New Testament that reveal how Jesus fulfilled those prophesies. The script ends as the announcer quotes some scriptures yet to come.

item.title: 3074 Stephen McPherson Sequel – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Black Missionary in New Guinea
item.itunes:summary: Stephen goes to seminary and then is called to New Guinea where he has many adventures teaching physical education to natives and missionary kids in school. Returning home his church sends him to linguistic school where he struggles. His beloved grandmother dies and his brother is hospitalized, near death. After two years his brother dies and Stephen preaches at his funeral.

item.title: 3073 Stephen McPherson Classic Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Alcohol, Track
item.itunes:summary: Raised by his maternal grandmother and mama, Stephen prays at 12 but fear of peer rejection leads him to backslide. A fast runner, he excels at track in high school. But he steals and is caught; then racial tension and prejudice keep him unnerved. He hears the gospel but refuses to accept Christ. He goes to college but quits the track team, smokes pot and drinks too much. A man shares the gospel with him and he prays for salvation. He reads the Bible but still waffles. The first part ends as he makes a commitment to follow Christ.

item.title: 3072 Craig & Lauri Hartman – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Messianic Jew, Religion
item.itunes:summary: Craig continues to study scripture with Mark until their son is born. Afterward he and Lauri meet for Bible study with Mark. They even go to a church service. Then Craig’s beloved grandfather dies and he is too devastated to think about eternity. Mark finally calls and confronts Craig, who makes a decision for Christ. Lauri, too, is saved. Craig begins reaching out to other Jews through churches, and eventually leaves his law profession to a full-time ministry to Jews and Christians.

Craig begins reaching out to other Jews through churches, and eventually leaves his law profession to a full-time ministry to Jews and Christians.

item.title: 3071 Craig & Lauri Hartman – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Messianic Jew, Religion
item.itunes:summary: Craig wants answers and doesn’t get them in Hebrew School, so he drops out, then wants to make Bar Mitzvah and does, thanks to a rabbi’s help. His parents divorce but his maternal grandpa upholds him. He meets Lauri, goes to college and they marry while he’s in law school. She’s Catholic but they agree to study the Bible. When a colleague at work tells Craig about Jesus and points out the flaws in Catholic teaching, Lauri becomes an apostate as the first part ends.

item.title: 3070 David Lemmond – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Violence, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: David is arrested for stabbing his brother who survives and even goes to court on David’s behalf. He quits drinking but after six months resumes, worse than ever. His marriage threatened, he quits drinking again but still sells drugs. Then he hears a radio preacher and goes to church. While reading a book by the radio preacher, he understands Christ’s sacrifice and is born again. He witnesses to his brother who goes to a Christian rehab where he is saved. Then his brother dies of cancer. Still faithful, David goes to college.

item.title: 3069 David Lemmond – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Violence, Drugs, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: David’s parents divorce when he is nine. His dad is a violent drunk, and David begins drinking and using drugs in elementary school. His mother puts him in a psychiatric center at 13. He repeatedly goes into rehab. He believes in God, tries church at 17, marries out of guilt and then turns against God when his wife leaves him for another man. He marries again at 19, and they have a son. But David can’t control his drinking. Drunk driving leads to jail. His dad dies of cancer before David can show love, leading to guilt. He and his brother quarrel and David stabs him as the first part ends.

item.title: 3068 Floyd Plumb Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Gambling, Polio, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Floyd has polio at age four leaving him with a stutter. He runs away from home at five, finding friends who teach him to smoke. Rebellious, he does poorly at school, is held back repeatedly and finally is expelled at 16 in the 7th grade. He marries at 20; the Depression hits, and he drinks and gambles. After a fight with his dad, he looks at his life and wants God. He drives his wife and son 80 miles on a gallon of gas to hear a preacher he’s heard on the radio and is saved.

item.title: 3067 Bill & Barb Akright
item.itunes:subtitle: Religion, Near-Death, Dairy Farmer
item.itunes:summary: Bill and Barb marry when she is only 14 and he is 16. Bill decides to live as he pleases and get saved when he is old. When his father can no longer farm, they assume responsibility for the family dairy farm. An accident nearly kills Bill. Hospitalized for three months, he surrenders to Christ. The couple does well in farming afterward until government interference drives them into bankruptcy, after which Barb has a nervous breakdown. They overcome with prayer and Bible study.
item.description: Bill and Barb marry when she is only 14 and he is 16. Bill decides to live as he pleases and get saved when he is old. item.title: 3066 Byron Dotson Classic – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcoholism, Suicidal, CEO
item.itunes:summary: Byron attempts suicide several times. His doctor refuses to treat him because of the drinking problems, and his wife is at wit’s end, even having Byron put in jail for his own protection. The family tries to have him committed but the judge lets him try to change. He can’t. Finally, in an alcoholic center, a pastor explains the gospel and Byron is saved. He spends the rest of his life as a witness for Christ.

item.title: 3065 Byron Dotson Classic – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Gambling, Alcohol, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Byron’s assertive father stirs up rebellion in the son. Wearing braces for the first six years of his life due to bow-legs, Byron walks to Sunday school and is beaten for not telling his parents. He learns to smoke and drink by age ten; commits vandalism and nearly dies. He runs away and his dad arranges to have him arrested. Byron quits school at 16 and his dad sets him up in business. Byron is successful, but alcohol consumes him. The first part ends with his dad’s death and Byron’s addiction having led to heartache for his family.

item.title: 3064 Bruce & Doris Burke – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionaries to South Africa
item.itunes:summary: Daughter, Gann, chooses to go to South Africa with her parents and they arrive by Greek freighter. Their co-workers, however, are liberal and the Burkes leave the mission after 9 months to serve on their own, forming Open Bible Ministries. The government doesn’t renew their visa, so they go home but continue to raise support, starting new churches and schools. When they return to S. Africa they face corruption, losing two schools; also rebellion from students. They flee Lesotho and start a school in Fouriesburg. Their story concludes as a former Bible school convert calls, still serving the Lord.

item.title: 3063 Bruce & Doris Burke Classic – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Near Death Experiences, Conversions
item.itunes:summary: Bruce and Doris run away to marry when she is only 16. His motorcycle crashes into a car, and he prays for her to live, promising God to change. He doesn’t. Then she nearly dies after having their first baby. Again he promises God to change. They move to a small town where a neighbor prays for them. They go to church, hear the gospel and later that night, both pray to receive Christ. Change begins as they choose the LORD over the world. They grow as they trust in the LORD. Then God calls them to Africa and Bruce resists. The first part ends as he chooses to obey.

item.title: 3062 Lawrence Durfee Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger, Bitterness, Burn Victim
item.itunes:summary: Raised without God or the Bible or church, Lawrence quits school at 15 to work and become rich. He marries Wilma at 24. Violent and bitter, he loses his job, borrows money from his dad to start his own auto shop. He has amassed nearly $50,000 when an oil-sparked explosion sets him on fire at work, and he nearly dies. In a coma he has a vision of hell and cries out to God to save him. All his money is spent on doctor and hospital bills, but he has peace and goes into ministry distributing Bibles.

item.title: 3061 John Denson – Part 3
item.itunes:subtitle: Prison, Messianic & Prison Ministry
item.itunes:summary: The associate warden John works with in prison is a Messianic Jew who teaches John about the roots of Judaism in Christianity. He also tutors him for a G.E.D. As an inmate John is allowed to go to Bible college. When released, he and Donna go into ministry, speaking at prisons across the country. He asks forgiveness from his family. He brings his dad to live with them, speaking at his dad’s funeral. After training, he and Donna are now in Jewish evangelism.

item.title: 3060 John Denson – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Crime, Prison
item.itunes:summary: John meets Donna and they live together, moving often because of the contracts out on his life. Then his partner is shot and killed, and John is arrested. As a third-time offender, he faces a long sentence and tries to escape. He’s caught and put in solitary where he learns of his brother’s death from leukemia. In prison he reads the Bible and hears an evangelist. One night he prays and is saved. He asks Donna to get a pastor to help him get paroled. Instead, Donna gets saved. Miraculously, he is released long enough for them to marry. The first part ends as he goes back to prison.

item.title: 3059 John Denson – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Crime, Prison, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: John’s father is paralyzed from a job injury when John is 6, and John grows up without a father in the home. A wild child, his mother takes him along as she cleans the homes of Jews, and he learns Bible stories. They also go to church, but John rejects Christ. He uses drugs, drops out of high school to join the army and marries Carla. Children are born, but he can’t quit drugs; he goes to prison again and she waits for him. He works with Jewish gangsters and his wife and he separate. The first part ends as John’s mother dies of cancer and he is bereft.

item.title: 3058 Thomas Gregory – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Architect, Wife’s Suicide, Religion
item.itunes:summary: Devastated after his wife’s suicide, Tom is visited by a man (George Eager) who leads him to Christ. George then persuades Tom to take his children to a Bible conference camp that summer. There Tom meets Cherie, a single mom with three daughters. He also meets John, an architect who loves the LORD. Tom and Cherie marry, and Tom’s partners ask him to leave, so he starts his own firm. Cherie opens a Christian bookstore that prospers, and Tom and John form a ministry, The Master Architect, that ministers to architects around the world.

item.title: 3057 Thomas Gregory – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Architect, Religion, Wife’s Suicide
item.itunes:summary: Although his parents take him to church and read Bible stories to him, Tom has religion but doesn’t know Christ as he matures. Smart and responsible, he studies architecture, meets and marries Judy, who becomes a teacher. For eight years they live near her family. Her father’s death of brain cancer and their following move to Georgia, away from her mother, leave her feeling trapped. Then his partnership dissolves. They end up divorced and she shoots herself. The first part ends with Tom’s grief and guilt.

item.title: 3056 Joe Stump Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Unsaved Religious Pastor
item.itunes:summary: Fearful in the Great War, Joe promises God that he will become a minister. Unsaved, he goes through seminary. As a pastor he meets Nelda and they marry. Her mother knows Joe isn’t saved and her comments annoy him. When an unsaved parishioner dies, pleading for peace with God, Joe doesn’t have the answer and quits the ministry. He goes to New York, talks with theologians. One of them sends him to the Bowery rescue mission. Joe is offended by the sermon but ultimately goes forward and is saved.

item.title: 3055 Clinton Goodwin Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Crime, Prison, Rescue Missions
item.itunes:summary: The oldest of nine children, Clint and his family move from Arizona to Chicago when he’s twelve. There he’s invited to Sunday school and professes faith in Christ at fourteen. He goes to Bible classes and gives his testimony on street corners. At 17 he goes to Albuquerque to work for the railroad, working Sundays. He backslides, rides the rails, then falls in with a robber. They buy guns and commit highway robbery for 18 months. They’re caught, and in jail churches minister, but he resists. He’s sentenced to San Quentin where he finally surrenders to Christ. He serves God in jails and rescue missions.

item.title: 3054 Charles Churchill – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Persecution, Pastor
item.itunes:summary: Charles witnesses to his old buddies who ridicule him. Pat gives him a job in his body shop. Charles learns to prioritize and trust God as he serves in the church. He witnesses to a co-worker, but Don rejects the gospel. Charles and a mentor witness to an alcoholic friend, who also rejects Christ. The man dies that night of a heart attack and Charles feels compelled to preach on street corners. Charles goes to his former employer and confesses thefts that they forgive. He goes to Bible college, becomes a preacher. Don is saved and becomes a preacher.

item.title: 3053 Charles Churchill – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Charles goes to church with his granny but rebels at 14 and quits as he sees hypocrisy in people. He starts drinking with friends, steals, uses marijuana and drag races. He meets Jennie and they marry three months later, then he resumes his old life, refusing to go to church with her. A biker comes into his workplace and invites him to church. That day Charles is fired for insubordination, leading to a fight with Jennie. He promises to go to church, and the next day they do. There he is led to Christ, ending the first part.

item.title: 3052 Robert Brown
item.itunes:subtitle: Jew, Drugs, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: At birth Robert is adopted into a Jewish family and raised as an only child. Spoiled by his mother, he is rebellious and self-centered. He graduates without motivation and marries, but both are immature. They have three sons, but he floats from one job to another, then begins smoking marijuana. After his mother dies, he and his wife divorce. As a traveling salesman, lonely and disconnected, he asks God for a woman to talk to. He meets Delilah, and she invites him to church where he prays for salvation. They marry and he begins to change, becoming a Messianic Jew and meeting his birth mother.

item.title: 3051 Virginia Sartin
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Neglect, Forgiveness
item.itunes:summary: Virginia’s mother dies, charging the ten-year-old to keep the six siblings together. Her dad abuses and neglects them. The next five years Virginia perseveres, feeding and watching over the family. Her dad is gone and doesn’t bring food or clothing. Their Sunday school teacher comes and shares the gospel. When she’s 12 and her brother Billy is 14, they receive Christ. Then Billy is killed in an accident. Virginia meets Lewis and they marry when she’s almost sixteen. She fulfills her mother’s charge, raising the children, praying for her dad. He repents at age 79 and lives with them till he dies.

item.title: 3050 Thomas Graumann – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Czech Jew, Persecution, Missionary
item.itunes:summary: Tom serves as a missionary in the Philippines where he meets Caroline. They marry, but when they adopt two children, their mission drops them. For 25 years they live in the U.S., serving in spite of illness and setback. They return to the Philippines to serve, but more illness interferes. When Communism falls in Eastern Europe, Tom returns to Czechoslovakia where he obtains citizenship, serves as a missionary and links up with his past.

When Communism falls in Eastern Europe, Tom returns to Czechoslovakia where he obtains citizenship, serves as a missionary and links up with his past.

When Communism falls in Eastern Europe, Tom returns to Czechoslovakia where he obtains citizenship, serves as a missionary and links up with his past.

item.title: 3049 Thomas Graumann Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Jew, Persecution, World War II
item.itunes:summary: A Jew, born in Czechoslovakia, Tom’s parents put him on the train to England to escape Hitler’s persecution. He hears the gospel and trusts Christ at age 9. His family dies during the war. He is called to missions at age 16, goes to nurses training and then Bible college in Glasgow. The first part ends as he and his foster “Uncle Jimmie” pray together.

item.title: 3048 Rudy Peterson Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Train Accident, Religion
item.itunes:summary: Rudy grows up in a Christian family, leaves home to work on the railroad around corrupting men. He marries a girl from his Sunday school class. After a few years he decides to read the Bible, then he memorizes 1000 verses. He’s made a conductor. An accident causes a train car to run over his legs, mangling them. Doctors want to amputate but he refuses. God saves his legs, and during 107 days in the hospital he leads several men to faith. He goes back to work as a conductor and helps at PGM on layovers.

item.title: 3047 Bob Phillips
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Cherokee Indian, Missionary
item.itunes:summary: After his mother dies, Bob’s father raises him and his older sister. Speaking Cherokee at home, he struggles in school. Tribal superstitions rule. His dad remarries, a woman who takes them to church and teaches responsibility; then she dies. His dad drinks; Bob sneaks alcohol and steals, feeling shame. Finally, he graduates, goes to vocational technical school but drops out. His father dies of a heart attack in Bob’s arms, and he rages at God. Drunk and homeless, he stays here and there. A man gives him a tract; he goes to church. The pastor leads him to Christ. He serves as youth pastor and meets Charlene. They marry & he goes to Bible college. They are still serving as missionaries on a reservation in Washington.

item.title: 3046 Charlene Phillips – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Cherokee Indian, Missionary
item.itunes:summary: Charlene’s family mocks her faith; her stepfather forbids her to go to church and she rebels briefly, trying to get drunk. Then she asks God’s forgiveness, ignores her stepfather and goes back to church. She and Bob, the youth pastor, marry. They go to Bible college, and he becomes a missionary to Indians on a reservation in Washington State. She witnesses to her family. Her parents and two brothers profess faith in Christ.

item.title: 3045 Charlene Phillips Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Cherokee Indian, Drugs, Abuse
item.itunes:summary: Charlene’s family life is full of drunkenness and fighting. Her stepfather feuds with his family and they move constantly. Her step-grandmother and mother practice spiritualism, bringing fear. When she’s 12, her stepfather tries to molest her and continues trying until she’s 17. She begins using drugs, sniffing paint. A girl at school witnesses and takes her to church. Charlene runs away but has a bad experience and ends up in the hospital. She reads the first chapter of Proverbs and knows God is real. A pastor comes to the house and takes her to church. She prays to receive Christ, but the first half ends with learning her stepfather’s sordid past.

item.title: 3044 Becky Brooks
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, Depression, Preacher’s Wife
item.itunes:summary: Becky struggles with the assurance of salvation but finally trusts in God’s Word. Marshall becomes a preacher, and she gives herself wholeheartedly to the church. Then she’s hurt when others leave or gossip, betraying her trust. She goes into depression and struggles for two years, writing poetry to ease the pain. She learns to trust God. Their younger son walks away for ten years, then returns and is saved. The family is still in ministry.

item.title: 3043 Marshall Brooks
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Motorcycles
item.itunes:summary: Marshall goes to church growing up but stops when he’s 18. He sneaks alcohol with friends. He marries Becky, tries college for a year then quits to run a motorcycle shop. Becky hates the drinking and drugs. When he buys a bar, she keeps the books and is there the night two drunker patrons have a shootout. No one dies, but Marshall is sick of his lifestyle. He talks with a friend who is saved and who ultimately leads him to Christ. Marshall becomes a preacher.

item.title: 3042 Holland Oates Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Shame, Stone cutter
item.itunes:summary: Holland hears the gospel at a mission but his wife doesn’t want to pursue God’s nudging. Holland becomes a drunkard; but when their baby daughter falls ill, he wants to pray. The baby dies, and a drunken Holland almost knocks over her casket. Mortified, he prays, asking God to save him. He quit drinking but smokes cigars until he stops by PGM and a counselor prays with him. Holland begins preaching at PGM. When his son dies in the war, Holland becomes an itinerant preacher.

item.title: 3041 Ashley Mariela Kovach
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Abandonment, Colombian
item.itunes:summary: Her father dies when she is four and her wayward mother leaves her with an aunt who neglects Ashley’s baby brother, who dies in Ashley’s arms. After beatings and rape from a stepfather, who also leaves her without food, she becomes homeless at age 6 when he throws her out. She tries to end her life but is rescued. Many foster homes and orphanages later, she is adopted by an American. At Bible camp Ashley hears the gospel and accepts Christ at 13. She goes to Bible college where she meets and marries Paul. They are missionaries in Brazil.

item.title: 3040 Kay Henderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Depression, Infidelity, Adoption
item.itunes:summary: Kay’s troubled brother causes her anxiety and depression even though her parents are educated and loving. She tries to be perfect but suffers more depression in college until she meets Matt and they marry. She becomes a Special Ed teacher while he’s in Vietnam as a Marine. Afterward, he practices law and they prosper, having two children. When he confesses to fathering a daughter with his secretary, Kay is devastated. A neighbor leads her to Christ, and she leads Matt to the Lord. They begin adopting children, bi-racial and Hispanic—even his illegitimate daughter.

item.title: 3039 Matt Henderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Adultery, Vietnam, Attorney
item.itunes:summary: Starting in high school, Matt drinks too much. He goes to law school after college, where he meets Kay. Before they marry in his senior year, he enlists in the Marines. He goes to Vietnam and survives. Afterward, he practices as a lawyer. Seven years into his marriage he has an affair with his secretary who becomes pregnant after seven years. She keeps the baby that Matt supports. He tells Kay and she goes to a neighbor for comfort who leads her to Christ. Then Matt and their children get saved. They begin adopting bi-racial children. They even adopt Matt’s illegitimate daughter. He shares his testimony at churches.

item.title: 3038 Jettie Evans Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Poverty, Drunken Husband
item.itunes:summary: Jettie is the fourth of twelve children. She believes in God but her family doesn’t go to church. She goes occasionally with a neighbor. She has to quit school at 14 to help at home. At 18 she’s allowed to stay behind when the family moves. She works, meets Brady and he promises to get a job. He joins the army and they marry. But his bad discharge from the navy ends his enlistment. He becomes a drunk, staying out all night. Jettie prays for salvation and leaves him. After he is saved, they move to Chicago and discover “Unshackled!” They go to PGM for years and foster a child from the Women and Children’s Division.

item.title: 3037 Brady Evans Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Blind Mother, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Brady’s father dies when Brady’s a child, and his mother goes blind; so he grows up without supervision. He joins the navy but receives an Undesirable Discharge for drinking and pilfering cargo. Unable or unwilling to work, he turns to stealing and goes to jail for 11 months. Then he meets and marries Jettie Mae. Again he makes bad decisions and she leaves him. He finally cries out to God, quits drinking and goes to Chicago. Jettie Mae joins him. They hear “Unshackled!” and he gives his testimony at PGM.

item.title: 3036 Worth Ellis Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Gambling, Anger, Poverty
item.itunes:summary: Worth’s family is poor. His dad has skin cancer and drinks whiskey to deal with the pain. Scared of hell during revival, Worth joins the church at 12 but doesn’t know Christ. He drops out of school to work, then drops back in. But the Depression forces him to work. He falls in love with Dot, but gambling controls him after they marry. He mocks his sister’s faith. After his brother is killed in World War II, he becomes bitter at God. His sister reminds him that if he had been killed, he’d be in hell. He finally yields to God and eventually becomes an evangelist.

He drops out of school to work, then drops back in. But the Depression forces him to work. He falls in love with Dot, but gambling controls him after they marry. He mocks his sister’s faith. After his brother is killed in World War II, he becomes bitter at God. His sister reminds him that if he had been killed, he’d be in hell. He finally yields to God and eventually becomes an evangelist.

item.title: 3035 Louis Holguin
item.itunes:subtitle: Hispanic, Religion, Medic
item.itunes:summary: Louis grows up in a Catholic family. Strict father. He joins the air force after graduation, becomes a medic and serves in Vietnam. Afterward, he meets Sharon, a nurse and an officer. She takes him to church, he feigns salvation and they elope. Then he prays for salvation. When their first son is born, he tells his family he is born again, and his father renounces him. Louis goes to Bible college in Chattanooga where he has adventures pastoring hill people. They endure many personal trials. Still a pastor in Las Vegas, New Mexico.

item.title: 3034 Douglas Hainer
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Violence, Trans World Radio
item.itunes:summary: Doug grows up in abusive home. His mother beats him with a 1x2; his sister slams a rifle butt into his face when he’s four. He becomes a loner, mistrusting everyone except faces that he sees on his bedroom wall. He has nightmares, fights at school where he learns to make tiger pits, practicing on his dad. He plans mass murders to get even for his pain. At 11 he goes to Christian summer camp where he is saved. He memorizes scripture, studies hard, goes to Bible school for a year. Then graduates from electronic school and spends three years on Guam as a technician for Trans World Radio. Still in Christian radio in Cleveland.

item.title: 3033 Michelle Morales
item.itunes:subtitle: Abortion, Drugs, Abandonment
item.itunes:summary: As the youngest child of four, Michelle endures a childhood of abandonment, cruelty and fear. Her mother attempts suicide; her sister is raped and Michelle lives with one person after another. At sixteen she gets pregnant and has an abortion. She keeps the second baby after her sister helps her, but she and her boyfriend don’t marry. The whole family uses drugs, but sister, Anna, gets saved and persuades the other two sisters to go to church. Michelle reads passages in the Bible, goes back to church and prays for salvation. When she gets pregnant again, she realizes she cannot marry her boyfriend who rejects Christ. Through Anna she meets and marries a believer.

item.title: 3032 David Hicks – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Army Chaplain, Insecurity
item.itunes:summary: David does poorly at college until he meets Janice, who prays with and encourages him. They marry and he goes to seminary at Princeton. After graduation he is ordained as an Army chaplain. He does well through various Army posts, even serving as an airborne chaplain. He witnesses to his brother and dying father, but neither is receptive. David rises in rank, assigned to the Pentagon during 9-11. He becomes Chief of Chaplains and leads his brother to Christ. Now retired.

Now retired.

item.title: 3031 David Hicks – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Army Chaplain, Emptiness, Insecurity
item.itunes:summary: One of twelve children, David’s father sets a proud example of black fighters in World War I. But David doesn’t do well in school and drops out to join the army, and he learned to drink with other soldiers in bars. He becomes paratrooper like his brother and they carouse. When his brother is discharged, David suffers turmoil. He talks with the chaplain, receives Christ and then baits Satan. He goes to jail, but the chaplain restores him and David goes on to give his testimony and study the Bible. The first part ends as he leaves the Army to go to college, called by God to the ministry.
