item.title: 3030 Bob Gardner Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Blind, Alcohol, Country Music
item.itunes:summary: Bob is born blind, and his mother dies in childbirth so his deaf but godly grandmother raises him to age 11. Then he goes to a school for the blind. He meets another blind boy and they play and sing country music together. They record a song that sells millions, and Bob goes to California where he squanders his money. He returns to Chicago, teams up with his friend and they do well. He meets Francis in a restaurant, they marry but he doesn’t change. When she becomes ill he prays for her. People invite him to revival then pray for Francis. When she’s well she goes to revival and is saved. He ultimately receives Christ, leaves his singing career and joins the staff at PGM.

item.title: 3029 George Eager
item.itunes:subtitle: Religion, Guilt, Ministry to Children
item.itunes:summary: George is convicted at age seven, but no one tells him how to be saved. He grows up depending on his own efforts. In college he meets Laura and they fall in love. He is a senior in Naval ROTC when Pearl Harbor comes. He and Laura marry and he goes to war. When he returns, his father dies and he works the family farm. Then he accidentally runs over his 7-year-old son who dies, and George is devastated. He goes to his mother who talks about Job and George surrenders to Christ. God leads him into children’s ministry, and he founds the Mailbox Club for children, now all over the world.

item.title: 3028 Chris DiGiacomo – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Teen Car Surfing, Backsliding
item.itunes:summary: Chris goes to college but joins a fraternity where he drinks and gets into immoral behavior. For five years he fails to go to church and drifts away from God. He is miserable but doesn’t know why even though he has a good job and home. He meets Jennifer and they live together. His mother keeps telling him to go to church. Finally, he goes, is convicted and recommits his life to Christ. Jenn is saved and they marry. Chris witnesses to his dad who refuses to pray, but repents later with a pastor. Chris goes to Bible college and is preparing to pioneer a church in Boston.

item.title: 3027 Chris DiGiacomo – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Teen Car Surfing, Religion
item.itunes:summary: His parents divorce when Chris is ten and his mother falls out with the church. At eleven his stepfather tells him he must work and leave home at 18. The mixed family is troublesome and his mother seeks God. She is saved while Chris works at a Burger King. There he meets Pat, a thrill-seeker who tries car surfing and falls. Chris does CPR but his friend dies. Chris is devastated, seeks counseling that doesn’t help his panic attacks. The first part ends when he prays for salvation with his mother’s pastor.

item.title: 3026 Gary Beikirch – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Vietnam medic, Medal of Honor
item.itunes:summary: Gary spends ten months healing in a veteran’s hospital, tries drugs in his search for God. Then tries college but drops out after some students spit on him. He visits his cousin and her husband gives him a New Testament. He discovers Jesus and is saved. He is reconciled to his father, also saved, and then he goes to seminary. While there he’s called to Washington to receive the Medal of Honor. He meets and marries, Lolly, gets a Master’s in counseling and counsels middle school students.

item.title: 3025 Gary Beikirch – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Rebellion, Medal of Honor
item.itunes:summary: Gary’s parents divorce when Gary is five. He goes to many different school but excels. Becomes a leader under the encouragement of his high school sweetheart. They go to college and she dumps him, so he joins the Army Special Forces and becomes a medic with the Green Berets. He gets drunk and piles up so many charges that he re-enlists for Vietnam. He loves the Montagnard people, the peace and purpose. The first part ends after a huge battle when he is injured three times but keeps helping others, which will earn him the Medal of Honor.

item.title: 3024 Bessie Tollberg Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Selfishness, Widow
item.itunes:summary: Bessie’s beauty is her god. As a youth she sings at a mission but then falls away as a teenager. She meets and marries Nick, a Mafia type who is killed after their marriage. Her behavior degenerates and she sickens of her life and goes to Chicago where her family has moved. Her mother takes her to church and Bessie goes to the altar and prays to receive Christ. In street ministry she meets Bill, an accordionist, and they marry. He joins the Navy after Pearl Harbor and is killed in action.

item.title: 3023 Dick Lane Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Burglary, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Dick Lane’s cruelty is as famous as his skill at blowing safes. A newsman tries to help Dick by offering him a job, but Dick refuses. He disdains rehabilitation and thwarts the efforts of other inmates to go straight. After he breaks the wrist of a Christian who offers friendship, Dick’s hard shell cracks along with his career. He goes to the newsman who gives him a job but he can’t escape the memories. He walks by Pacific Garden Mission, gets saved and begins helping other guys on the street. One of them robs and shoots him.

item.title: 3022 Rodney Williams – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Molestation, Alcohol & Meth, Gambling
item.itunes:summary: While making methamphetamine, Rodney is set on fire. A neighbor takes him to the hospital where he recovers. The pastor of the Christian rehab visits, and Rodney goes there when he’s released. He finishes the course, lives with his dad and has many opportunities to witness for Christ. He finishes college, writes a book and becomes pastor of a church. He counsels Jennifer, a former drug addict, and they marry. Now in ministry.

item.title: 3021 Rodney Williams – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Gambling, Meth
item.itunes:summary: Rodney is molested at age four but turns to God for comfort. At nine he walks away from God to friends that lie and swear. He drinks, does drugs and is in several accidents, breaking both legs. He squanders insurance money on drugs, gambling and a sport car that he wrecks. He marries, has a son but his drugs and neglect lead to divorce. He repents but doesn’t get his family back, so he gets into Meth use, deteriorates and tries rehab. When that doesn’t work he asks his mother for help and she takes him to a Christian rehab. But he walks away to go back to Meth. The first part ends with a fiery explosion.

item.title: 3020 “Trudy”
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, Unforgiveness, Missionary to Brazil
item.itunes:summary: Trudy’s parents are religious until she’s twelve and they start listening to Christian radio. They receive Christ, but her father leaves when she’s 17. She quits seeing Dad who remarries. Trudy works to help her mother financially until her siblings graduate, then Trudy goes to missionary training in Canada. There she meets Jeff and they marry. They serve in Manaus, Brazil. When her mother is dying of cancer, Trudy cares for her until she dies. After 22 years she is reconciled with her dad, and all the siblings are there when he dies. Still serving in Brazil.

item.title: 3019 Julio Velasquez
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Rejection, Religion
item.itunes:summary: Julio’s father is a philandering alcoholic who dies when Julio is 16. He grows up with religion but not the Bible. He studies agricultural science at university and meets an American missionary who tells him about Jesus. Foolishly he steals car parts and goes to jail for a week. Afterward, the missionary tells him Jesus will set him free. He goes to church but to mock. After he graduates he gets drunk and nearly dies of pneumonia. He starts graduate school, then gets saved. His family rejects him and he lives with the missionary, whose daughter he marries. They go to the U.S. so he can go to Bible college and he becomes a missionary to Spain and Venezuela

item.title: 3018 James Fickley
item.itunes:subtitle: Paternal Abandonment, Fighting, Poverty
item.itunes:summary: His father abandons the family when Jim is five, leaving his mother to raise five children. His grandmother sends him to church and he works, but he and his brothers get into trouble, stealing, smoking, fighting. A classmate invites Jim to a Bible club when he’s sixteen, and he prays for salvation. Another classmate dies unexpectedly of a seizure and Jim realizes he must witness more. Unable to graduate, he joins the army, stands up for Jesus against a bully sergeant and breaks his hand. After the army he goes to Bible college, meets his wife and they become teachers.

item.title: 3017 Barbara Caldwell
item.itunes:subtitle: Manic-Depression, Singer
item.itunes:summary: Barbara’s parents divorce when she’s an infant and she grows up afraid of her father. Her mother is strict but they go to church faithfully. Barbara confesses Christ at age 8, but she drifts into singing and acting, goes to college and does well until senior year when she has a nervous breakdown. Diagnosed as manic-depressive, she is in and out of the hospital for 15 years, wanders into parapsychology and fear. She runs away often. Finally, she cries out to God to save her and today, fifteen years later she is writing and recording Christian truth.

item.title: 3016 David & Norma Winget – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Moonshiner, Pulmonary Fibrosis, Bible Teacher
item.itunes:summary: David and Norma marry after she finishes college. When he graduates from Bible college, they start a church near his family. His dad attends and professes faith. David gets his Master’s degree in theology and becomes department head at their old college. They witness to her family, but the brothers and dad resist. Norma develops Pulmonary Fibrosis, and David cares for her. Her brother, Harry, finally professes faith in Christ at 84 and dies just before Norma does. They keep the faith even through the ordeal of death.

item.title: 3015 David Winget – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Moonshiner, Pride, Bible Teacher
item.itunes:summary: In 1944 David’s dad begins making moonshine with David’s help. He is 14. His mother finally objects and the family moves to Florida where David finishes high school at 16. David goes to hear an evangelist at the church next door and after a week of sermons he prays to receive Christ. His whole family, except for his dad, gets saved. His dad resists the gospel. David becomes superintendent of Sunday school, grows in the Lord, leads several people to Christ and his pastor encourages him to go to Bible college. The first part ends with him at Bible college, meeting Norma.

item.title: 3014 Jack Ferguson Classic – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Prison, Drugs, Missionary to Mexico
item.itunes:summary: Jack travels with an evangelist for three years, then goes to Bible college where he studies Spanish evangelism. In a ministry to Spanish people at his church he meets and marries Gloria. They adopt two girls and have a son and daughter. He leads the Spanish ministry four years then quits. Called to be a missionary to Mexico, he quits his job and they go to Mexico. After ten years they go to Tabasco where flooding destroys half their possessions. He accidentally hits and kills a man on the highway and is jailed but his church helps him. Still ministering to the poor.

item.title: 3013 Jack Ferguson Classic – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Drugs, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Jack burns his picture out of the school yearbook and his family sends him for psychiatric help. A thief and drug dealer, he flees his family after high school and goes to Florida. There he hears the gospel at a rescue mission and feigns conversion. A motorcycle accident causes him to bargain with God but he doesn’t keep his promises. He drinks too much, is charged with rape and spends a year in county jail where another inmate preaches to him. When he violates parole he goes to prison, gets serious with God and goes back to witness to his family as the first part ends.

item.title: 3012 Bill Behrens
item.itunes:subtitle: Marine, Religion, Vietnam
item.itunes:summary: Bill hates parochial school, gets in trouble and fights growing up. He joins the Marines after high school, meets Marly and falls in love. He goes to Vietnam where she stops writing after he proposes. He survives the Tet Offensive, comes home and reconnects with Marly. He becomes a drill instructor, desensitizing him to life. When his tour is up, he goes to college and he and Marly are engaged. But she gets saved and breaks the engagement. He goes to church with her, keeps going back because the church is troubled and he expects a fight. One night he attends a deacon’s meeting where he is saved. He and Marly marry. Now an evangelist.

item.title: 3011 David Astwood
item.itunes:subtitle: Meniere’s Disease, Religion, Chemistry
item.itunes:summary: His family’s cult religion doesn’t allow doctors, so David suffers ear infections as a child. Finally, he has surgery to remove tonsils and adenoids, then gets swimming water in his inner ear leaving him with Meniere’s Disease. He suffers ridicule for being off balance, isolates himself and does well in chemistry. In college he idolizes his professor who reduces him to tears. In graduate school he meets a Christian who leads him to Christ. David’s father professes faith in Christ before he dies of cancer. David follows Jeff to seminary but is rejected as a missionary. Now works as a consultant writing standardized tests.

item.title: 3010 Bill Rieser
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger, Drugs, Abuse
item.itunes:summary: Bill grows up in New York City. Gifted in basketball, he’s molested at 12 by a gangster and left with rage. His drinking ruins his NBA chances but he finishes college and marries Carolyn. When a back injury ends basketball, he has an affair. Carolyn learns and wants a divorce. After her pastor prays, she has peace and offers Bill forgiveness if he accepts Christ. He does but keeps drinking until his liver rebels. At a men’s gathering, he forgives the molester and finds peace. Now leads a recovery ministry.

item.title: 3009 “Eda”
item.itunes:subtitle: Albanian, Atheism, Communism
item.itunes:summary: “Eda” is the oldest of three sisters. Their grandmother secretly talks about God in a godless country, closed to the world. No one trusts anyone. Education is paramount to her family and she is obedient. Communism begins to fall when she is 14. Churches open and she hears an evangelist on TV and prays with him. Someone gives her a Bible and she reads voraciously. As a teenager working at a public radio station, she repels the advances of her boss. Civil war in Albania strengthens her faith. Then the Kosovo crisis comes and she sees the evil of mankind. God opens the door for her to run a Christian radio station in Albania.

item.title: 3008 Roger & Naomi Walkwitz – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionaries to Philippines
item.itunes:summary: Roger and Naomi are a challenge to the existing church in Banaue that takes them to court. Roger wins. He and a native believer, George, translate the Gospel of John into Ifugao. The mission wants Roger to teach chemistry in Manila, but he resists, so they send the couple to Baguio. There they establish Bible fellowships for the mountain students. After 32 years they retire and go to Israel, enduring the Gulf War. They start a Messianic ministry. Then their oldest son and family die in a plane crash. Roger and Naomi are still in ministry.

item.title: 3007 Roger & Naomi Walkwitz – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionaries to Philippines
item.itunes:summary: Roger is saved at 13 and studies chemistry, planning to teach in high school. Instead he’s recruited to teach at a Bible college where he meets Naomi. He’s drafted into the army where he works as a chemist, hears a Wycliffe call to teach the Bible in the Philippines and submits to God. He and Naomi apply to be missionaries. He’s accepted, she’s rejected. They marry anyway and both are approved. They go to Manila where their first son is born. The first part ends as they arrive in Banaue.

item.title: 3006 Ken Edwards Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Crime, Burglary, Gambling
item.itunes:summary: Beginning as a teenager, Ken Edwards traced a life of crime across the nation leaving a trail of stolen or counterfeit loot. He lived a style many yearned to imitate but for the reckoning which came in a Florida jail. His mother and grandmother had prayed for years – without seeming effect. But at last, from a source he had spurned, Edwards experienced the grace hundreds have found.

item.title: 3005 “Sophie” Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Death, Fear, Religion
item.itunes:summary: While she’s a child, Sophie’s sister, mother and brother all die, leading to her fear of death. To placate God she goes to church and prays often as a teenager. She meets Nick but is afraid to marry him until he converts to her church. When their daughter is born, Sophie becomes even more fearful. Even when they go out with friends to party, the fears haunt her. She hears a radio preacher and prays for salvation, then talks with a neighbor who has been praying for her. At first Nick is upset with the change in her, but after several accidents, he professes faith, too. No longer afraid of death, Sophie witnesses in the hospital

item.title: 3004 Jimmy Rowe
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Stealing, Cocaine
item.itunes:summary: Jimmy grows up without a dad and starts smoking pot at 12 even though his mother is a police officer and they go to church. He marries Patty although her dad opposes the match. Jimmy promises to straighten up at 30 but doesn’t. A drug dealer, he becomes addicted to Oxycontin, then crack cocaine. His addiction leads him to steal from his wife, his mother and daughter. He resists conviction several times. Finally, he steals his wife’s 401K check and disappears for a week. She finds him. At home he wrestles with the devil but finally surrenders to Christ. Now in Bible college and ministry.

item.title: 3003 Charles Palmer Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Pride, Marital Strife
item.itunes:summary: Chuck joins the navy at 17, hears and rejects the gospel during boot training. Later he says “yes” to Jesus but not with his heart. He marries 15-year-old Nell when he’s 20. They party and have a son, Larry, but alcohol nearly drives them apart. When the navy sends him to Iceland, she wants a divorce. He persuades her to try again but the marriage founders. A sailor urges Chuck to come to Bible study and he eventually prays for salvation. Nell comes at Christmas but they fight, and he sequesters the boy. She goes back to Texas and he prays for two years. Finally, she returns, hears him preach and professes faith in Christ. The marriage is restored.

item.title: 3002 Becky Kelly
item.itunes:subtitle: Deception, Thievery, Promiscuity
item.itunes:summary: 3002 Becky Kelly: Becky resents her step mom. She also resents the restrictions of diabetes and steals sweets, then money to buy sweets. A liar and thief, she becomes promiscuous and has a bad reputation in high school. Her parents send her to a mental health clinic where she meets a guy she eventually marries. But he is a homosexual who abuses her. The marriage is annulled, and Becky runs around, meeting John, an Irish con artist. They live together, adopt a baby boy because her pregnancies are difficult. But she has two more healthy sons. Seeking to baptize their “adopted” son, they go to church where Becky is saved. She takes care of John for 14 years after a stroke that brings him salvation.

item.title: 3001 Mamie LaFlamme Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Bad Upbringing, Drugs, Handicapped
item.itunes:summary: Mamie’s mother gives her to a stranger who takes her to France and teaches her to deal cards, smoke and drink. She marries at fifteen, has a daughter, Sonia. Her husband dies and Mamie raises Sonia by dancing in cabarets. She becomes a drug addict, enduring the Nazis. Her daughter dies, further embittering Mamie. When the war ends she goes to Canada where she contracts polio and is crippled. A woman invites her to church, and she goes to mock but is saved. She becomes a missionary to the bayou of Louisiana.

item.title: 3000 Kathy Wellin
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, Depression, Eating Disorder
item.itunes:summary: Kathy’s bitterness toward her busy father causes many problems: bulimia, rebellion, drinking and a bad attitude. She meets Kip in high school and they go off to college together, but she cannot be faithful. Her sin leads to depression and she has several accidents, but she finishes nursing school. She and Kip marry but her bulimia returns after her first baby is born. She goes to a clinic, overcomes bulimia and meets Christians in exercise class. She learns about Jesus, goes to Bible study and receives Christ. But she still takes anti-depressants for 14 years. After a crisis when she’s diagnoses with psychosis, she and Kip go to a seminar where she learns to trust in the Lord and she throws away her meds.

item.content:encoded: Kathy’s bitterness toward her busy father causes many problems: bulimia, rebellion, drinking and a bad attitude. She meets Kip in high school and they go off to college together, but she cannot be faithful. Her sin leads to depression and she has several accidents, but she finishes nursing school. She and Kip marry but her bulimia returns after her first baby is born. She goes to a clinic, overcomes bulimia and meets Christians in exercise class. She learns about Jesus, goes to Bible study and receives Christ. But she still takes anti-depressants for 14 years. After a crisis when she’s diagnoses with psychosis, she and Kip go to a seminar where she learns to trust in the Lord and she throws away her meds.

item.title: 2999 Johnny Spence Classic – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Golf
item.itunes:summary: Johnny becomes addicted to narcotics when the “rest home” gives him Demerol to wean him off alcohol. He loses his right eye in a rest home brawl. Bitter and unable to work, he sells his possessions and then borrows. Reduced to the gutter, he decides to end his life, but a friend takes him to the V.A. Hospital where a chaplain prays for him. He goes to hear a former golf student at the chapel and gives his life to Christ. He witnesses to others including his father.

item.title: 2998 Johnny Spence Classic – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Golf
item.itunes:summary: His dad abandons the family when Johnny is 14. At 17 Johnny takes a job as professional golfer and chooses to work on Sunday rather than go to church. His mother pleads with him to no avail. He begins drinking and drinks too much. He marries Dorothy and they build a country club. When World War II comes, he converts the club into an officer’s club. He’s drafted but the army has him teach golf rather than go overseas. He continues drinking to excess, tries rehab, spurns his mother’s prayers and pleading. Dottie stays with him. The first part ends when he’s drunk and crashes his car into a truck.

item.title: 2997 Michael Swiger
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, Lies, Prison Ministry
item.itunes:summary: Mike blames God for setbacks in his life. When his older brother beats a man to death, Mike covers for him and lies to the police. Thinking they’ve gotten away with it, Mike is engaged to Susan. Then he’s arrested. In county jail he’s outraged by a preacher, reads the Bible and is convicted of sin. He prays for salvation, expects to be exonerated but gets 21 years. Susan faithfully visits him. He grows in faith, gets a seminary degree and leaves prison after 16 years. He and Susan marry and he is now in prison ministry.

item.title: 2996 John Stehr Classic: (Bavarian Waiter, European Traveler)
item.itunes:subtitle: Bavarian Waiter, European Traveler
item.itunes:summary: When John is six his father goes insane and tries to kill the family. At seventeen John goes to Vienna to become a waiter. A pastor in Munich sends him to a Christian Waiters’ Home in Paris. There he sees a plaque: Where will you spend eternity. He visits his mother before going to London, where Christian waiters’ testimonies help him come to Christ. More adventures follow as a waiter at sea before he comes to the U.S. He witnesses to guests and at PGM.

item.title: 2995 Bill & Joyce Scott – Part 3
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionaries to India
item.itunes:summary: Joyce and Bill marry and serve with the mission school in India. Bill has a vision from God to get Bibles into every home in India, but illiteracy is widespread and the nation is closed to the gospel. After nine years with the mission school, they leave to work at the mission hospital. In time India opens more to the gospel and they begin a school of evangelism, sending local men out to villages. Joyce writes a literacy manual and they teach people to read using the Bible as content. Hundreds of thousands learn to read. Many stories of God’s work over the years. Joyce dies but Bill still goes back to India.

item.title: 2994 Bill & Joyce Scott – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionaries to India
item.itunes:summary: Joyce and Bill Scott meet in London, where she tells her life story, salvation and call to India while they ride the bus to the shipping office. They become acquainted as they sail to India together with 77 other missionaries. Bill has several humorous mishaps. They share the train ride to Secunderabad, their mission field, for language training. Two weeks after their arrival Bill proposes marriage, and the first part ends with Joyce waffling, unable to decide and not wanting to be married.

item.title: 2993 Bill Scott – Part 1 of 3
item.itunes:subtitle: Irish, Gambling, Thievery
item.itunes:summary: Bill’s family in Belfast, Ireland is poor but hard working. Bill’s father and he both gamble pocket money. They don’t go to church, but his mother takes him to Sunday evening services at a local mission. At school he learns to memorize scripture daily. Working at fourteen, he begins stealing money from his boss. Then a friend is saved at the mission and proselytizes Bill. He goes to a prayer meeting and gives his life to Christ. He confesses his theft and begins preaching at fifteen. A benefactor at the mission sends him to Bible school in Glasgow. The first part ends as Bill prepares to go to India as a missionary.

item.title: 2992 Philip Foxwell – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Magician, Missionary to Japan
item.itunes:summary: Phil is in Bible college when he falls in love with Jane, the president’s daughter. She spurns him and becomes an army nurse. His friends encourage him to pursue her, and he visits her with an engagement ring. She interrogates him on his theological position so he keeps the ring. Still a magician, he entertains troops but is deferred from serving because he’s in seminary. He and Jane ultimately marry and then go to Japan as missionaries. Old friend, Don Hoke, visits them and also comes to Japan as a missionary. Phil, 93, still serving God.

item.title: 2991 Philip Foxwell – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Magician, Missionary To Japan
item.itunes:summary: Mesmerized by magic, Phil studies and practices to be a magician. In high school he hears a sermon and goes forward, giving his life to Christ. He graduates in 1932 and works as a magician. An agent friend mocks him for praying because Phil is too poor to buy food. So Phil and his mother pray, asking God to honor His name. The next day Phil is offered a contract with Lyceum, going to schools across the country performing his magic. God takes a back seat. But Phil hears sermons and sees a sign that makes him think. The first part ends as Phil leaves the circuit to go to Bible college.

item.title: 2990 Tommy Neiman
item.itunes:subtitle: Firefighter, Paramedic, Fear
item.itunes:summary: Saved at age nine, Tommy dreams of a baseball career but God has other plans. He becomes a paramedic and firefighter at age 23. God puts suicidal people, drug addicts and other desperate people in Tommy’s life, and he witnesses to one and all, including a former neighbor who brought fear to Tommy as a child. He even recounts one instance of failing to witness to a dying man. All the vignettes are examples to us of God’s grace and love and our responsibility to tell others.

item.title: 2989 Billy Crone
item.itunes:subtitle: Despair, Drugs, New Age
item.itunes:summary: Billy’s parents work, leaving their children in turmoil and without God. He cries out to God at 13 but doesn’t get an answer, so he turns to drugs and alcohol. He gives his soul to Satan at 17, then tries suicide. He graduates but a friend’s accidental death makes him wonder what will happen when he dies. He goes to California with his brother, works, tries a relationship, then worldly things, then New Age to fill the emptiness. A coworker tells him about Jesus. When Billy begins seeing a dark apparition, he cries out to God to save him. He goes to Bible college and becomes a pastor. Still in ministry.

item.title: 2988 Sonny Fleming: (Country Music, Alcohol)
item.itunes:subtitle: Country Music, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: Sonny goes to the altar at ten, but is led astray by country music. He succeeds, elopes with Mary and joins the Navy in World War II. He and his group hit it right in New York and Chicago, where they play for nationwide radio. But he drinks too much. A salesman comes to his house and offers to pray for Sonny who continues to run from God. One day he is unable to sing and begins to shake. He promises God he’ll do anything. Unable to even drink, he confides in a Bible-reading girl at the Chicago bus depot. Then he gets on the wrong bus and has to walk three miles in sleet. He cries out to God, is saved and becomes an evangelist. He counsels Laura Swaringim.

item.title: 2987 Laura Swaringim
item.itunes:subtitle: Legalism, Divorce, Music
item.itunes:summary: As an only child, Laura grows up privileged but without God. At 14 she wins first place in a country music TV competition. She meets Rusty, also a musician, and they marry when she’s 17. They go to Nashville, hoping for success but fail. They have two sons, then he leaves her for another woman. She fights the divorce, loses after three years and lives in denial. For the next nine years she serves the Lord while his mother and she pray for reconciliation. Finally, she accepts her situation, meets Don, a musician, and they marry. Both minister in music & still married after 30 years.

item.title: 2986 Tim Lee Classic – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Vietnam, Amputee
item.itunes:summary: On his way to Vietnam Tim tells God that he can’t live for Christ. His Marine buddy, Lee Gore, tries to encourage him. After ten months of combat, Tim steps on a land mine. He comes to with Gore weeping and praying for God to spare Tim. He loses both legs; no more running. After eight months in the hospital and 13 operations, he goes home, falls in love with Connie and they marry. He surrenders to preach the gospel and then becomes an evangelist. During a revival, his old buddy Gore appears and they are reunited. Tim is still an evangelist.

item.title: 2985 Tim Lee Classic – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Marine, Preacher’s Son
item.itunes:summary: A willful child, Tim prays for salvation at age 10 because he fears hell. But as a teenager he rebels against authority. He smokes, breaks rules as well as track records in the long jump and high hurdle. He moves out, gets a job and goes to college. A bad accident makes him think but not enough to change. He joins the Marine Crops, shapes up and gets meritorious promotions. Then he gets his orders for Vietnam, goes home and goes to the altar. The first part ends as he heads for Vietnam, telling God he can’t live for Christ.

item.title: 2984 Bill Shade Classic – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Amputee, Inner-City Missions
item.itunes:summary: 2984 Bill Shade Classic – Part 2: (Amputee, Inner-City Missions) After hearing a policeman describe youth crime, Bill launches an inner-city ministry in York. God provides people and resources to help him take hundreds of poor gang members to camp where they fight. Asked to preach, Bill begins sobbing and they listen and respond. God helps him buy buildings as centers for youth. Riding his motorcycle, Bill is hit by a car and his leg amputated. A nurse saves his life. He goes through a time of darkness as his ministry shrinks but at the end he has been chosen director of a world-wide ministry.

item.title: 2983 Bill Shade Classic – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Near-death, Missions
item.itunes:summary: Bill grows up an only child. His mother reads him Bible stories and the family goes to church. At church camp when he’s 13, Bill asks Jesus to save him, but he later denies being a Christian. His parents encourage him to join a social club where he learns to smoke, drink and play poker. After his dad is saved, Bill rebels. His smoking ruins his health and he is hospitalized with rheumatic fever. Dying, he asks God to let him lead one person to Christ. He lives and goes to camp where he leads a young man to faith. He goes to Bible school where he meets and marries Ruby. They serve in Kentucky. The first part ends as a Supreme Court decision forces them to leave their ministry.

item.title: 2982 Harold Witmer – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Inability to read, Missionary
item.itunes:summary: Faye teaches Harold until she goes off to college. He joins the army, gives his testimony in the Stockade, and a colonel hears and takes him under his wing. He gets his high school education, marries Faye and when he’s discharged, the colonel helps him start a Christian Servicemen’s Center. He helps start a Youth Challenge ministry to help troubled teenagers and leads his pastor to Christ. He takes Russian Bibles to East Germany, then to Russia where he starts orphanages and witnesses to a Russian judge who professes faith in Christ. Still serving in various ministries.
item.description: Faye teaches Harold until she goes off to college. He joins the army, gives his testimony in the Stockade, and a colonel hears and takes him under his wing. He gets his high school education, marries Faye and when he’s discharged, the colonel helps him start a Christian Servicemen’s Center. He helps start a Youth Challenge ministry to help troubled teenagers and leads his pastor to Christ. He takes Russian Bibles to East Germany, then to Russia where he starts orphanages and witnesses to a Russian judge who professes faith in Christ. Still serving in various ministries.

He takes Russian Bibles to East Germany, then to Russia where he starts orphanages and witnesses to a Russian judge who professes faith in Christ. Still serving in various ministries.

item.title: 2981 Harold Witmer – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Daydreamer, Inability to read
item.itunes:summary: Harold’s aunt and grandmother look after him and his siblings when his dad is gone and his mother works during World War II. They never go to church, but his grandmother has a picture about Jesus knocking on the door of the heart. His father buys a farm when he returns from the war and Harold, as the oldest, does much of the work. Being a daydreamer in school and having failed several grades, Harold quits school at age sixteen without being able to read. He wants to know God, though, and goes to a church service where he is saved. But he is unable to read the Gospel of John given him.

item.title: 2980 Odell Summer – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Crime, Jail
item.itunes:summary: The birth of his son, Joshua, motivates Odell to live under a false name to be with him. After the 9-11 terrorist attack, he prays and goes to church, but keeps smoking pot. Loretta leaves him and he prays, asking God to help. He’s arrested. While in jail he studies the Bible and prays for salvation. As a trustee, Odell witnesses to his grandfather. Danny, a Christian, befriends Odell. When he’s released, he and Danny rebuild a porch to make restitution for a burglary Odell once committed. He gets custody of his son after Loretta is arrested for bank robbery. He finishes Bible school and visits Loretta in prison.

item.title: 2979 Odell Summer – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Alcohol, Suicide
item.itunes:summary: Odell’s childhood is horrible: his father beats him and leaves him with uncles; his uncles give him marijuana; his mother vanishes periodically. Sent to a school for kids with behavior problems, he does well but goes back to drugs. He quits school to work, gets involved with Loretta who cannot be faithful and they come and go in each other’s lives. He loses his driver’s license, goes to jail and there a man comes and tells him about Jesus. Put on probation, he tries to stop sinning then gets angry at God when Loretta again fails him. The first part ends when his mother commits suicide and with Loretta expecting his child.

item.title: 2978 John Conley
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Divorce, Bitterness
item.itunes:summary: John’s father goes to prison and he grows up never having his dad hug him or say, “I love you.” His grandmother reads him the Psalms, but disillusionment leads him to rebel. He drinks, smokes and runs away at 13, returning to finish two years of high school. At 19 he marries a girl with a baby and they binge drink for several years. When her drunken relative threatens to shoot John, he leaves and gets a divorce two years later. Then he meets Pat, a woman with three children. They marry. A co-worker witnesses to John and he takes the children to church. One day he collapses unexpectedly and goes to the hospital where his co-worker’s pastor comes and leads him to Christ. He wants to be a pastor but his divorce precludes that option.

item.title: 2977 Percy Edmonds
item.itunes:subtitle: Gangs, Drugs, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Percy’s stepfather takes the family to church where they all profess faith when he is about ten. He sings in the choir and is an honor roll student in high school. But gangs terrorize him, and he goes to live with his grandparents in Chicago. There he falls under the sway of drugs and gangs. He sells drugs and is arrested, charged with a felony. He spends two-and-a-half years in prison, goes back to the gang and commits more crime. Re-arrested, he hears the gospel and commits his life to Christ. After prison, he goes to PGM and learns to serve. Now in Bible college.

item.title: 2976 Hans Nikoley
item.itunes:subtitle: German Immigrant, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: Hans and his family immigrate to the U.S. in 1952 when he’s 13. He works hard to lose his accent, falls in love with Mary and joins the Nevada Air National Guard after graduation. He learns to drink with friends and he and Mary wed. He quits the Guard and becomes a cabinet maker, then becomes a realtor. His excessive drinking, threats and a bad accident sends Mary into a breakdown and suicide attempt. Still he drinks. She and their two children are saved and she prays for Hans, who believes he is a Christian. He rebuffs all who witness to him. Finally, he goes to a Christian Businessmen meeting where he receives Christ. He goes to Bible college and into the pastorate.

item.title: 2975 David Walker
item.itunes:subtitle: A.D.D., Drugs, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Spinal Meningitis as a toddler leaves David with A.D.D. and he is given Ritalin, a drug that leaves him by turns disruptive or zombie-like. He is eleven when his dad dies, and at 13 he’s put in a home for disturbed youth. He feels rejected, runs away, addicted to drugs. He commits burglary, goes to prison and when he’s released he goes to California. For 13 years his is a life of crime, drugs and prison. He returns to Ohio and another four years of drugs. After he steals a computer from a job, he’s arrested. Alone in a cell, God speaks to his heart and he discovers that his purpose in life is to know and serve God. He gets a degree in counseling and now helps troubled youth at a Christian home for youth.

item.title: 2974 John Knoble – Part 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Actor, Missionary to Japan
item.itunes:summary: John feels called by God to give up acting and go to Bible school. Then he applies to a mission group and is accepted for Japan. In language school in Japan he meets Barb and they marry. A son and daughter are born to them. The conclusion of his testimony deals with their means of reaching the Japanese people, their furloughs home to gain support and God’s use of his use of acting to achieve those ends.

item.title: 2973 John Knoble – Part 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Actor, Aimlessness
item.itunes:summary: John learns drama and zest for life from his mother, who dies when he is 14. He joins in the Navy, returns home and goes to drama school in New York City. He works at Saks but returns home after five years. His father disdains acting, which John pursues, frequently changing jobs. He goes to Bible study and hears about a Jesus that his liberal church doesn’t teach. He prays for salvation. His father dies and the first part ends as he sees the need to choose between acting and following Christ.

item.title: 2972 Eric West Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Gangs, Stuttering
item.itunes:summary: After his salvation Eric smokes pot and struggles with demonic oppression until he repents. He goes to a Christian leadership training ranch in Kansas where he learns humility and trust in the Lord after some conflict with students. Then he goes to Wichita as an urban missionary. He dates Andrea but both waffle about commitment, she as a victim of incest, he because of his gang background and stuttering. They marry but his job losses create marital discord. They separate and he tries counseling. After two years they reconcile and adopt two babies. His stepfather calls to ask forgiveness

item.title: 2971 Eric West Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Gangs, Stuttering
item.itunes:summary: Until age six Eric is raised by his grandmother. He is molested several times, then his mother and stepfather take him to Watts in L.A. where he goes to Bible Clubs. He stutters badly, is ridiculed and bullied so he forms a gang, then joins the Crips at 13. He defies his abusive stepfather who leaves home. Eric’s mother drinks too much. He meets his real father and goes back to Arkansas several times. He drops out of school. Many deaths on the streets and in the family leave Eric with fear and he seeks his Bible teacher who leads him to Christ as the first part ends.

item.title: 2970 Kevin Noles
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Lies, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Kevin repeats a prayer at age nine and thinks he is saved but grows cold to God. As a teenager he starts drinking. A bad accident nearly kills him but he doesn’t repent. He starts using drugs, including cocaine and Meth. He lives with Debbie and they have a son that he neglects. He’s arrested and spends 7 months in jail. His parents pray for him, but he ruins his father’s business. Released, he starts going to church but keeps using drugs. He becomes a trucker. At revival in church he finally receives Christ and he and Debbie marry. Now in ministry at church.

item.title: 2969 Max Forman Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Jewish, Gambling, Immigrant
item.itunes:summary: When he is a baby, Max Forman’s father dies in Russia, so his mother brings the children to Philadelphia to live near her Orthodox Jewish parents. Proud but poor, Max becomes a coppersmith in the Naval shipyards when World War II comes. He marries Evelyn and they have a daughter. He rides to work with Tony, a Christian who witnesses constantly. Then Max changes jobs and the rides end. After he gets a car they drive past Tony’s house, stop by and hear more scripture. The next week Max and Evelyn stop by and end up praying for salvation.

item.title: 2968 Fred and Janey Smith Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger, Guilt, Pride
item.itunes:summary: Fred and Janey marry after college, and he pursues his love of acting. They move to Chicago where he buys a Great Dane dog and does well. He gets roles on “Unshackled!” But when hard times come, he keeps feeding the dog even though his children go without things. Angry at his fate, he talks with Jack Odell and Genie Price who urge him to receive Christ. He reads the Bible and prays for salvation. Convicted about the dog, he goes to a pastor, admits that he sold the previous dog that was dying, and then gives away his Great Dane to the man. Janey and daughters profess faith in Christ.

item.title: 2967 Matilda Wright
item.itunes:subtitle: Fear, Divorces, Welfare
item.itunes:summary: Tillie grows up feeling unloved and marries four different men searching for love. Each husband is wrong for her. She makes bad decisions based on emotions instead of facts and leaves them out of fear. Her first daughter is born out of wedlock but her second husband adopts the girl. Tillie has several nervous breakdowns and lives mostly on welfare, turning to her sister and husband for help from time to time. Finally, she goes home. Her oldest daughter receives Christ at 21. Seeing the joy, Tillie calls a pastor who tells her the gospel and she prays for salvation.

item.title: 2966 Don Hoke
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionary to Japan
item.itunes:summary: After Don’s father gets saved when Don is in high school, his parents put him in a Christian high school for his senior year, and Don gets saved. He goes to a Christian college, where he’s called to the mission field. But World War II interferes. He’s invited to pastor a church while he’s in graduate school and meets Martha. They marry. Don becomes assistant to the president of a Christian college, which seems like a detour. But God has plans. After Don goes to Japan on a mission survey trip, the couple go there as missionaries. Don helps found a Japanese Christian college and radio station. After 22 years he then helps with the world evangelism conference. Then he became a pastor again. Now with the Lord.

item.title: 2965 Martha Hoke
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionary, Japan, Switzerland
item.itunes:summary: Martha’s father leads her to Christ when she is ten. Like him, she learns to take a stand for her faith and commits to being a missionary as a teenager. She travels as a soloist with an evangelist, then goes to Wheaton College where she meets Don, a pastor. They marry and go to Japan as missionaries in 1952 with their two sons. In spite of much illness, they stay and Don helps found a Christian Bible College. After 22 years they go to Lausanne to help with world evangelism. Their faith never falters even when their oldest son is killed in a plane crash. Still serving the Lord in retirement.
item.description: Martha’s father leads her to Christ when she is ten. Like him, she learns to take a stand for her faith and commits to being a missionary as a teenager. She travels as a soloist with an evangelist, then goes to Wheaton College where she meets Don, a pastor. They marry and go to Japan as missionaries in 1952 with their two sons. In spite of much illness, they stay and Don helps found a Christian Bible College. After 22 years they go to Lausanne to help with world evangelism. Their faith never falters even when their oldest son is killed in a plane crash. Still serving the Lord in retirement.

Their faith never falters even when their oldest son is killed in a plane crash. Still serving the Lord in retirement.

item.title: 2964 Alexander Thompson Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Brawling, Marital Restoration
item.itunes:summary: Alex grows up with alcohol and lives to get drunk in high school. He drops out to join the Navy where he learns to box and gets into numerous brawls. Drunk, he drives through a bridge railing into a muddy inlet but survives. He takes “the pledge”, moves around but can’t quit drinking even after he marries Eileen. She leaves him and he is so drunk he hears voices. A.A. helps him get sober and he goes to church where he hears the gospel and receives Christ. They move to Idaho & Montana where he teaches the Bible. Now in ministry in Florida.

item.title: 2963 David Chapin
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger, Alcohol, Failure
item.itunes:summary: Dave grows up with an alcoholic father and a mother who prays, reads the Bible and takes him to church. He fakes a conversion at age nine to please her. At thirteen he lives with a farmer for three years and learns many valuable lessons. Dave goes home and takes up drinking with friends. He joins the army and marries, but his drinking destroys his work and his marriage. The army gives him a less-than honorable discharge. His marriage ends and he’s arrested for writing bad checks. His nephew’s sudden death leads Dave to call a Christian cousin, then he prays for salvation. He quit drinking, meets and marries Mary, but the anger persists until pastors help him use scripture to root out the past.

item.title: 2962 David Aponte Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Drinking
item.itunes:summary: When he is three, David’s life is saved by the family dog. His mother takes him to church and he learns about God. He prays for peace after he argues too much as a teenager, and sees his father recover from a heart attack. But he turns away from God, Who doesn’t seem to answer his prayers. He drinks, joins the army, and realizes that God did answer his prayer for peace. But drugs and rock music lure him away again. When a fellow soldier is murdered, David once again is jarred into reality. He marries his girlfriend, gets out of the army and goes home. There he goes to church with his parents and finally surrenders to Christ. Still in the national guard, he witnesses to other soldiers.

item.title: 2961 Chuck Cofty
item.itunes:subtitle: Vietnam Vet, Marine, Alcoholism
item.itunes:summary: Chuck grows us with an alcoholic dad and learns to fight. He joins the Marines and marries Lenora two months after they meet. She is horrified by his drinking and fighting. He becomes an officer, trains in counterintelligence and goes to Vietnam. In Hue he survives the Tet Offensive, escaping several traps for eight days. Finally he is rescued. Back home he debriefs POWs when the war ends and their horror stories break him. Lenora has received Christ and prays for him as he weeps for days. She leads him to Christ and Chuck declares his salvation in church. He retires from the Marine Corps and becomes a preacher. Now in evangelism.

item.title: 2960 “Terrson”
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Adultery, Forgiveness
item.itunes:summary: Terrson’s dad has a mistress, causing turmoil in the home. Shy and fearful, Terrson turns to alcohol as a teenager. She tries drugs but prefers alcohol. An alcoholic in her twenties, she struggles against drinking. She marries another alcoholic and they have two children. She manages to quit while she’s pregnant. She reads Leviticus and tries to follow God’s law so she’ll go to heaven but can’t. Her sister-in-law’s dad tells her how to get saved and Terrson prays and is born again that night. Her husband rejects Jesus and divorces her. Terrson learns to forgive him and the other woman. She remarries and she and her husband are serving the Lord.

item.title: 2959 Bette Hammang Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Crime, Drugs, Promiscuity
item.itunes:summary: Bette drops heroin for Meth and her life becomes even more degrading. She’s arrested for burglary and her father refuses to bail her out or get an attorney. Faced with prison, she goes into hiding with a friend whose husband finds them. He sends Bette home on a bus and she decides to turn herself in. In jail she experiences the Lord and is born again. She goes to Bible study and worship and when she’s released on probation, she keeps going to church and helps with ministry to the homeless. Her faith helps her through drug recovery. She meets Kevin and they marry. Now in prison ministry.

item.title: 2958 Bette Hammang Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Jail
item.itunes:summary: When she’s sixteen her mother dies and Bette becomes pregnant. She marries but is divorced after two years. Irresponsible, she becomes addicted to pot and parties, smuggles drugs from Mexico and is busted. She spends 30 days in jail but returns to drugs. She has a friend, Tracy, who parties with her and they try heroin and get mixed up with bikers. Trying to kick the habit, they go to church and Bette goes forward for salvation but doesn’t turn from her sin. She falls for a convict, Zack, in San Quentin and falls away from God. She and the biker marry but he is unfaithful and cruel. She leaves him after fifteen years. The first part ends when Tracy ends their friendship to kick drugs and Bette tries Meth.

item.title: 2957 Kevin Hammang
item.itunes:subtitle: Crime, Drugs, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Growing up, Kevin fights to protect a brother with cerebral palsy. He starts drinking and using drugs at fifteen, is arrested at 16 & again at 17 so he joins the Navy & serves in Vietnam. Then he orchestrates his discharge by going AWOL. Back home he gets in trouble with drug dealers, flees to Oregon where a drug buddy kills a man with a gun Kevin has stolen. He’s sentenced to life in prison but paroled after five years. He’s in and out of marriage and many prisons because of heroin until he faces another life sentence. He prays, asking God to save him. A cold-hearted parole board member miraculously gives him a break, but he continues to struggle until he commits his life completely to Christ. Now in prison ministry.

item.title: 2956 Bret Monday
item.itunes:subtitle: Learning Disability, Molestation
item.itunes:summary: Bret has a grand mal seizure at age four that leaves him with a learning disability. A sister’s interest in the occult brings evil spirits into his life and he sets fires and steals. He is beaten for something his brother did. In high school friends try to lead him astray but with special help Bret graduates. He goes to church and is baptized but doesn’t understand the gospel until he’s 19 when he prays for salvation. He serves in the Navy where he volunteers to be the lay religious leader. Afterward he graduates Bible college. His brother writes a letter asking forgiveness for letting Bret take his punishment.

item.title: 2955 Bruce Frye
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Musician, Evangelist
item.itunes:summary: Bruce dreams of fame and fortune as a country music star. He smokes, drinks and uses drugs at fifteen, leaves home at 17 but manages to graduate. He’s arrested for burglary but given probation and a fine. He and his brother form a band and do well, but his brother is saved and quits. Bitter, Bruce goes it alone, does well, then goes to Nashville while his brother, Sammy, becomes a pastor. Sammy’s witness and prayers and Bruce’s misery at failing to succeed lead to Bruce finally praying to receive Christ. He marries and is now an evangelist.

item.title: 2954 “Dallas” Morales Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Family Feud, Forgiveness
item.itunes:summary: After receiving Christ, Dallas goes home. He and his dad fight and his dad again tries to kill him. Dallas goes back to his brother in New Orleans to be discipled. Returning home, he visits his dad, now diseased with diabetes. His dad rejects the gospel but accepts help through a partial foot amputation, hyperbaric oxygen treatment and dialysis. Dallas offers his kidney and the transplant is successful. When his dad keeps drinking, Dallas leaves for seminary, where he marries after graduation. Threatened with a leg amputation, his dad receives Christ; and Dallas and he have a loving relationship until his dad’s death. Dallas is now an evangelist.

item.title: 2953 "Dallas" Morales Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Family Feud
item.itunes:summary: Dallas is an Army brat whose mother prays for her family. Dallas worships his volatile, hard-drinking father who has fought in three wars and was shot four times. His dad retires and goes to college with Dallas who is using and selling drugs. They drink together in bars; but during a trip with friends, his drunken dad shoots Dallas at close range as they argue. Miraculously, the bullet doesn’t kill Dallas. But his love turns to hatred and both men continue to feud. His older brother invites him to Louisiana where his brother witnesses to Dallas who prays to receive Christ. The first part ends as he refuses to forgive his father.

item.title: 2952 “Peter Lee” Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Persecution, Chinese, Communism
item.itunes:summary: Peter is detained a year, then allowed to return to college. The Communists trick people into airing grievances and Peter does. Again sent to labor camp for nearly four years, he is brainwashed and tries to deny God. They release him and he finishes college but is sent to labor camp for another year for listening to English radio to learn English. Still persecuted, he finally meets Chang and they marry; but the persecution continues. As a scholar he goes to the U.S. where other Chinese believers help him see God’s mercy and grace. He recommits his life to Christ, brings his family to the U.S. and goes to seminary. Now a missionary to the Chinese worldwide.

item.title: 2951 “Peter Lee” Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Persecution, Chinese, Communism
item.itunes:summary: Peter grows up in Communist China, where his mother dedicates him to the Lord and takes him to church. He is saved during revival when he is 16. Although he is an outstanding physic student, he is denied a place in the best university, the beginning of his persecution. At college he witnesses to students and leads 17 to Christ. He persuades two pastors to leave the state church. During summer vacation his pastor is arrested and then Peter is told to return to college where he is accused of being anti-revolutionary. He is interrogated ruthlessly and then encouraged to write about his faith which is used against him. The first part ends as he is taken to labor camp.

item.title: 2950 Mary Goloversic Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Fear, Enabler
item.itunes:summary: Mary’s physical and emotional pain is so great she bangs her head against walls and attempts suicide. Her pastor often rescues her. Finally, she leaves home, taking a bus to Chicago where she goes to Pacific Garden Mission. She stays for three months, getting wise counseling and seeing a doctor for exploratory surgery. When she goes home, her doctor won’t perform corrective surgery. Still in pain, she regresses, bangs her head and fights with Jim. Finally, a specialist operates and corrects her problems. She learns to make wise decisions and writes books to help others.

item.title: 2949 Mary Goloversic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Illness, Fear
item.itunes:summary: As an only child, Mary grows up with a negative, protective mother, who sends her to church alone. Mary longs for acceptance. She marries Jim, joins his church and they go to Spain for two years, where Mary has a miscarriage and the marriage deteriorates as he spends time at bars. Back home, they got college degrees and have three sons. Mary suffers from chronic colitis and nearly dies in childbirth. She is hospitalized in a psychiatric ward where a friend visits and invites her to Bible study. After two years she prays to receive Christ. The first part ends as she tell her husband she is leaving his church.

She marries Jim, joins his church and they go to Spain for two years, where Mary has a miscarriage and the marriage deteriorates as he spends time at bars. Back home, they got college degrees and have three sons. Mary suffers from chronic colitis and nearly dies in childbirth. She is hospitalized in a psychiatric ward where a friend visits and invites her to Bible study. After two years she prays to receive Christ. The first part ends as she tell her husband she is leaving his church.

item.title: 2948 Jerry Kaifetz
item.itunes:subtitle: Jewish, Sports, New Age
item.itunes:summary: Jerry grows up in a Jewish family. Trained in schools in France and the U.S., he loves adventure sports, especially downhill ski racing. He also tries kayaking on the Colorado River and scuba diving. He drops out of college to sell LSD, goes to jail for six months and then follows a new age cult. Disillusioned, he spends many years as an instructor at resorts around the world. But he is unable to reach God. He finally prays, asking God to show him a church to attend, and the next day two women knock on his door. He goes to their church, and the pastor leads him to Christ. He goes to Bible college, gets married, writes a book and is still following Christ.

item.title: 2947 Carolyn Knapschaefer
item.itunes:subtitle: Abortion, Selfishness, Adoption
item.itunes:summary: Carolyn is adopted at seven months, grows up with loving but non-Christian parents. Carolyn rebels as a teenager, smokes, drinks and gets pregnant. The family doctor tells her to get an abortion. She resists but is so sick that she has the abortion and nearly dies. She aborts a second baby out of fear even though she is engaged. The marriage lasts a year. Led astray by a new-age friend and church, she spends nine years in drinking and immorality. Then she meets Rick, gets engaged, becomes pregnant, and a Christian doctor dissuades her from a third abortion. She and Rick marry, have the baby and fight because both are selfish. She meets a Christian, goes to church, gets saved and Rick repents. After her adoptive mom dies, Carolyn finds her birth mother. Now counsels in a crisis pregnancy center.

item.title: 2946 Anne Carlo Classic Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Prodigal, Prison Ministry
item.itunes:summary: Ann and her husband begin ministry to neighborhood kids. Through His Word, God prompts Anne to visit those in prison, which—like Jonah, she resists. Finally, she obeys and discovers great joy and purpose after she is widowed. Her jail ministry lasts for three decades until old age puts her in a nursing home, where many celebrate her 100th birthday. Two months later she dies and the mantle passes to one of her “adopted” kids.

item.title: 2945 Anne Carlo Classic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Repression, Self-Centeredness, Prison-Ministry
item.itunes:summary: Anne grows up with a repressive mother, a kind stepfather and a grandmother who reads the Bible and takes her to church. Anne wants to be a missionary but secular teachers destroy her faith and she goes to business college instead. Her mother quashes successive attempts to date and then sends Anne to a delinquent girl’s school. Embittered, Anne lives to have fun. During the Depression she learns the grocery business, dates Fred, and marries him before he goes off to the war. Her Aunt is saved. When Fred comes home, their marriage falters because of Anne’s willfulness. But they remarry and continue to struggle. The first part ends when Anne comes to Christ.

item.title: 2944 Kazuo & Hisako Ozaki
item.itunes:subtitle: Japanese, World War II, HCJB translator
item.itunes:summary: Bombs destroy Kazuo’s home during the war but he to goes to high school where he learns English, becoming a translator after graduation. Asked to translate sermons for a missionary pastor, he is convicted and receives Christ. A chaplain sponsors him to Bible college where he meets Hisako and they marry after he graduates. He works for Pacific Broadcasting Association, producing radio programs, then is called to Quito, Ecuador to translate and produce Japanese programs. He and Hisako serve for nearly four decades until her death in 2006. He is still in ministry.

item.title: 2943 "Tammy"
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Abortion, Fear
item.itunes:summary: Tammy and her older sister are molested by their stepfather while their mother works. She accepts Christ as Savior at age six but the family quits going to church. Her sister accuses the stepdad, but their mother thinks she’s lying. She marries, tells her husband of the abuse, and they go to the prosecutor. Tammy is removed from her parents’ custody, but her mother threatens to disown her, so she returns home. She meets Kurt, a follower of Christ. But she dates a college guy who gets her pregnant. She has an abortion and drinks to ease the guilt. She plans suicide, but Kurt comes back into her life and persuades her to go to Bible college with him. There she finds the courage to confess her past and they marry.

item.title: 2942 Earl Wafford Jr.
item.itunes:subtitle: Pride, Profanity, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: Earl’s mother takes him to church but his dad, a Navy deep sea diver, is mean and Earl fears him. His mother and several pastors have Earl pray for salvation but don’t mention Jesus Christ. He grows up fearing God but Jesus is a curse to him. He dates Shirlee but they break up when he goes into the Navy where he does well. Various people have him pray, asking God’s forgiveness for his sins without mentioning Christ. He goes to church with his boss, goes forward, and again doesn’t hear about Jesus. Finally, a co-worker urges him to attend church where, after several months, Earl stops resisting and surrenders to Christ. Now in several outreach ministries.

item.title: 2941 "Stephanie"
item.itunes:subtitle: Prostitution, Drugs, Abuse
item.itunes:summary: Stephanie’s dad is killed in Vietnam. Babysitters molest her and she discovers pornography. When her mother remarries and has a new baby, Stephanie rebels at 13, runs away, lies and fakes a suicide attempt. Her parents put her in various treatments, adding to her feeling of rejection. At 15 she’s raped; at 16 she starts using drugs and tries prostitution. She’s arrested and an officer tries to warn her. She tries to change but meets a black man who turns her into a prostitute. He tries to kill her many times. After three years she leaves him, meets Luke and they marry, he hoping to save her. But she cannot change, still needing the attention of men. She has four children and suffers panic attacks. Then she is saved and Jesus Christ changes her.

item.title: 2940 Bobby Jackson Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Cocaine, Music
item.itunes:summary: After his mother’s death, Bobby and his father are estranged over the family house. Bobby builds a sound studio, produces records and does well until a girlfriend lures him into cocaine use. Rapidly, he loses everything to his addiction. He borrows, steals and hates himself; but calls a radio preacher who prays for him. When he steals a friend’s VCR, he goes into drug rehab. There a Christian group comes in and reads the Bible. Bobby prays for salvation. He is reconciled to his father before his father’s death. He marries and starts his own agency. Now a church deacon and pianist.

item.title: 2939 Bobby Jackson Classic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Music, Abuse, Black
item.itunes:summary: Bobby, the youngest child, adores his mother and fears his drunken father, who is kind when sober. When he’s sixteen, Bobby confronts his dad who backs down. Bobby’s musical talent is developed by a voice trainer and he’s accepted in Chicago’s Lyric Opera. His mother takes him to church and he avoids drugs, but he is morally loose, fathering various children. At 28 he signs a record contract, getting a financial bonus that he spends on himself and his mother’s house. Six months later she dies, leaving him bereft as the first part ends.

item.title: 2938 Patricia Patton Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Rage, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: Working as a barmaid, Pat meets Richard and they marry. Both drink, and Pat becomes a mean drunk because of the rage within her. Defying him one night, she is hit by a van and nearly killed. Being hospitalized leads her to think about eternity, but she goes back to drinking. Blackouts and depression lead her to seek psychiatric help and shock therapy. Her daughter has become a Christian and talks to her about God. Pat argues, so her daughter suggests she talk with her pastor. Pat does and he makes her think about eternity. After her grandson is born, Pat talks to God. She faces possible cancer that leads to her salvation cry. Still faithful.

item.title: 2937 Patricia Patton Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Abandonment, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: Pat’s real parents give her to friends who adopt her; but her adoptive dad dies when she is eight. Her drunken adoptive mom lets men abuse Pat. She abandons Pat, who goes to a children’s home where she hears the gospel and hopes God will bring back her mom. When He doesn’t, she despairs and quits believing. A self-pitying, angry girl, she leaves the home at 17, tries college, tries suicide and several times commits herself to a psychiatric ward. Hooked on drugs, she again tries suicide. A friend rescues her and they live together. She gets pregnant and they marry but fight. Pat’s entanglement with her real family leads to her leaving her husband as the first part ends.

item.title: 2936 Jerry Harpool Classic Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Fractured Family, African Missionary
item.itunes:summary: Jerry goes to Bible college in Chicago where he meets Jan. They date for six months until he leaves for Swaziland. After five months he asks her by telegram to marry him, and she accepts and comes to Africa. They marry and he becomes headmaster at the Christian school that his mission founded. The king’s son attends and Jerry longs to meet the king. Eventually, the king’s son arranges an audience, giving Jerry sermon material. After 20 years in Africa they return home so their daughters can attend college in the U.S. Now pastor of a church in Ohio.

item.title: 2935 Jerry Harpool Classic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Fear, Dishonesty, False Humility
item.itunes:summary: Jerry lives in the shadow of his older brother and their mom’s dominance. Ridiculed at school, he sees himself as a victim. At 13 he follows his brother to the altar for salvation, but remains unchanged. Jerry helps his history teacher grade papers and Jerry changes grades for classmates. Confronted by the teacher, he lies. Seeing his deceitful heart, he is genuinely saved at 17. After graduation he finishes college, becomes an English teacher and does well teaching in high school. He then leads Bible study and friends encourage him to go to Bible school, which angers his mother. The first part ends as Jerry goes off to Bible college.

item.title: 2934 Thomas Castellaw
item.itunes:subtitle: Family Pressure, Germany, Missionary
item.itunes:summary: Tom’s mother, married four times, won’t go to church because her father is a deacon, so Tom grows up without faith. When a co-worker invites him to church, his parents refuse but Tom goes. Eventually, he prays for salvation, but his love for the Lord leads the family to think he’s in a cult and they move to another state. For three years Tom falls away from God. He graduates, joins the Army and goes to Germany where he see such immorality that he goes back to church where he learns that he is still saved. He meets Angie, they marry and serve the Lord together. His mother professes faith in Christ before she dies. He and Angie are missionaries in Germany.

item.title: 2933 Angie Castellaw
item.itunes:subtitle: False Teaching, Pride, Germany
item.itunes:summary: Angie’s parents divorce when she is ten, and she grows up without her Italian father. Her mother works, so they go to church only on Christmas Eve. At an advanced academic school she learns English and then goes to England when she’s 17 as an exchange student, where she falls in love with philosophy and becomes an atheist. Back home, a Christian challenges a teacher about disrespecting Jesus, and Angie goes to church with a friend where an evangelist shares the gospel, which Angie fails to accept. At the university she plans to be a journalist and change the world, but her old friend gets saved and helps Angie understand God’s love. She opens her heart to Christ. A Scottish exchange students disciples her. She witnesses to her former teacher and leads her mother to Christ.

At the university she plans to be a journalist and change the world, but her old friend gets saved and helps Angie understand God’s love. She opens her heart to Christ. A Scottish exchange students disciples her. She witnesses to her former teacher and leads her mother to Christ.

item.title: 2932 Darwin Merrill Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Disillusionment, Missionary
item.itunes:summary: Dar and a friend go to California to evangelize but are ill-prepared. Dar meets a missionary who impacts his life but who is later martyred in Brazil. Back home he is disillusioned by an unfair believer and a charlatan, but his pastor’s sermon revitalizes him and he dedicates himself unconditionally to Christ. He goes to Bible college, becomes assistant pastor and marries Elaine. They pastor a church for 16 years, during which they travel to India and feel called as missionaries to unreached areas. Still in ministry.

item.title: 2931 Darwin Merrill Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Poverty, Abuse, Missions
item.itunes:summary: Dar grows up in poverty. He helps his dad make beer and teaches his friends to do the same. His mother takes him to church once when he is five. He cooks dinner and irons for his younger sister because his parents work. He caddies at age eleven with Johnny, a boy who is faithful in church. Dar has a gift of humor and enters a contest that he wins over thousands; but he turns down a contract to go to Hollywood. Too poor for college, he works at the battery factory where his dad works and Dar is made the manager. Then he buys a gas station. Johnny invites him to church where Dar gives his life to Christ. The first part ends after he leads his sister to the Lord.

item.title: 2930 Nathan Raymond Stigler
item.itunes:subtitle: Anxiety, Alcohol, Profanity
item.itunes:summary: Nathan grows up with a twin brother, a fear of God and a family devoted to religion. Going to parochial school he hears stories of God’s anger but also hears Bible stories read aloud. His anxiety about death causes heart palpitations. Nathan talks to and experiences God at ten, but his faith is not nurtured; and religious rituals, peer pressure and his fears squash his love for God. He drinks in high school, swears to be accepted and takes a job as carpenter after graduation. A friend mentions Revelation, and Nathan reads and becomes convicted of his sin. On the job he cries out to God and finally asks God to save him. His father rejects the gospel but Nathan continues to follow Christ.

item.title: 2929 Ashish Majmundar
item.itunes:subtitle: Hindu, Cricket, Idols
item.itunes:summary: Ashish is born into a Hindu family in Bombay. He idolizes first cricket, then a rock star. He is selected for a near-professional cricket team that goes to England; but when he fails to make his college team, he despairs, drinks alcohol and tries hashish. Then he and a friend volunteer at a blind organization and Ashish goes to a camp for the blind in North Carolina. There he meets Emily and is introduced to Christ, Whom he rejects. He works on his Master’s degree in the U.S., finally receives Christ and marries Emily. Getting his Master’s in Bible, hoping to go back to India to share Christ.

item.title: 2928 George Snow Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Gambling, Lying, Fear
item.itunes:summary: George quits school in the seventh grade to work and slides into gambling with dice. Then he works for a gambling joint and is taught to cheat at cards. His mother prays for him and asks him to take her to Pacific Garden Mission. He does but ignores the truth he hears. After 25 years of cheating people, he begins to lose, lives in fear for several days before going back to the mission where he gives his life to Christ. He shares his testimony there for years, well into his eighties. The story is set around 1900.

item.title: 2927 Susan Duncan
item.itunes:subtitle: Hypocrisy, Anger, Self Deception
item.itunes:summary: Susan goes forward at five and is baptized but doesn’t remember and grows up doubting her salvation although her father is a pastor. She quietly rebels, lying to her parents and sneaking out to movies. She goes to Bible college but her true nature lurks near the surface. She cheats once in college. She marries Larry who becomes a pastor. Home-schooling their four children, her angry outbursts increase and she fears death. She confides in a prayer partner who gives her a book, and as Susan studies the Bible, she realizes she is a sinner and repents.

item.title: 2926 Billy Comfort Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Family Dysfunction, Depression
item.itunes:summary: Bill witnesses to his family, but only his brother, Ron, responds. Bill gets an early discharge, goes to Bible college and persuades Ron to go to the Christian high school attached to his college. Coming home during summer, he meets Shirley. As a missionary in Honduras, he gets amoebic dysentery and nearly dies. He goes into depression that school year. The next summer he reads a book that helps, and gives the book to other students, incurring the displeasure of school authorities. But he graduates, marries Shirley and pastors a church in Norfolk. Shirley fights breast cancer at the same time that Bill’s stepmother dies of cancer. After Roxie dies, Bill’s dad professes faith after hearing Ron preach. Both brothers now presidents of Christian colleges.

item.title: 2925 Billy Comfort Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Fighting, Poverty, Dysfunctional Family
item.itunes:summary: Bill’s dad teaches him to fight as a child. His dad is a drunk; his mother is unstable and abusive. She neglects him and his siblings and sends them to their father who has divorced her and remarried. The family goes by bus from New York to North Carolina where Bill prospers as a teenager, becomes a leader and gets a job. Then his dad abruptly goes back to New York, taking his sons along. Bill quits school, joins the army and there he hears a street preacher and yields his life to Christ. The first part ends as he witnesses to his brother, Ron.

item.title: 2924 Tim Conti Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Prison, FBI informant
item.itunes:summary: After his arrest, Tim becomes an F.B.I. informant, going undercover. He serves time in jail, then goes to drug treatment. While on probation he goes to church on Mother’s Day where he meets Hylea. She befriends him, writing to him in jail. After the indictments are served, he proposes to Hylea and they marry before he is sentenced to prison for 30 months. Kept in isolation, he weeps and reads the Bible, then after a fit of rage, he experiences God’s presence. He’s moved to a prison in Texas where he meets a believer who mentors him. After release he reunites with friend, Steve, in ministry before becoming an evangelist and then returning to a secular job and serving his church as a devoted layman.

item.title: 2923 Tim Conti Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Drugs, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Tim and his older brother are molested by their stepfather who dies when Tim is 12. Both boys get into drugs and after his brother attempts suicide, Tim rebels and is expelled from school twice. His mother turns to Christ and puts him in a Christian reform school where he continues to rebel. His real father dies and Tim feels yet more alienated. Although he has professed faith in Christ several times, he doesn’t deal with the pain of his past. He becomes addicted to cocaine in college, drops out, gets in trouble with the law and threatens suicide. Then he slips into dealing cocaine. The first part ends when he is arrested.
