item.title: 2922 Rose King Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Repression, Homeless
item.itunes:summary: Rose is one of ten children living in poverty when their home is destroyed by fire. Her father thwarts her dream of being a nurse, refusing to let her work or finish high school. When she leaves home at 18, she goes to Boston and falls in with a dissolute man who lures her into alcohol and immorality. After many years she finally leaves him when he beats her. She goes to Chicago but slides into a worse life of drunkenness. She often goes to jail where a PGM woman visits and takes her to the mission. After many relapses, Rose yields her life to Christ.

item.title: 2921 Michael Sean Walsh
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Informant, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Mike’s parents divorce when he is 12, and he drifts into using and dealing drugs. A friend’s uncle shares the gospel. When his girlfriend is arrested, he becomes an informant to the police, yet he continues to deal and burglarize with a friend, who plans to rob the safe of a local business. Mike’s girlfriend is released from jail, saving him from being considered as a suspect in a crime that ends in murder. Mike-the-informer becomes a pariah who attempts suicide until God speaks to his heart, and he listens. He reads the Bible at his uncle’s place in the mountains, gets his GED and joins the USAF, becoming a trainer of dogs and a SWAT instructor. Afterward, he joins the Houston Police Department, serving for 20 years. Now seeking full-time ministry.

item.title: 2920 Chad Klunder
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Fear, Suicide
item.itunes:summary: After his parents divorce, Chad drifts into trouble, shoplifting. A buddy tells him about hell. But he quits going to church at fifteen and starts using drugs and alcohol. He denies God’s existence even when he has a near-fatal accident on a four-wheeler. He’s arrested several times for underage drinking. Then he and his friends steal things and are turned in to the police. They flee to Ohio where Chad has a surreal drug experience and believes he has sold his soul to the devil. They go to Phoenix where he listens to radio preachers and decides to turn himself in by going home. He’s sentenced to jail and drug treatment where he meets a Christian but still feels in bondage. Another believer hands him a tract and then comes to disciple Chad who finally prays for God’s forgiveness. Married with three sons.

item.title: 2919 Patrick Gosnell
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Dysfunctional Family, Suicide
item.itunes:summary: Pat’s dad abandons the family and his mother is a drunk. He and his brother live with uncles or in foster homes. His brother teaches him to drink and use drugs; then his brother goes to prison for robbery and Pat drops out of school at 13. He meets Terry, an undercover cop who talks to him about God and the Bible. But Terry smokes pot and leaves town after a drug bust. Pat goes back to drugs. When Terry returns, he’s addicted to cocaine and ends up killing himself in front of Pat, who becomes suicidal. He marries Deanna but can’t quit drugs, so she leaves him, and their pastor sends Pat to a rescue mission. He surrenders to Christ, quits drugs and witnesses to his dying father. Pat is preparing for full time ministry

item.title: 2918 Melvin James
item.itunes:subtitle: Korean War, Womanizing, Pride
item.itunes:summary: Adopted as an infant, Mel joins the church to please his Mother. In high school and college he cares more about girls than studies. He joins the Air Force after Pearl Harbor and trains as a bombardier; but the war ends before he goes overseas. Back in college he marries Marj, parties with friends but doesn’t commit adultery. He re-enlists in the Air Force to fight in Korea, where he again womanizes and has several close calls. Back home he and Marj become active in church, but Mel realizes that the church teaches falsehoods about the Bible, and they seek a new church, where the pastor leads him to Christ. He & Marj help missionaries; their daughter is a missionary in Mexico.

item.title: 2917 David Wolfe
item.itunes:subtitle: Selfishness, Motorcycles, Divorce
item.itunes:summary: Dave grows up an only child with asthma. His parents move to the Southwest for Dave’s health. They send him to a private boys’ school where he learns to cuss and drink. He races a hotrod and breaks many driving laws. Then he buys a motorcycle and risks his life. He flunks out of college because of parties, crashes a friend’s car, then decides to go back to college to study agriculture. He goes to church, hoping God will help him graduate. He and a drunken farmer crash a pickup with trailer but aren’t hurt badly. He marries a Mormon who leaves him after nine months, and Dave threatens suicide. Then he talks with a pastor who leads him to Christ. Dave goes to Bible college where he meets Bev and they marry.

He races a hotrod and breaks many driving laws. Then he buys a motorcycle and risks his life. He flunks out of college because of parties, crashes a friend’s car, then decides to go back to college to study agriculture. He goes to church, hoping God will help him graduate. He and a drunken farmer crash a pickup with trailer but aren’t hurt badly. He marries a Mormon who leaves him after nine months, and Dave threatens suicide. Then he talks with a pastor who leads him to Christ. Dave goes to Bible college where he meets Bev and they marry.

item.title: 2916 Wayne Brown
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Drugs, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Wayne’s parents drink and fight until he is eight when they go to church and profess faith in Christ. But his mother becomes disillusioned and they quit attending when he is twelve. He follows the world, learns karate and hurts others. He drinks, loses his license and his front teeth when he brashly rides a bull that horns him. His principal, a pastor, tries to warn him. He is badly burned by hot tar, promises to get back to God but doesn’t. Unable to work, he gets into drug dealing, has many close calls and even flies to Colombia, where God warns him again. Finally, he goes back to church, commits his life to Christ and walks away from drug dealing. Married with three daughters, he is faithful in ministry.

item.title: 2915 Jack Franklin Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Music, Failure
item.itunes:summary: As the youngest in a family of five, Jack grows up feeling like a loser. When he gains too much weight, a doctor puts him on amphetamines, launching fifteen years of drug addiction. He often fakes illness to get morphine at hospitals. He forms a music group at fourteen and in college, then strikes out on his own, moving to Colorado. But his drug abuse ends his music career, and he works at a publishing house where he meets a Christian. After numerous accidents, his brother’s witness and then a near-fatal time of wandering in a blizzard, he calls his friend who leads him to Christ in 1971. Jack is still an evangelist.

item.title: 2914 Earl Ankron
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Heavy Metal Music
item.itunes:summary: Earl’s dad doesn’t drink but his mother drinks and uses drugs daily. She won’t let him join Cub Scouts because she doesn’t believe in God. At age eleven he begins listening to heavy metal music and the lyrics lead him astray. He cuts school, hangs out in bars and leads a degenerate life, quitting school at 16. He attempts suicide and hates his life and himself. He meets Amy and they live together. She urges him to quit drinking & drugs. A friend invites him to church and he goes. Then a man from church comes to his job and leads him to Christ. His family ridicules him, but Earl is still in ministry.

item.title: 2913 Mary Anderson
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, Abuse, Hatred
item.itunes:summary: Her father’s murder when she is seven leads to her mother’s mental breakdown and the dispersion of the four sisters. Several uncles try to molest Mary. She and a younger sister end up with their maternal grandmother, who is poor but firm and loving. Mary longs to kill the murderer. Her sister runs away but Mary does well in school, graduating salutatorian. Her grandmother dies that day, and Mary weds her high school sweetheart who is abusive. Finally, Mary takes their two children and divorces him. She drinks to ease the pain, meets Jay and they marry. After he quits drinking, she talks with his sister, who leads her to Christ. She is able to forgive the murderer and serve.

item.title: 2912 Frank Hampshire Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Drug Addiction, Crime, Hate
item.itunes:summary: Frank joins the army but is so undisciplined that he is discharged honorably. Back home he meets Cheryl. They fall in love and marry and she has a calming effect. He works hard, goes to college but becomes briefly hooked on prescription drugs for stress. He works for a biomedical firm that moves them to Georgia where the owner prays for Frank one day. He’s transferred to South Carolina, and a preacher comes to their house, invites them to church to hear evangelist, Phil Kidd. The last night they go and Frank is convicted but not saved. The pastor and evangelist visit again and Frank submits to Christ. His dad professes faith before he dies. Frank forgives his mother and is now in ministry.

item.title: 2911 Frank Hampshire Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Hatred, Abuse, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: The first part begins as Frank visits an inmate in prison. He relates how he was bullied by his older brother and hoped the brother would get killed in Vietnam, then felt responsible when this happened. He is expelled from school many times; his mother threatens to kill him and banishes him from home except to sleep. His father doesn’t know what to do. Frank goes into a black depression, and at 15 sees a psychiatrist at school. He steals, lies and is permanently expelled for violence. He and a friend smoke pot and steal marijuana from a grower. The first part ends as Frank, now saved, witnesses to the inmate.

item.title: 2910 “Valerie”
item.itunes:subtitle: Parental Guidance Suggested - Sexual Abuse, Adultery, Abortion
item.itunes:summary: Valerie grows up on a large dairy farm. Her older brother molests her until she’s nine and refuses. Her father dies when she is sixteen and she and her mother move to a small town where Valerie blossoms but has illicit encounters. She works to stay in college for two years, then meets a man in the air force, thinks she’s in love and talks him into marriage. They are miserable. He’s transferred to Germany where he confesses to meeting prostitutes and selling on the black market. She forgives and they return to the states where she has an affair with a man and both leave their spouses. When she gets pregnant and has an abortion, both are guilt-ridden; but they marry. A woman visits, wanting to take their children to church. Finally, they go and Valerie unburdens to the pastor. After several moves, she hears the gospel and prays for salvation.

item.title: 2909 Samuel Hyde
item.itunes:subtitle: Korean War, Rebellion, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: Sam is raised on a North Carolina farm near a godly grandmother. He goes forward at age thirteen during revival but no one explains how to follow Christ. At fifteen he abandons godly efforts and drinks with friends. At seventeen he and a cousin leave home and don’t tell their parents for eight weeks. He is drafted, goes to the Korean War and when his girlfriend breaks their engagement, he drinks harder. His sergeant and captain warn him, and he promises God during a fierce artillery battle that he will live for Him. He doesn’t. He comes home, drinks too much and has an accident, then lives with his sister who is saved. He falls in love with Shirley, whose family he helps one day. Finally, he surrenders to Christ, marries Shirley and goes to Bible college. Still in ministry.

item.title: 2908 James Holland Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Classic Alcohol, Homeless, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Jim begins a 20-year odyssey, drifting around the country, staying at rescue missions, riding freight trains. When he tries to cash a stolen Treasury check, he’s arrested and sent to prison, where he studies college courses. After three years he is paroled but violates his parole by getting drunk and riding a train out of state. He goes back to prison. When he’s released, he still drinks, ends up in jail but his family helps him, sending him to an alcohol recovery center. He stays sober, graduates from college and works for the state. He goes to see a blind and paralyzed woman who leads him to Christ. Married and in ministry.

item.title: 2907 James Holland Pt 1 Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Korean War, Alcohol, Crime, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Jim quits school in 6th grade to work. Age 20 he’s sent to fight in the Korean War where he learns of his dad’s death. His mom gets him a hardship discharge. He joins the Air Force, learns to drink hard with another airman. His C.O. punishes him but Jim still drinks. Finally, he is sent to Guam where he gets drunk, wears an officer’s rank and then breaks into a shoe store while drunk. He feigns mental illness, is shipped home and given a Dishonorable Discharge. He fails to show up for his own wedding because he’s drunk. His Mama gives up on him and he sells his blood to buy wine. Goes to a rescue mission, hears the gospel but not saved as the first part ends.

item.title: 2906 Al Vescera Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Dyslexia, Bitterness, Missionary
item.itunes:summary: Al witnesses to inmates in the jail and the judge, who dismisses the charges. Al also shares the gospel with a neighbor, John; but he is awkward as he continues his odyssey West, seeking God’s will. He stops in Wichita and works for an airplane company where he has his first experience seeing someone yield to Christ. He drives on to Los Angeles, where he hears a Messianic Jew on Christian radio and learns personal evangelism with him. He quits his job to attend a missionary training school and goes to Africa as a missionary for three years. He does well at evangelism but has problems with other missionaries. Eventually, he leaves the mission to be an independent missionary, going to 40 countries.

item.title: 2905 Al Vescera Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Dyslexia, Bitterness, Shyness
item.itunes:summary: Al hates his father, an abusive alcoholic. Unaware that he has dyslexia, Al fells inferior, daydreams and doesn’t handle conflict. He quits jobs and joins the army where they make him an electronics instructor. His father dies and Al still hates him. Hospitalized several times, he volunteers because he likes the praise. At home he fights with his mother. He goes to technical college, dos well but fails a political science class, then quits without graduating. He joins a group of men who form a company that does well but he works too much. A Christian invites him to church and he goes, falls in love but is rebuffed. Then he is saved, and decides to travel the country, searching for God’s will. The first part ends when he is arrested in St. Louis after an accident.

item.title: 2904 Ron Comfort Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Eye Disease, Dysfunctional Family, Evangelism
item.itunes:summary: Ron and his brother, Billy, spend the summer street preaching together. After three weeks of preaching in the town rescue mission, Ron receives enough money from donations to go to the Christian academy his brother attends – over his dad’s objections. He completes college and becomes a full-time evangelist, working with friend, Larry. He meets and marries a young woman who is saved at one of his revivals. Then his eyesight deteriorates and he is diagnosed with Keratoconus. He eventually has a corneal transplant, teams up with Larry and they travel the world as evangelists. His dad is saved. In 1989 he starts a college for preachers.

item.title: 2903 Ron Comfort Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Neglect & Abuse, Dysfunctional Family
item.itunes:summary: Ron’s grandmother stops his mother from throwing him out the window as a baby. The next seven years he endures his mother’s drunkenness, immorality and neglect while his dad is away in the army. He and his older brother join gangs in Brooklyn. His mother finally sends the children by bus to live with their dad who has remarried. The family moves to North Carolina where a woman prays for them and takes them to church. Ron’s dad and stepmother get drunk and fight every weekend. His dad wants Ron to be in show business and gets him onto a local radio station. His brother joins the Air Force, is saved and comes home to witness. Ron professes faith but is really saved during a revival weeks later. The first part ends as Ron witnesses to his dad.

item.title: 2902 Melva Harding Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Pride, Hypocrisy, Preacher’s Wife
item.itunes:summary: Melva and Wayne get back together and marry. While he’s away at the Korean War, a new preacher creates doubt in her heart about her salvation. When Wayne returns, he tries several jobs then confesses that he’s running from God, Who called him into ministry. She’s thrilled, and they go to Bible college. She sits in on his classes and again feels troubled about her soul but decides she must be saved. After Wayne begins his first pastorate, their old pastor comes to preach. He confronts Melva about her lost condition. Other women admit their doubts. Finally, when she is 34, Melva asks God to show her, and He leads her to Romans where she sees her sin and repents.

When Wayne returns, he tries several jobs then confesses that he’s running from God, Who called him into ministry. She’s thrilled, and they go to Bible college. She sits in on his classes and again feels troubled about her soul but decides she must be saved. After Wayne begins his first pastorate, their old pastor comes to preach. He confronts Melva about her lost condition. Other women admit their doubts. Finally, when she is 34, Melva asks God to show her, and He leads her to Romans where she sees her sin and repents.

item.title: 2901 Melva Harding Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Pride, Hypocrisy, Preacher’s Wife
item.itunes:summary: Melva and her family move from Kansas to western Colorado when she is nine. At seven she had gone forward during a tent revival for salvation but doesn’t feel saved later, listening to a radio preacher. She lives by good works, obedient to parents and studying hard in school. Because the family is poor, she works for room and board in high school and earns a scholarship to college where she tries smoking but doesn’t drink. She drops out after the first year, goes home and works as a secretary. She begins dating Wayne, who goes to church with her and gets saved. The first part ends as he walks away when she refuses to marry him.

item.title: 2900 Neil Schlang Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Blind, Jewish, Musician
item.itunes:summary: Neil shares an apartment with another musician. A friend takes him to a Sunday evening service where he hears Truth that makes him miserable. He thinks of suicide. Then a friend comes by and leads him to Christ. Neil tells everybody, including his family, who are upset but don’t disown him. He loses his job and goes to Bible college. His blind friend, Joe, is his best friend. Desperate for love, Neil hears about Cathy, calls her and they begin a romance that ends in marriage and ministry as evangelists. He suffers from disk collapse in his back but hopes to return to preaching.

item.title: 2899 Neil Schlang Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Blind, Jewish, Musician
item.itunes:summary: Neil is born with congenital glaucoma. His poor Orthodox Jewish family moves downstate so he can attend the state school for the blind. There he encounters prejudice but makes a few friends among the black students, who introduce him to boogie-woogie music which becomes a passion. Because of prejudice about Jews, he decides to study Hebrew and passes his bar mitzvah, planning to be a rabbi. Liberal teaching ends that interest and he pursues music becoming an accomplished piano player. Because he is overweight and blind, no girls are interested in him. He graduates and goes to college, meeting Christians who take him to church. He doesn’t drink or use drugs but he becomes an “atheist”, playing in nightclubs. The first part ends when his mother dies.

item.title: 2898 Gilbert Massengill Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Missionary to Brazil & the Jews
item.itunes:summary: Gil meets Nancy, a Jew, and they elope, living with her parents until he graduates. He works for a print shop whose owner pays poorly, and the men try to unionize but lose their jobs. They plot to kill him; then Gil is diverted to Atlanta where he works and takes his wife and four children. He goes overboard with drinking and drug use. Some church ladies come to the door, inviting them to church. Gil slams the door on them three Thursdays in a row. Then he overdoses and spends a week in the hospital after which he takes his family to church and is saved. He goes to Bible college, Nancy is saved and they go to Brazil as missionaries. Now in ministry to Jews.

item.title: 2897 Gilbert Massengill Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Alcohol, Missionary to Brazil & the Jews
item.itunes:summary: Gil’s parents drink, fight and practice infidelity. His aunt provides each of the five siblings with a week of respite at her home. Gil’s father, who spent five years in prison for bootlegging, punishes the children for their occasional church attendance. But Gil loves his dad more than he loves his mother; and when dad dies of liver failure, Gil chooses to go to a boys’ home. His mother visits once to tell him his younger brother has accidentally shot and killed his youngest brother. He runs away but is caught and returned. At a church service at the home, he learns to pray. Gil’s aunt brings him home after three years, but he rebels, drinking and doing drugs with school friends. The first part ends as he sees the girl he will marry.

item.title: 2896 Steve Sokola
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Stealing, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Steve grows up without his father. Between three marriages to alcoholics, his mother works at a tavern run by Steve’s Aunt Lil. Steve and his brother steal from the tavern as well as their aunt and uncles’ cars for joyriding. At 16 Steve and two buddies attempt a burglary but are caught. Aunt Lil helps him bail out. Steve, his brother and mother go forward at a church service, but fall away from the faith. Steve flaunts the law by drag-racing. Then his brother is nearly killed in an accident, and he urges Steve to get right with God. Three months later Steve feels the Lord calling him. He goes to church and is saved. He witnesses to his uncles and aunt but they stall. His aunt is killed later, but his uncle comes to Christ before he dies. Steve marries, goes to Bible college and seminary and is still a pastor.

item.title: 2895 Phyllis Broome
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Separation, Fear
item.itunes:summary: Phyllis has many disappointments in life. She is born with a heart defect. Her father is a master weaver in a large textile mill that provides heart surgery when she is fifteen. She is gifted at the piano and her mother teaches her, but her father can’t afford college and sends her to secretarial school. She marries Gil but they can’t have children so they adopt. Gil secretly drinks, sending Phyllis into despair. She goes to a hospital where the chaplain encourages her to play the piano again. She leaves her husband to get alone with God, listens to Christian radio and prays to receive Christ; then she goes back to Gil. God delivers him from alcohol, but a year later he develops cancer, lives ten years, then dies. Phyllis now plays piano and witnesses to others.

item.title: 2894 “Caleb”
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: Caleb’s mother is a widow with two daughters when she marries Caleb’s father, who is abusive, forcing his sons to read the Bible and pray. He home-schools the boys while their mother works. Caleb grows up hating religion and runs away numerous times. He prays to be saved but is never sure. He joins the army to get away but is so rebellious he is discharged. He goes to live near his grandparents and his sister, who tells him her stepfather molested her growing up. This drives Caleb away from God to drugs and the occult. He attempts suicide. In the hospital a preacher visits and shares the gospel. Caleb then goes to Hollywood to study music. Life with drug addicts is scary, and he is cheated and longs for peace. Finally, he prays, trusting God for salvation. Now in Bible college, preparing for missionary service.

item.title: 2893 Harvey A. Thomas
item.itunes:subtitle: Prison Ministry
item.itunes:summary: Harvey is one of ten children, the only one to graduate from high school in his family. He surrenders to full-time ministry and manages to work his way through a Christian college. He marries Norma but isn’t accepted at seminary, so he becomes a lay minister in his church then is ordained – with difficulty – through equivalency ordination. As a pastor of several churches, he reluctantly visits relatives of church members in prison and thus begins a jail ministry to which he devotes himself.

item.title: 2892 Ed Tibbits Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcoholism, Crime, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Ed steals a car loaded with marijuana but the police catch him. In a jail Bible study he meets Pastor Don, who visits him in prison and helps Ed when he’s released. Ed gets drunk, but Don and the church keep accepting him. Ed goes back to prison for parole violation, gets out and then fails by getting drunk and trying to rob a restaurant. Pastor Don doesn’t give up. Ed gets probation, goes into recovery for a year, where he surrenders his life to Christ. Pastor Don takes him into his home for a year; Ed meets and marries a cousin of Don, goes to Bible college and is now in ministry.

item.title: 2891 Ed Tibbits Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Rejection, Alcohol, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Ed grows up with his mom, grandma and great-grandma, but no father. He fears his grandma, who is mean to him and his mother. At ten he is addicted to alcohol. At thirteen he drops out of school, addicted to drugs. He and his drug friends take over the house. Ed is violent. He steals his mother’s car, breaks into a gas station and goes to jail but not for long. He forges his grandma’s checks and goes to jail for six months. His mother becomes delusional and Ed trashes his grandma’s house, so they are evicted. He becomes a vagabond for ten years, roaming the country, a drunk who fears both death and life. He begs at a church and hears the gospel. The first part ends as he hits the road again, unsaved.

item.title: 2890 “Nick Randolph”
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Alcohol, Fear
item.itunes:summary: Nick’s parents divorce and his father raises him and his sister. In drug and gang infested Detroit, Nick and his friends make a pact to never use drugs. They steal some plywood to build a skateboard ramp and the police catch them. In high school they fall prey to drugs and gangs, but Nick graduates. His best friend is killed in a car accident and then his father nearly dies of a brain aneurysm, leading to fear of death in Nick. He hears a radio preacher and gives his life to Jesus, then goes to Bible college after being called to ministry.

item.title: 2889 Robert Pock
item.itunes:subtitle: Meth, Crime, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Robert begins stealing at five to gain attention. He smokes at ten, uses drugs at twelve and steals from his employer at sixteen. He burglarizes a store and is sent to prison at eighteen. Unable to break the meth habit, he marries and has a son, tries drug treatment eleven or twelve times over the years. His wife divorces him, and he allows another man to adopt his son. He falls in with bikers and the low-level life they lead. His father has to rescue him once, but his family generally shuns him. He prays for salvation several times, but doesn’t follow through. Finally, Robert asks to stay in rehab for six months, breaks the meth addiction and gets serious with God. His son commits suicide at 20, and Robert is now in jail ministry.

item.title: 2888 Larry Gannon Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Ice Sculptor, Missionary to France
item.itunes:summary: Larry tries alcohol at fourteen, gets drunk and becomes an alcoholic. As a chef, working at country clubs and hotels, he learns the art of ice sculpture. During the war he serves as a cook, stays on in France, drinking. He goes to Korea as a government employee, meets Ethel and then becomes ill. Paralyzed and blind, he is diagnosed with multiple sclerosis and deemed incurable. But his mother and Ethel pray and he is miraculously healed. He and Ethel marry, but he degenerates, unable to hold a job and depressed. Ethel gives him books to read and he meets Jesus in the Bible. After salvation they plan to be missionaries but he can’t raise support until he begins using ice sculpture with his testimony. Now missionaries in France.

item.title: 2887 Jay Dalrymple
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Prison
item.itunes:summary: His harsh dad causes Jay’s heart to harden. At ten he begins using alcohol and drugs. He has a bad motorcycle accident at thirteen, but rides motocross and does well. A friend’s drug overdose causes him to quit school at sixteen and run away to Florida. Life from then on is downhill. He steals, gets in trouble and goes home. He marries, has a son and they split. He goes berserk and trashes his mother’s house. He lives with Joan, but is involved in the beating and rape of a girl, and is sentenced to prison. Joan stands by him, but after prison he continues to drink, and they marry but divorce. He lives with his brother and they make crystal meth, burning their trailer. More jail time where a chaplain leads him to Christ. He stumbles on parole, returns to prison where he commits to Christ. Now in jail ministry, remarried to Joan.

More jail time where a chaplain leads him to Christ. He stumbles on parole, returns to prison where he commits to Christ. Now in jail ministry, remarried to Joan.
item.content:encoded: His harsh dad causes Jay’s heart to harden. At ten he begins using alcohol and drugs. He has a bad motorcycle accident at thirteen, but rides motocross and does well. A friend’s drug overdose causes him to quit school at sixteen and run away to Florida. Life from then on is downhill. He steals, gets in trouble and goes home. He marries, has a son and they split. He goes berserk and trashes his mother’s house. He lives with Joan, but is involved in the beating and rape of a girl, and is sentenced to prison. Joan stands by him, but after prison he continues to drink, and they marry but divorce. He lives with his brother and they make crystal meth, burning their trailer. More jail time where a chaplain leads him to Christ. He stumbles on parole, returns to prison where he commits to Christ. Now in jail ministry, remarried to Joan.

item.title: 2886 Neil Verwey Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionary to Japan, South African, PBA
item.itunes:summary: Neil and his wife Peggy expand their hospital ministry to include prison evangelism. They use newspaper ads as well as radio to reach millions with the gospel. Anecdotal dramas provide insight into the various problems they encounter and the false religions that permeate Japan. Their son, David, and his family have joined the ministry as the second part ends.
item.description: Neil and his wife Peggy expand their hospital ministry to include prison evangelism. They use newspaper ads as well as radio to reach millions with the gospel. Anecdotal dramas provide insight into the various problems they encounter and the false religions that permeate Japan. Their son, David, and his family have joined the ministry as the second part ends.

item.title: 2885 Neil Verwey Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionary to Japan, South African
item.itunes:summary: Neil grows up with a godly mother who dies when he is twelve. In despair he quits going to church but prays for forgiveness for his worldly lifestyle. After hearing an evangelist he believes God and is called to Japan as a missionary. His girlfriend drops him and he vows to stay single. In Japan he meets Peggy and regrets his vow; but God releases him to marry. They launch a ministry, Japan Mission; then switch to hospital evangelism to reach the millions of TB patients. The first part ends as they decide to begin a radio ministry through the Pacific Broadcasting Association.

item.title: 2884 Art Seely Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionary to Japan, PBA Co-founder
item.itunes:summary: During Bible college, Art is called to the mission field. He falls in love with Florence, on her way to China as a missionary and reluctant to commit to Art. China’s civil war forces Florence to Japan where Art also goes. He continues his courtship, but the two misfire, and he gives up in frustration. Then they are reconciled and marry. He and five other missionaries launch PBA after some difficulties.

item.title: 2883 Art Seely Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Missionary to Japan, Rebellion, World War II
item.itunes:summary: Art grows up with restrictions and lots of Bible verse memorization. He attends Bible college in Chicago but rebels and is expelled. He joins the army and goes to radio communication school. He meets a girl and they plan to marry when the war is over. He serves in China, drinks too much because of Japanese bombing and meets a missionary who urges him to go back to his faith. When the war ends, Art stops by his sister’s Bible college where the gospel brings conviction. He goes back home where a cousin’s sermon brings him to God. The first part ends as he begs the Bible college to accept him so he won’t yield to temptation.

item.title: 2882 Bob Boardman Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: World War II, War Wounds, Missionary to Japan
item.itunes:summary: After being shot in the throat, Bob is rescued by fellow Marines. He is taken by hospital ship to San Francisco where he and the lieutenant are reunited; then he goes to Idaho where his father visits and is offended by Bob’s faith in Christ. Bob then goes to Philadelphia for specialist surgery where he spends a year. He returns to Salem to work for a Christian missionary, cares for his terminally ill father. God calls him to go to Japan but Bob resists until he hears the testimony of a veteran who learned to forgive. Bob decides to go to Japan, asks Jean to marry him and they serve 33 years as missionaries.

item.title: 2881 Bob Boardman Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: World War II, Alcohol, Wounded
item.itunes:summary: Bob grows up in a liberal church and family. He joins the Marine Corps after Pearl Harbor, trains as a tanker and ships out to Australia, where he severs tendons in his wrist during a drunken brawl. Chagrined at his failure, he reads the New Testament for months as he recovers and then receives Christ as his Savior. His unit sees combat in three different islands, culminating on Okinawa, where he and his buddies are wounded. The first part ends as he struggles to survive.

item.title: 2880 Matthew Rath
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Sexual Abuse, Mental Illness
item.itunes:summary: Matt and his older brother are sexually molested by older boys. He becomes a binge drinker to forget, and his brother has a mental breakdown at age 18. Matt goes to college where Christians witness to him. His best friend is killed while drunk driving, and matt flunks out of college. He marries, finds a tract at work and prays for salvation. Then he becomes psychotic and is taken to a mental ward. He has two more psychotic episodes, one of which leads him to crash his car, making him realize he must take his meds. He and his wife go to church and the pastor holds Bible studies for them.

item.title: 2879 Cindy Kelly
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Delusion, Divorce
item.itunes:summary: Cindy’s mother, a paranoid schizophrenic, often beats her and Cindy locks herself in the bathroom to sleep at night. Her father has numerous girlfriends and begets half-brothers and sisters who also beat up on the hapless girl. She finds a Bible that gives her comfort until her mother chops it up while she’s at school. When she gets pregnant by a local rowdy, they marry, prompting her father to disown her. She escapes into romantic fantasy novels, divorces her husband and raises their daughter. She lives with Mike for several years, but his family doesn’t accept her. They marry, have a son and go to church. The pastor visits and leads them to Christ. Both are active in ministry at church, but Cindy is now battling multiple sclerosis.

item.title: 2878 Ron Allen
item.itunes:subtitle: Vietnam War, Alcohol, Divorce
item.itunes:summary: Ron’s mother abandons the family when he is four. His grandma takes him to church and prays with him, so Ron asks God to spare grandma as she is dying of heart failure. Grandma dies leaving Ron disillusioned with God. He joins a gang, then joins the army to fight in Vietnam, becoming an Airborne. A black soldier witnesses to him. Ron is wounded by mortar, and the black soldier saves his life. Ron marries but the marriage ends in divorce. He is disillusioned at America’s treatment of Vietnam vets and becomes a hermit. After eight years, he marries Glenda. Her brother invites them to church, and after a nephew witnesses to Ron, he finally receives Christ.

item.title: 2877 Walter St. Clair
item.itunes:subtitle: Evangelist, World War II
item.itunes:summary: Walter’s mother dies when he is ten, having prayed that he will be a preacher. His dad, brothers and sister help raise him. Walter joins the Navy during World War II, and his ship is torpedoed and sinks. He loves God and receives Christ after coming home and is called to preach. He goes to Bible college, accidentally sets himself on fire but survives. Then he meets Connie and they fall in love. They marry and become pastors, she with a puppet ministry. He has a heart attack and eye problems, but Connie develops breast cancer that takes her home to the Lord. He is still preaching.

item.title: 2876 Suzanne Andrus
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger, Rebellion, Adultery
item.itunes:summary: Suzanne suffers dizzy spells from age two. Her parents’ lack of love leads to hiding her feelings. Seven deaths, including her father’s from cancer, during her teenage years harden her to loss. She rebels, meets Kyle and they are forced to marry when she becomes pregnant. The baby needs surgery for deformities, and she doesn’t bond. She commits adultery several times, meets Russ and files for divorce when she becomes pregnant again. Her second marriage doesn’t fill the void in her life, so she works in the hospital, then is laid off. Both her sons leave because of her temper, and the estrangement sends her into depression. She visits her brother, where riding horses brings joy but parting brings rage. Her sister-in-law quotes Bible verses. When her husband threatens to leave her, she cries out for release and is saved. God heals the marriage, the dizziness and her sons’ relationship.

item.title: 2875 Tom Rakow
item.itunes:subtitle: Anger, Alcohol, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Tom’s first rebellion is poaching a deer at age eleven. His beloved grandfather dies when he is thirteen. Six months later his older brother is killed, and Tom quits going to church. His anger is aggravated by drinking, and he picks fights, has accidents and starts using marijuana. But he hates himself for hurting his parents, and prays for salvation after hearing an evangelist on television. He struggles, can’t change his lifestyle, so he goes to Houston where he meets a false prophet, prays and returns home to Wisconsin. He keeps reading the Bible, finally talks with the pastor and a counselor and has the assurance of salvation. Now a pastor with a ministry to hunters and fisherman.

item.title: 2874 Dick & Deb Foreman Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Rape, Bitterness
item.itunes:summary: Deb and Dick meet at church and he tells how his grandparents raised him. Twenty-nine-year-old Dick has just learned to drive and has no job but has been saved for two years. Possessive Granddad tries but fails to prevent their marriage. When he dies, Granddad leaves everything to Dick, who goes to Bible college. After graduation Dick and Deb serve in a rescue mission that closes after five years. While on vacation, Dick falls down stairs and suffers a severe head injury. He has three operations and slowly improves; but Deb now speaks for him. She learns to let go of bitterness.

item.title: 2873 Deb Foreman Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Blindness, Rape, Bitterness
item.itunes:summary: Premature Deb needs oxygen that leaves her blind at two months. She attends public school, prays for salvation at ten and again at fourteen when she is raped by her sister’s fiancé. She and her father quarrel so much, she goes away to a school for the blind but a bad housemother leaves her bitter. She graduates and attends a vocational school for the blind. But the rape secret leads to emotional illness and anorexia. She is hospitalized for four months. Afterward, she goes to another school for the blind where she meets Don, also blind, and they live together before marriage. He is abusive, beating her often. A pastor comes to their home and they recommit their lives to Christ. Don dies of an epileptic seizure and heart failure as the first part ends.

item.title: 2872 Patricia Adams
item.itunes:subtitle: Abortion, Drugs, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Patricia struggles in school because of buck teeth and is ridiculed. After she gets braces, she does better and dates. After graduation she meets Geoff who divorces his unfaithful wife. Pati and Geoff marry and have a son. But he persuades her to get an abortion the second time she gets pregnant. After a second son is born, he demands two more abortions and they begin to fight, separate and then reconcile. Both use drugs and get into a biker group. She tries to fulfill a dream of rock music fame but her son gets into drugs and crime; so Geoff moves the family to Florida, where during rehab for the son, they meet a couple who lead them to Christ. Pati is now in a crisis pregnancy ministry.

item.title: 2871 Bill Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Drunkenness, Drugs, Abuse
item.itunes:summary: Bill’s father is a cowboy whose drunken abuse drives Bill to drink and use drugs. A school counselor is no help. After his father yanks an earring from Bill’s ear and throws him out, Bill uses intravenous drugs and his life spirals down. He marries Pam and they have two daughters, but his drinking, drugs and neglect drive her away. A cousin who urges him to go to church and a couple that gives him a New Testament lead to his conviction and salvation. God restores his marriage, and he goes to Bible college. Now an evangelist.

item.title: 2870 John Ruhlman Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcoholism, Poverty, Tuscarora Indian Connection
item.itunes:summary: John is a hopeless drunk with eight children, whose wife, Sophie, stands by him. Told through daughter Grace, who sees her mother pray against all odds, John goes to a revival one night, where his old drinking buddy leads him to Christ. John and Bob start a church, and John visits a Tuscarora Indian Reservation where he becomes pastor, serving for 27 years. He adopts orphaned Indian boys, serving until he dies at 75.

Told through daughter Grace, who sees her mother pray against all odds, John goes to a revival one night, where his old drinking buddy leads him to Christ. John and Bob start a church, and John visits a Tuscarora Indian Reservation where he becomes pastor, serving for 27 years. He adopts orphaned Indian boys, serving until he dies at 75.

item.title: 2869 Merlyn Dillow
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Deception, Hypocrisy
item.itunes:summary: Merlyn pretends to be saved when he is fifteen just to impress his girlfriend. He likes to drink and surf and does poorly in school. He works in a grocery store where a Christian witnesses to him, but Merlyn disdains the gospel. He meets Joyce and they marry while both are in different high schools. His drinking drives her away after their daughter is born, but they reunite. He works at a paper mill and goes out drinking after his shift. Through her job at a bank, Joyce meets a preacher having revival, and Joyce persuades Merlyn to attend. On the last day he is saved. He’s now in prison ministry.

item.title: 2868 Jeanne Haverstick Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcoholism, Self-Righteousness, Hypocrisy
item.itunes:summary: Jeanne loses her job but Gloria, the babysitter, befriends her. Dave sends flowers, beginning a friendship that turns into marriage. Gloria tries to warn Jeanne against marriage so soon after the death of her husband; but Jeanne ignores the warning. Dave’s drinking turns Jeanne into a nag. Gloria continues to disciple her. Dave is pronounced dead after a bad accident, but is revived at the hospital. He promises to quit drinking if God spares his life. He lives but their marriage is still rocky until God tells Jeanne to drop the mask. Dave commits his life to Christ. Jeanne is now a public speaker, giving her testimony.

item.title: 2867 Jeanne Haverstick Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Hypocrisy, Verbal Abuse, Death
item.itunes:summary: Jeanne’s father dies when she is three, and her mother marries a rich but cruel man who verbally abuses Jeanne. The family lives a pretentious life, and Jeanne longs for truth. Jeanne’s stepfather dies after she graduates but the inheritance goes to his first wife. Jeanne falls in love with Ed, whose mother doesn’t like her. They marry, and he becomes a policeman. After five years and the birth of their daughter, Ed is killed on duty. A week later Jeanne’s mother dies. Jeanne’s babysitter, Gloria, is a Christian whose compassion carries her through the suffering. The first part ends with Jeanne’s desire to die.

item.title: 2866 Doris Martens Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: False Teaching, Bitterness, Forgiveness
item.itunes:summary: Doris and Pete marry and have five children in four and a half years. But Pete’s family doesn’t accept her, and she becomes increasingly stressed and bitter at his demands and indifference. Christian women invite her to Bible study, but she is so “works” oriented, that she’s unable to grasp the gospel. In despair she runs away to her sister where a doctor puts her on anti-depressants. She and Pete return home where another Christian helps lead Doris to the Lord. A few years later Pete is saved. Twenty-one years later Doris learns to forgive the man who molested her and she now shares her testimony.

item.title: 2865 Doris Martens Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Rebellion, Reform School
item.itunes:summary: Doris is the youngest of four children. Her parents leave her alone to go out drinking, and she is molested, leaving her bitter. Friends invite her to Vacation Bible School where she learns the gospel but doesn’t repent. Ashamed of her poverty, she rebels as a teenager and falls in with a rough crowd that steals cars and vandalizes. She ends up in reform school several times, then tries to straighten up. She drops out of school and begins dating Pete, whose family is part of an isolated, doctrinally strict church. The first part ends when they secretly marry because she is pregnant.

item.title: 2864 “Carolyn Williams”
item.itunes:subtitle: Incest, Bitterness, Divorce
item.itunes:summary: Carolyn’s father becomes disillusioned with churches and keeps the family away from faith. He falls into heresy, then begins molesting her when she is twelve. Ashamed and despairing, she studies hard to get a scholarship. In high school she meets Gary who takes her to church and leads her to Christ. They marry when she is sixteen; but four years later Gary is killed in an oil rig explosion. A young man in church woos Carolyn and they marry. They serve as evangelists until he slides into exorcism and divorces her after 24 years of marriage. Today she is in prison ministry to women.
item.description: Carolyn’s father becomes disillusioned with churches and keeps the family away from faith. He falls into heresy, then begins molesting her when she is twelve. item.title: 2863 Kurt & Agnes Stebner Pt 3
item.itunes:subtitle: German POW, World War II, Immigrants
item.itunes:summary: Agnes is an orphan when she meets and marries Kurt in 1941. She goes to live with his parents in East Russia where their first child is born. Her mother-in-law is controlling, and Agnes longs for independence. When the Russian Army draws near, she and her daughter flee to West Germany in 1944. Kurt comes home in 1946 and they struggle to survive in post-war Germany. They apply to immigrate to the U.S., arriving in 1952 where they serve seven years with a mission farm. Kurt becomes disabled and Agnes cares for him as his illness becomes terminal. She is now 83 and still faithful to God.

item.title: 2862 Kurt Stebner Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: German Soldier, World War II, POW
item.itunes:summary: Kurt and thousands of other German prisoners travel by truck to Morocco to a POW camp where some men make an escape. From there they go by ship to the U.S.; Camp Livingston in Louisiana. Kurt’s experiences range from good food and friendship to slave labor and hunger as the war ends. A German POW who is a pastor encourages him to pray for salvation, which Kurt does. From then on he sees God’s hand in his life. In 1946 he goes home by ship and train and is reunited with his wife.

item.title: 2861 Kurt Stebner Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: German Soldier, World War II, POW
item.itunes:summary: Kurt is an only child, born to a farming family in East Prussia. He goes to agricultural college, planning to take over the family farms. He becomes engaged in 1938, the year he’s drafted into the army. Because he can drive, he’s put in charge of the motor pool. After war breaks out in Poland, he travels all over Europe, marries his sweetheart in January 1941, and fights on the Russian front, where burn injuries send him back home. In 1943 he’s sent to fight in Africa. The first part ends when the English capture him.

item.title: 2860 Shawn Leary
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Satanism, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Shawn’s parents receive Christ when he is nine and put him in Christian schools. He hears rock music on the bus, gets mixed up with school rebels and begins smoking pot in public high school. His stressed-out mother has a nervous breakdown and he rebels even more. He drops out of school to drink and do drugs, hanging out with evil kids who threaten to harm him. Accidents, violence and overdose fill his life until his mother helps him go to a Christian drug center where he encounters Christ. Now an evangelist.

item.title: 2859 John Paul Kejick
item.itunes:subtitle: Ojibwa Indian, Alcoholism, Suicide
item.itunes:summary: John Paul is born in a small village near Ottawa, Canada. He and older siblings are sent to a church school and forced to learn English. At 16 he returns home, starts drinking at 17 and becomes a drunkard. He feels so hopeless he attempts suicide, is sent to a psychiatric hospital for nine months. Goes back to drinking. Then he passes out in a January snowstorm and loses three fingers to frostbite. A Christian couple takes him to a retreat and cares for him. As he studies the Bible, his thirst for alcohol vanishes. He is saved and baptized in 1985, goes to Bible school and is still serving Christ.

item.title: 2858 Patricia Hanson
item.itunes:subtitle: Sexual Abuse, Verbal Abuse, Depression
item.itunes:summary: Patricia is molested by her stepfather and others throughout her childhood. Her mother works too hard to notice. In high school Patricia works, improves her appearance and dates Steve. They marry and have three sons. They give their lives to Christ and decide to go to Bible school, where Pat grows depressed and even talks of suicide. A friend stops by and Pat confides the past. The friend gives her Christian books to read, and Pat begins to dig out the roots of her depression by clinging to God’s Word. She forgives her stepfather and writes songs about her journey of faith. Both she and Steve are in ministry.

item.title: 2857 Ernie Pahlek
item.itunes:subtitle: Orthodox Jewish, Anger
item.itunes:summary: Ernie’s parents are Auschwitz survivors. Ernie rebels against his Orthodox Judaism after his Bar Mitzvah. He marries a Jew and has two sons, then divorces. Five years later he marries a Christian. His mother dies of Alzheimer’s. His father suffers three heart attacks, dying after the last one. When Ernie sees the look of terror on his father’s face, he knows there is a hell and begins a search for God. He comes to faith through the witness of believers, a radio preacher, and Bible reading. Listening to a Christian song while driving, he prays for salvation. He ministers to the church now by giving his testimony.

item.title: 2856 John Ballentine
item.itunes:subtitle: World War II, Alcohol, Religion
item.itunes:summary: John grows up in Minneapolis during the Depression, fifth child of six. His family is religious, goes to church every Sunday. His dad works for the railroad. After high school, John and a friend ride the rails to look for work. He returns home, joins the National Guard and meets Marva, whom he marries after Pearl Harbor. He goes to fight in Europe and during a German attack, he cries out to God. After the war he and Marva struggle and her sister invites them to church where they pray for salvation. He leads his sister to the Lord but the rest of his family is liberal. Now a retired pastor.

item.title: 2855 Russell Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Divorce, Panic Attacks
item.itunes:summary: Russell’s parents are divorced and he runs away often, lives in abandoned places, marries at 17 when his girlfriend gets pregnant. He works hard, drinks harder and is unfaithful but tries to commit suicide when his wife has an affair. Her second affair ends the marriage. His second marriage to an alcoholic ends after two years. His drinking leads to blackouts, five DWI’s and an anxiety disorder. After a weekend binge, he hides in his apartment and cries out to God to end his life. After three weeks, he goes to church, a changed man. He marries a third time but they divorce for two years, then remarry.

item.title: 2854 Bonnie Neufeld Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Prostitution, Suicide
item.itunes:summary: Bonnie meets a doctor who offers to provide drugs in exchange for sexual favors. The arrangement lasts for six years during which time she marries a second time and has a second son. Then she divorces. When the doctor drops her, she attempts suicide. Wayne Neufeld has been taking her sons to church, and he finds her limp body and takes her to the hospital. She blames Christians, returns to bars and meets a biker, who shares her with his buddies. She moves and he follows her. She is again hospitalized, told to give up drugs and alcohol, and she goes to rehab. There she reads the Bible and gets saved. She finds Wayne to ask forgiveness and they marry. Now in ministry as drug counselors.

item.title: 2853 Bonnie Neufeld Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Prostitution, Drugs, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: As the oldest child of six, Bonnie grows up feeling rejected by her dad. Her grandmother is the only source of faith. At twelve she’s molested by a family friend and feels betrayed. Hooked on LSD at 14, she drinks at 16, passes out and her boyfriend molests her. She gets pregnant and they marry but party and fight. They divorce, and she takes their son. She continues to shoplift and deal drugs. Then a pimp gets her hooked on heroine and drags her into prostitution. He throws a knife at her, cutting an artery and their relationship. The first part ends as she comes home from the hospital and her grandmother calls, urging her to accept Christ.

item.title: 2852 Tommy Gordon
item.itunes:subtitle: Musician, Drugs, Fear
item.itunes:summary: Tommy learns to play guitar. His parents divorce when he is twelve, and he doesn’t see his dad for fourteen years. A buddy entices him to smoke, drink and use drugs, but Tommy gives up beer when he sees the consequences in his friends. His older brothers go their own way and Tommy’s girlfriend dumps him. He has a panic attack during a performance and says the name “Jesus”, which ends the attack. He goes to Los Angeles and joins a rock band but prays the sinners prayer while watching a televangelist. He goes to church, reads the Bible and his brother asks him to leave. Tommy quits the band, goes back to Virginia to see his dad. Now married and in ministry.

item.title: 2851 Mike Small Jumper
item.itunes:subtitle: Sioux Indian, Alcohol, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: Mike is sixth child of ten born to Lakota Sioux Indian family. His parents are alcoholics and the court sends Mike and siblings to a religious boarding school for five years. Mike is moved to a different school where he skips and breaks into a liquor store. The court sentences him to training school, but then releases him. He goes to an Indian art school in Santa Fe but fighting gets him expelled. He fathers an Apache child, has adventures with the police and travels to Texas before spending time in federal prison. He goes home and fathers a Sioux child; then goes to Albuquerque and fathers a Pueblo Child. Ends up on skid row, goes to a mission halfway house on his home reservation, where he receives Christ. Now has terminal cancer.

item.title: 2850 Tommy Lewis
item.itunes:subtitle: Theft, Drugs, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: When Tommy’s dad nearly dies of a heart attack, he receives Christ as Savior and begins taking the family to church. Tommy rebels as a teenager, smokes, drinks with friends and cuts class. He falls in love at thirteen but the girl doesn’t love him. Disappointed at love and denied the chance to play basketball in high school, Tommy drops out. He steals, gambles and has several close calls with death as his parents continue to exhort him. Finally, Tommy cries out to God, goes to church and gives his life to Christ at 22. Still single at 38 but with a ministry to nursing homes.

item.title: 2849 Norval Pittman
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Family Estrangement
item.itunes:summary: Norval grows up on an isolated farm and never meets his father, who suffers from Parkinson’s. He likes to live on the edge, gets in trouble with the law as a senior in high school. He goes to college, graduates and dates a girl. When they get carried away and she becomes pregnant, her family won’t let Norval see her, and she gives up the baby for adoption. He loses his job because of drinking and takes a job as a banker. Then he meets Jane and they marry, have children and he settles into a job teaching wrestling. After his mother dies, he contacts his father’s family. Retired but serving in the Gideon Ministry.

item.title: 2848 Doris Ehlenfeldt
item.itunes:subtitle: Sexual Abuse, Divorce, Promiscuity
item.itunes:summary: Doris is sexually abused by her brother’s friends and cousins, leading to guilt and shame. After she graduates she joins the U.S. Navy and does well. She hungers to know God but doesn’t know how to find Him. She marries another sailor and they move to Minnesota where his drinking destroys their marriage. She raises their three children, joins a singles group and begins bar-hopping. After many bad relationships, she meets a man who gives her a Bible. New Year’s Eve she is born again. Her second marriage lasts for 26 years. Now a widow.

item.title: 2847 Dennis Rice
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Drugs, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Dennis grows up in a permissive family. His parents send him to church, but he rebels, tries drugs in his dad’s pharmacy. Drops out of school and hitchhikes to Mexico. He goes to San Francisco and is arrested for drug possession. Back in Phoenix he gets hooked on heroin and resorts to burglary. Third arrest leads to drug rehab. He returns to San Francisco, marries and has children. He quits drugs, but his wife doesn’t. They split and he takes the children. He falls in with the Manson family, commits armed robbery to help the leader get out of jail, but is arrested and sent to San Quentin. Hears “Unshackled!” After numerous paroles and breaking parole, he prays to receive Christ. Now in prison ministry.

item.title: 2846 “Hafiz” Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Muslim Convert, Persecution
item.itunes:summary: “Hafiz” goes to Iran where he helps an Iranian Muslim know Christ. He finds no Christians in China so he returns home, where Muslims cause an accident that leaves him disabled for more than a year. When he can walk and work again, he buys a mini-truck and works as a salesman for a food factory. Repeatedly he is beaten and driven out when his Christianity is discovered. He marries and has children. Burglars invade his home and steal, terrifying his wife; so he goes to the Emirates. Christian friends help him and his family escape to South Africa.

item.title: 2845 “Hafiz” Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Muslim Convert, Persecution
item.itunes:summary: “Hafiz” is born into an Orthodox Muslim family and memorizes the Quran. At fifteen he finds a Christian pamphlet and compares the Bible to the Quran. He believes in Jesus and his family throws him out. The persecution continues; he goes to a Christian tech school, returns to his home town and his family tries to kill him with poison. He recovers and begins traveling from one country to another—is jailed in Syria for possessing Bibles. There he helps a fellow prisoner who has converted to Islam out of fear. The first part ends as Hafiz travels to Iran.

item.title: 2844 “Starla”
item.itunes:subtitle: Abortion, Dysfunctional Family, Guilt
item.itunes:summary: “Starla” grows up with parents who fight hard. She reads her father’s porn collection and develops an unhealthy attitude toward sex. In college she gets pregnant and her boyfriend arranges an abortion after which she is disillusioned. They break up and Starla drifts into the party life. Eight years later she meets a Christian who helps her understand God’s love. Starla receives Christ, drops her friends and grows in faith. Then she picks up a drunken woman who confesses to an abortion, which opens the buried past. Her pastor recommends post-abortion counseling, and Starla learns to love her lost baby. Now married with two sons and unafraid to share her testimony.

item.title: 2843 Darren Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Darren’s parents divorce when he’s six. His mother’s involvement with palm readers and horror movies confuse him although his father gets saved and takes him to church. Left alone, he smokes with a friend. His older brother plays in a band and Darren does, too, at age thirteen. Drugs and music consume his life. He quits school at seventeen and lives with one person after another. His dad takes him to youth camp at nineteen, where he surrenders to Christ. Now in ministry.

item.title: 2842 Danny Basham Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Dysfunction, Fear
item.itunes:summary: Danny gets a football scholarship to college, but in his senior year he begins to party and gets hooked on methamphetamines. His older brother comes out of prison and has a bad drug experience, almost dies. He induces Danny to rob a dealer-friend. Danny confesses his complicity but becomes paranoid, afraid of losing his mind. He’s arrested and faces prison for receiving stolen property. He quits drugs and finds his old youth pastor. Recommits his life to Christ. Now in ministry to youth.

item.title: 2841 Danny Basham Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Dysfunctional Family, Shame
item.itunes:summary: Danny’s parents never marry. His father is an alcoholic, his mother a paranoid-schizophrenic who lashes out violently. His older brothers are criminals. Danny feels shame at his family yet likes the protection his brother provides. He finds a niche in football, an outlet for his anger. A girlfriend encourages him to learn to read and he goes to church with her. At a youth group Bible study Danny receives Christ but doesn’t live a godly life. His girlfriend breaks up with him, and he drifts away from God as the first part ends.

item.title: 2840 Gary Waddell
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Alcoholism, Divorce
item.itunes:summary: Abuse displaces love in Gary’s family. His parents drink; his father beats him; he is a poor student who becomes a bully. He joins the air force, marries and has two children. His wife leaves him as does the second wife, who makes life miserable for him. In desperation he cries out to God but isn’t obedient. Then he finds a good church and is discipled. He learns to trust in the Lord and witness boldly.

item.title: 2839 Harvey Thomas Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: British, Youth Salvation
item.itunes:summary: Harvey grows up in London, goes to school at Westminster Abbey but finds the chapel service stiff. He hears the gospel at a Bible camp and gives his life to Christ. His parents want him to study law and he does for two years. Then Billy Graham comes to Manchester and Harvey drops the study of law to assist in setting up the crusade. He meets Sylvia, goes to the U.S. and she follows. The two marry and witness at Pacific Garden Mission.

item.title: 2838 "Bryce Robertson" Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Rebellion, Mistrust
item.itunes:summary: Bryce tells his alcoholic father about being saved, but his dad rejects the gospel. A month later his dad is killed in an accident. Bryce marries Kim. They take their baby daughter back to Michigan where he is arrested for violating probation. The judge lets him go, but when officials come snooping, Bryce panics and they run back to Florida. He confides in his pastor who persuades him to go back and turn himself in. The pastor drives him, and they stay with his mother. When Bryce avoids prison, his trust in God is established. Both his brother and his mother profess faith in Christ.

item.title: 2837 "Bryce Robertson" Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Mistrust, Alcoholism
item.itunes:summary: Bryce’s family is an alcoholic who batters the family. Parents divorce when Bryce is fifteen. He joins the air force but stays in trouble, attempts suicide, goes AWOL. At home his mother refuses to take him in, and he and friends commit burglaries. Grandfather urges him to turn himself in. He spends eleven months in jail, reads a book about peace with God, is discharged from the air force. When he gets in trouble at home, he violates probation and leaves the state, going to see his father in Florida. There a witness leads him to Christ. Still facing a warrant for his arrest as first part ends.

item.title: 2836 Dominic Mance
item.itunes:subtitle: Despair, Workaholic, Divorce
item.itunes:summary: Dominic works in the family pizza / bar from age six. He lifts weights and boxes to gain strength. Money is all-important. He attends all-boys church school, goes to college and falls in love with Lynette, a nurse. They marry and have two daughters. Dominic achieves success in international banking but loses his wife. The bank files for bankruptcy the same week. He wanders aimlessly on the streets, meets a Christian surfer, reads the Bible and gives his life to Christ. Now a writer and artist with a ministry to the homeless.

item.title: 2835 Bruce O’Neill Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Thievery, Religion, Alcoholism
item.itunes:summary:
As a child, Bruce sees his police-officer dad steal and decides it’s okay. He quits going to mass at age sixteen but works hard. He marries Shirley who is an atheist, and they move to Florida, then Arizona, where he works for a major hotel chain. He begins taking things home from work. Then his young nephew dies, and Bruce is faced with mortality. He starts reading the Bible, goes to church and is saved. Shirley resists but soon gives her life to Christ. They have a prison ministry. Shirley dies in 2001, but Bruce remarries and continues the prison ministry full-time.
(Bryan O’Reilly #1858)

(Bryan O’Reilly #1858)

item.title: 2834 Violet Duracka Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Polio, Unwavering Faith
item.itunes:summary: Daughter of Bohemian immigrants, Violet finds Christ through her father’s involvement with Pacific Garden Mission. However, the few years of her life covered by this story are filled with sorrow, disappointment and tragedy. Yet Violet emerges “happy as a sunflower,” because of her unwavering faith in Christ and her belief that God makes all things work together for good in the lives of His children.

However, the few years of her life covered by this story are filled with sorrow, disappointment and tragedy. Yet Violet emerges “happy as a sunflower,” because of her unwavering faith in Christ and her belief that God makes all things work together for good in the lives of His children.

Yet Violet emerges “happy as a sunflower,” because of her unwavering faith in Christ and her belief that God makes all things work together for good in the lives of His children.

item.title: 2833 Mollie Rollins Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Drunkenness, Child, 1875 Mission
item.itunes:summary: Five-year-old Mollie comes to Jerry McAuley’s rescue mission in New York City to hear the music. Her mother is a drunk who yanks the children out of the meeting. The McAuley’s pray for the family, and one night seeks help when their drunken father locks them out. Maria McAuley ministers to Mollie’s mother as she recovers from delirium tremens. The woman then comes to a service and gives her life to Christ. Within months the woman lies dying of tuberculosis and asks that the funeral be held at the mission.

item.title: 2832 Rowdy Brown Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Brutal Seaman
item.itunes:summary: Known for his ability to drive men up the rigging of sailing ships by the sheer force of his physical prowess, “Rowdy” ships out of New York and other ports around the world. Sailors are afraid of him. He fights off death and danger – even beating his former ship’s captain within an inch of his life. Then through the testimony of some of his former shipmates in the Water Street Mission of New York, he comes face to face with Jesus Christ, Who turns this fearsome hulk of a man into a winsome witness to the saving power of Christ, showing there are no cases too tough for God to reach.

item.title: 2831 Phil Welsher Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Witnessing, War, Death
item.itunes:summary: Phil is saved at age ten and shows evidence of God’s life within him. He tries to reach his girlfriend, who had never gone to church. After graduation he joins the Marines – just before Pearl Harbor. His letters home encourage his parents. Then in 1943 the letters stop for six months. His parents worry but go to Pacific Garden Mission to help at the Servicemen’s Center. Finally, in November a letter comes from Phil written before his death. His dad, who narrates the story, begins a ministry using Phil’s last letter about God’s grace to reach others.

item.title: 2830 Emiline Strauss Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Self-Pity, Resentment, Divorce
item.itunes:summary: Emiline’s childhood is miserable, so she marries at sixteen. Her husband, Fred, begins to change after the birth of their second daughter. He treats her badly. Her brother, Bob, talks to her about Jesus before he dies at nineteen. Then two baby sons die after birth. Her husband becomes abusive and she runs around to get even. Finally, after the birth of a son, she divorces him. She meets Orville, a new Christian who also dies, and she puts Christ in the center of her life. She hears “Unshackled!” and goes to Pacific Garden Mission for help.

item.title: 2829 Charles Boren Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Decadence, Suicide
item.itunes:summary: Having grown up in southern Illinois, Charles leaves home to escape the restraints of his father and make changes in his life. However, he finds himself enslaved to the vices of Al Capone’s Chicago. Later, living in Detroit, he opens his own speakeasy. After numerous encounters with the law, he attempts to take his own life during a struggle with a cop. “Out of the blue” he decides to attend church and find out if there is salvation for a man’s soul. Finding the Lord, his life finally changes, and he becomes an evangelist, speaking in 42 different states and Canada.

item.title: 2828 Daniel McCarty
item.itunes:subtitle: Resentment, Drugs, Fighting
item.itunes:summary: Dan feels inferior because he stutters, is skinny and has buck teeth. His parents divorce when he is six, and he skips school to lift weights. He puts on muscles, excels at track and gets braces but still stutters. Alcohol helps with the stuttering, and he becomes addicted to booze and drugs. He marries Linda but their marriage suffers, and she leaves frequently, taking their daughters. A neighbor witnesses to them and Linda gets saved. Then Dan is arrested for DUI and he goes to church with Linda where he commits his life to Christ.

item.title: 2827 Gerald Pipher
item.itunes:subtitle: Angina, Theft, Backsliding
item.itunes:summary: Gerald goes forward at twelve but leaves God behind at sixteen when he falls in love with Geraldine. Doesn’t go to church for the next 20 years. Goes to Europe to fight in World War II as an electrician, repairing fighters. Meets up with his brother there. Comes home and marries Geraldine but goes from job to job. Rejoins the army to get an education, serves in Korea. Working for IBM, he steals a few parts, has heart problems and is hospitalized. There he discovers part of a Bible verse and rededicates his life to the Lord. Has had a prison ministry for many years.

item.title: 2826 James Wendorf Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Airplanes, Warships, Fast Cars
item.itunes:summary: Airplanes, warships, fast cars and other hazards nearly cost Jim Wendorf his life as a young officer in the Navy, and are part of the story of how this respected Wisconsin lawyer came to see he was not ‘just lucky’ or leading a charmed life – but that God had a purpose for keeping him alive through all these hazards. That purpose has been richly realized once he faced his life squarely and realized he wasn’t going to make it to heaven or escape hell just on will-power or luck. Jim Wendorf came to the place – by God’s grace – he recognized God’s hand in his seeming miraculous preservation from sudden and violent death – to carry on a ministry of sharing the Gospel – the good news that Jesus had died for him and for all who would trust Him.

item.title: 2825 “Carlene”
item.itunes:subtitle: Incest, Abuse, Shame
item.itunes:summary: Carlene grows up in a happy family until she is molested by her father, bringing fear and shame. She prays for God to intervene, and her mother discovers them. Her father stops molesting her, but is physically abusive. She goes to college and marries Sean, but pushes him away. She finally confesses the abuse but tries to forgive. Learning that her sisters and others have also been molested, she begins to confront her father about the past. Through prayer, counseling and Bible study, she is able to help others who’ve suffered incest.

item.title: 2824 Martin Garland
item.itunes:subtitle: Discouragement
item.itunes:summary: Life had become desolate for Martin Garland. Then a conversation on an airplane headed home set this weary executive on an entirely new course. Perhaps what Martin learned is exactly what you need as well. Find out when you listen to this dramatic true story on “UNSHACKLED!”

item.title: 2823 Ray Thombs Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, Insecurity, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: After his parents divorce, Ray’s father neglects his sons, and Ray becomes bitter. His grandfather is a good role model, and an older neighbor also witnesses about Christ through her kindness. Ray flounders in school but graduates. He joins the Navy and develops an addiction to alcohol. Some sailors invite him to Bible study, but only when his grandpa dies does Ray turn to the Lord. He marries, graduates from Bible college and goes into ministry; but struggles to forgive his father. He begins praying for his dad, who is the first in the family to profess faith. Now retired.

item.title: 2822 Leroy Van Wright
item.itunes:subtitle: Hardship, Drinking
item.itunes:summary: Leroy is a sharecropper’s son who is drafted in the army where he learns to drink and smoke. Injuries to his left eye when he is a boy and later during a barroom brawl leave him blind in that eye. He comes home, marries but continues drinking. A black woman witnesses to him over the years. His dad listens to Christian radio, and Leroy goes to hear the man preach and gives his life to Christ. Serves as a pastor for more than forty years.

item.title: 2821 Alex Rogers
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Alcohol, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Alex grows up in a God-fearing family, but he rebels. He’s expelled from Christian school, and he and his friends drink, fight and use drugs. He wrecks a car and is suicidal. They plan to go to a school in Florida, but an acquaintance steals their money. He meets Donna and they live together before marriage. His wife is unable to have a baby, and Alex begins listening to radio preachers as a comfort. Driving home he gives his life to Christ and learns that his wife is pregnant. Now in ministry.

item.title: 2820 Thomas Williams Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Bi-Polar Mom, Alcoholic Dad
item.itunes:summary: After Tom joins the Navy and his girlfriend drops him, he is depressed. A buddy tries to talk to him about Jesus, but he rejects the overtures. Then he foolishly goes AWOL for a day and is sentenced to work fifteen hours every day for three months, except for chapel. In chapel a man shares the gospel and Tom prays for salvation. He witnesses to his family and all but his father profess faith. He marries, has five children and still serves the Lord faithfully.

item.title: 2819 Thomas Williams Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Dysfunctional Family, Drinking, Navy
item.itunes:summary: Tom’s parents have problems: his dad drinks and rarely comes home; his mother, a manic-depressive, slides into mental illness as his father becomes unfaithful. Tom and siblings live with an aunt when his mother is hospitalized. The aunt and uncle provide guidance and discipline, taking the siblings to church. Tom falls in love but graduates and becomes a merchant sailor on the Great Lakes, planning to marry. His girlfriend drops him, leaving him depressed. The first part ends with Tom in the Navy and his aunt telling him to get a relationship with Christ.

item.title: 2818 “Bob Grant” Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Family Strife, Restoration, Death
item.itunes:summary: Bob’s mother rails against his decision for Christ, mocking him and making him leave home. He serves in the navy, returns home to work in the machine shop, but decides to go into ministry. He marries Jean, witnesses to his family, but they are unreceptive. His older brother, abandoned at birth, finds the family, but Bob’s mother rejects him. This brother and Bob’s younger brother die as well as Bob’s father, who prays the sinner’s prayer before death. Retired now, Bob contrasts his life with his older brother, now in prison, and his mother, still unyielding at 94.
