item.title: 2817 “Bob Grant” Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Immorality, Poverty, Stealing
item.itunes:summary: Bob’s mother abandons her three children to live with Bob’s father, who is an alcoholic gambler. Bob and his younger brother are born and grow up with fighting and fear. Two of his mother’s children return home, and his older half-brother teaches him to steal. Both boys are required to leave school at sixteen to work. The family goes to mass every week, but live sinful lives. Bob works at a machine shop with a believer who gives him a Bible and answers questions about salvation. First part ends with Bob’s salvation.

item.title: 2816 Clayton Miles
item.itunes:subtitle: Country Music, Bigamy, Pride
item.itunes:summary: The youngest of four boys who played country music on radio, Clayton grows up longing to be a country music star. His brother encourages him to read the Bible, which he does, a chapter a day; but he is not saved. After graduation, he goes to Nashville with friends and slowly rises to achieve stardom. He marries a woman who is a bigamist and they have a daughter. He is saved but divorces her and leaves country music to become a preacher and evangelist.

item.title: 2815 Stan Lander
item.itunes:subtitle: Jewish, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: Stan grows up in a semi-orthodox family of Jews. His mother dies when he is twelve, causing him to question God. At eighteen he is arrested on felony drug charges. Christians pray for him, his girlfriend gives him a Bible and ultimately the charges are dismissed. Stan goes to college where fraternity friends and an older woman continue witnessing. He prays for salvation and asks God for a sign. The next evening he has dinner with Corrie Ten Boom and has his sign. He now has a ministry sharing Jewish festivals with the church.
item.description: Stan grows up in a semi-orthodox family of Jews. His mother dies when he is twelve, causing him to question God. At eighteen he is arrested on felony drug charges. Christians pray for him, his girlfriend gives him a Bible and ultimately the charges are dismissed. Stan goes to college where fraternity friends and an older woman continue witnessing. He prays for salvation and asks God for a sign. The next evening he has dinner with Corrie Ten Boom and has his sign. He now has a ministry sharing Jewish festivals with the church.
item.content:encoded: Stan grows up in a semi-orthodox family of Jews. His mother dies when he is twelve, causing him to question God. At eighteen he is arrested on felony drug charges. Christians pray for him, his girlfriend gives him a Bible and ultimately the charges are dismissed. Stan goes to college where fraternity friends and an older woman continue witnessing. He prays for salvation and asks God for a sign. The next evening he has dinner with Corrie Ten Boom and has his sign. He now has a ministry sharing Jewish festivals with the church.

item.title: 2814 Siegfred de Guzman Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Filipino, Poverty, Persecution
item.itunes:summary: Fred grows in faith, witnessing to classmates, standing up to teachers. He leaves commerce college to tackle Bible school where he learns to submit to God by submitting to unfair authority. He marries Suzette and they serve in a communist infested area, receiving death threats and no support. Fred suffers periodic paralysis and a heart attack from an untreated thyroid condition, but he labors on serving the Lord.

item.title: 2813 Siegfred de Guzman Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Filipino, Gambling, Jealousy
item.itunes:summary: Fred is one of nine children whose parents work hard but live in poverty in the squatter’s area of Manila. Fred’s mom begins gambling and loses her small salary, which infuriates her husband. Fred is drawn into gambling, too. The family is Catholic but his mother gets saved at a friend’s church and pressures the family to get saved. Fred thinks money is the answer to life’s problems and begins commerce college. The first part ends with his salvation.

item.title: 2812 Morris Snook Classic Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellious Sons, Nursing Home
item.itunes:summary: Morry marries Jean and they raise five children while being active in ministry. Sons Craig and Brent rebel, smoking, drinking and using drugs. Brent surrenders to Christ at fourteen and Craig goes forward but can’t quit using drugs. Brent takes his brother to a Christian movie where Craig gets saved. Both brothers are now pastors. At 75 Morry has a stroke and lives in a nursing home. A soldier in Brent’s church is captured in Iraq and the story ends with Brent’s sermon on our hope in Christ.

item.title: 2811 Morris Snook Classic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Lies, Disillusionment
item.itunes:summary: Morris grows up in a Christian family, but he longs for affirmation and acceptance that he receives from classmates when he sings. He dreams of singing with the big bands, cuts class to drive to Chicago to hear stars sing. He is disappointed in love while he’s in the navy, and disillusionment grows the longer he’s in the world. His parents pray for him. He gets drunk and spends a night in jail. He finally agrees to hear an evangelist after which he gets alone and prays for salvation, where 1st part ends.

item.title: 2810 Marvin Lacy
item.itunes:subtitle: Country Music, Self-Seeking
item.itunes:summary: Marvin grows up in a poor share-cropper family that loves music. He goes forward for salvation at fifteen but falls in with rowdy boys after the family moves to Florida. In the army he plays in a band and learns to drink. Afterward he forms his own band, writes songs and has a major country music star record one of his songs. He marries and is increasingly conflicted about the lyrics of country music. Asked to be a music director at his church, he turns away from the world to serve the Lord.

item.title: 2809 Sidney Jordan
item.itunes:subtitle: Violence, Rebellion, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: When he is seven, Sidney’s parents have a bitter, contested divorce and he is left confused and angry. They live with grandparents. He rebels against church and family, smokes pot and cuts school. Expelled at sixteen, he works as a plumber by day, taunts the police at night. At nineteen he brawls with seven deputies and goes to jail, but is put on parole. He gets hooked on cocaine, steals and can’t hold a job. Tries rehab and fails. Finally, he lives with his mother in Georgia. A man at work reads the Bible to him. Sidney goes to church and prays for salvation. Now married and a step-grandfather.

item.title: 2808 Grady Johnson Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Violence, Alcohol, Bitterness
item.itunes:summary: Grady works as a logger and meets Bridgett. He leads her into marijuana smoking and they fight. When his mother is dying of cancer, he prays for her healing but she dies, and Grady is bitter at God. At work a new mechanic is hostile and the two men become locked in a bitter and deadly fight. Grady marries Bridgett. A tree falls on him and, fearing death, he gives his life to God.. Still disabled, he is now a chaplain in prison ministry.

item.title: 2807 Grady Johnson Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Fighting, Blindness
item.itunes:summary: Grady witnesses the drinking and violence of his parents. While drunk, his dad threatens to shoot the family with his shotgun. But Grady goes to church and trusts God. He loses faith when his dad beats him for obedience. At age 12 Grady gets a BB-gun and accidentally shoots himself, blinding one eye. Both his parents get saved, and Grady goes to the altar, hoping God will restore his sight. He turns from God when his hope is dashed. Ridiculed at school, he becomes bitter and hangs out with bullies. The first part ends when Grady rebels and starts drinking and using drugs.

item.title: 2806 “Heather”
item.itunes:subtitle: Lesbian, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: With an overly critical mother, Heather grows up feeling worthless. Her marriage at fifteen fails, and her parents put her in a girls’ school where she has an affair, which ends badly, leaving her physically and emotionally sick. She gets her GED, joins the Navy and marries at 18. Her husband drinks and is abusive. They divorce in spite of having two children, which Heather leaves with her parents while she lives a debauched life with other women. Finally, a Christian at work witnesses to her and she prays for salvation. She takes care of her mother before death, and has served the Lord since 1978.

item.title: 2805 “Brianna”
item.itunes:subtitle: Promiscuity, Abortion
item.itunes:summary: Born three months after her mother leaves her father, Brianna’s innocence is compromised by her drunken father. Overweight, she spends time in a bar and becomes boy-crazy at fourteen. Has an affair, gets pregnant and has an abortion. When she goes to college, she becomes promiscuous, has another abortion, then tries to straighten up. Finally, goes to church and gives her life to Christ. She goes to Bible college, marries and describes the difficulties of having an autistic son. Now has a jail ministry.

item.title: 2804 Larry Hale
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Infidelity
item.itunes:summary: Larry confesses Christ at age twelve to escape hell, but lust for fame as a rock music star leads him into immorality and drugs. He leaves his wife and children, becomes a dealer of cocaine. When the law closes in, he cooperates, quits the band, marries his girlfriend and takes a respectable job. A man at work witnesses to him. Larry’s parents pray for him, and he is sentenced to six months work release, after which he receives Christ. His new wife leaves him, but he is remarried and they are evangelists together.

item.title: 2803 Greg West
item.itunes:subtitle: Shame, Drugs, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Rebellious and wild, Greg worships his older brother who teaches him to fight. When he disappoints his brother, Greg becomes self-destructive, injecting drugs with his cousin. Treatment doesn’t help, talking with the pastor doesn’t help. He marries Tammy, and they are invited to revival at church, where Greg gives his life to Christ. Now an evangelist.

item.title: 2802 Dwight Tomlinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Vietnam, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: Dwight’s family is poor and he is ridiculed in school for his southern accent. He becomes a rebel, fighting and being suspended from school, drinking, smoking pot and stealing. He joins the army at 17 and fights in Vietnam, but gets three courts martial. Ashamed that the army wants to dump him, he asks for another chance. On leave at home, his parents are born-again, but he refuses salvation. Finishes his tour in Nam, goes home and his brother is saved. After a car wreck, he gives his life to Christ. A pastor for 30 years.

item.title: 2801 Lloyd Glickstein
item.itunes:subtitle: Jewish, Gambling, Bi-Polar
item.itunes:summary: Lloyd grows up in an Orthodox Jewish family. He joins the army at nineteen to escape his domineering mother. His bi-polar disorder manifests itself in the army and he gets two courts martial. His father hospitalizes him. From then on Lloyd periodically sees a psychiatrist. While manic, Lloyd can’t control his impulses to run away or gamble in Las Vegas. Gambling and infidelity destroy his first marriage and threaten his second one. At age 73 he meets a pastor who invites him to church. Finally, Lloyd receives Christ at 77. Still active in church at 81.

item.title: 2800 Levi Whisner Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Reconciliation, Persecution
item.itunes:summary: Levi asks his dad’s forgiveness, and the two are reconciled. He finishes Bible college, marries Phyllis, and begins serving the Lord as pastor. In 1972 his daughter brings home books from school that contain abhorrent teaching, and Levi starts a Christian school. The State of Ohio takes him to court and Levi fights a four-year battle to the State Supreme Court, winning the right to have his school and winning his adversary to the cause. Still teaching Bible study at 80.

item.title: 2799 Levi Whisner Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, War
item.itunes:summary: Levi grows up in a large poor family in West Virginia. His dad has a violent temper, so Levi takes a beating for his brother at age sixteen, leading to a schism with his dad. He joins the army after Pearl Harbor, fights in Europe with Patton’s army and learns to forgive the Germans as the war ends. He is injured and hospitalized with blood poisoning, but recovers. Coming home, his dad still won’t talk to him. Levi and sister go to Cincinnati to school where another student takes him to a mission and Levi is saved. First part ends as he prepares to go home and tell his dad about Jesus.

item.title: 2798 Tom Herro
item.itunes:subtitle: Pornography, Religion, Fear
item.itunes:summary: Tom grows up in a religious family, a descendant of Arab Christians. As a boy, he is fearful of God’s wrath. He discovers pornography as a teenager and becomes addicted, lying to his parents, hiding his obsession for x-rated movies. He marries Mary Jo but their marriage suffers because of his secret life. After five years, they begin going to Bible study with his cousin, and both get saved at a church retreat. They go to Bible college, then serve as missionaries to Arabs in Israel. Now a chaplain in a jail ministry.

item.title: 2797 Reuben Collins
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Alcohol, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: When Reuben’s parents divorce, he starts drinking at thirteen and running with the wrong crowd. Drugs and a bad attitude cause him to fail at school. Arrested for assaulting police officers, he joins the army, but gets in trouble there, too. He marries Coretta and fights in the Gulf War. When he returns, his sister visits and talks about Jesus. He finally goes to church with her, where he and Coretta are saved. After serving in Germany, he leaves the army for Bible college. His father is saved at the graduation. Now pastoring a church in Providence, home of his father’s family.

item.title: 2796 Thelma Hildebrand
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, Self-Sufficiency
item.itunes:summary: Thelma’s mother, who often abandons her children, forces Thelma to quit school at age fifteen and marry. Thelma’s husband dies, leaving her with eight children and no income. One daughter runs away. Destitute, Thelma gives up three daughters for adoption. “Unshackled!” writer, Kennetha, comes back home however. Thelma manages to build her own house. Kennetha gets saved and witnesses to Thelma, who is hostile to the gospel but who prays for salvation before her death.

item.title: 2795 Terrance Kelly
item.itunes:subtitle: Dyslexia, Ridicule, Fantasy World
item.itunes:summary: Born in Quebec, Terry and his twin brother are adopted by an American couple. Terry is dyslexic and constantly ridiculed at school as stupid. His parents love and support him, but he withdraws into an imaginary world of fantasy. In spite of his father’s death when Terry is twelve, Terry graduates and completes training to be a mechanic. He hates the job, but a co-worker leads him to the Lord, changing everything.

His parents love and support him, but he withdraws into an imaginary world of fantasy. In spite of his father’s death when Terry is twelve, Terry graduates and completes training to be a mechanic. He hates the job, but a co-worker leads him to the Lord, changing everything.

He hates the job, but a co-worker leads him to the Lord, changing everything.

item.title: 2794 Solomon Mekonnen
item.itunes:subtitle: Ethiopian, Blind, Self-Sufficiency
item.itunes:summary: Solomon is blinded and burned over all his body when he pulls a pot of boiling beans on himself as a child. His family abandons him, giving him to Emperor Haile Selassie, who supports the boy. Solomon is educated in a Christian mission school, but rebels against God and mocks Christianity. One day he enters a chapel to hear the music and goes forward to give his life to Christ. He goes to law school and marries; but they are persecuted by the Communist government in Ethiopia. Solomon comes to the U.S. on a Fulbright Scholarship and now serves with the mission that helped him.

item.title: 2793 “Gary”
item.itunes:subtitle: Materialism, Religiosity, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: Gary grows up in a Catholic family and always goes to church, believing God rewards good works and punishes bad. He continues going to church long after his peers quit, but his real gods are money and success. In college he uses drugs to gain acceptance and even sells cocaine. After graduation he lands a good job in sales, does well, but feels empty. Success isn’t enough. His boss invites Gary to Bible study, where Gary realizes he doesn’t have to earn God’s love; Jesus earned it for us. Now married with three sons.

item.title: 2792 Bill & Elise Taylor Classic Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcoholism, Self-Righteousness
item.itunes:summary: Blind drunk, Bill pushes Elise down the stairs and she separates herself, having him live alone downstairs. Feeling compassion one day, she helps him, but he tries to choke her. As she surrenders to the Lord’s will, Bill releases her. Diagnosed with cirrhosis, he quits drinking. They are reconciled. They retire to another state where Bill becomes active in church and commits to the Lord. When he dies, Elise recognizes her self-righteousness and God’s plan for their life all along.

item.title: 2791 Bill & Elise Taylor Classic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcoholism, Self-Righteousness
item.itunes:summary: Elise grows up in England but comes to the U.S. from Canada. She meets Bill who pursues her but feels unworthy of her. They marry just as the Depression hits, and jobs are nil. A daughter is born to them. They go to church but are not saved. Bill’s drinking leads to abuse. Elise goes to her brother but returns when she is unable to live on her own. Their daughter is born-again at sixteen. Elise & Bill find his sister and learn about his past. His drinking gets worse, and the first part ends when Bill pushes Elise down some stairs.

item.title: 2790 Marquita Wilson Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Physical and Sexual Abuse, Bullies
item.itunes:summary: She gets pregnant but has the baby. Then she begins living with Gus and they slide into drug and alcohol addiction. Living in a shelter, she hears the gospel from a woman. After a murder in the shelter, Marquita prays for salvation. She and Gus marry, but testing comes. Marquita has a double mastectomy and sinks into depression. Gus gets saved. Her mother dies, and at last she is prepared for ministry. She is serving the Lord in her church.

item.title: 2789 Marquita Wilson Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Physical and Sexual Abuse, Bullies, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Although her grandfather is a preacher and the family has Bible study and devotions, Marquita’s parents divorce because her dad is abusive. She is bullied and beaten by schoolmates and molested three times: at age three by a stranger, at fifteen when she is drugged and again by a teacher in high school. The first part ends as the teacher denies the rape.

The first part ends as the teacher denies the rape.

item.title: 2788 Harry Saulnier Classic Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: PGM Superintendent
item.itunes:summary: Told through his wife, Gene’s eyes, Harry accepts the job of superintendent in 1940 and faces a badly run-down mission that he cleans and changes from top to bottom. He begins a Women’s Division, a Serviceman’s Center and “Unshackled!”, but faces his wife’s unhappiness when he neglects his family. She prays and comes to understand God’s will and supports him.

He begins a Women’s Division, a Serviceman’s Center and “Unshackled!”, but faces his wife’s unhappiness when he neglects his family. She prays and comes to understand God’s will and supports him.

item.title: 2787 Harry Saulnier Classic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: PGM Superintendent
item.itunes:summary: Harry grows up in a family that goes to church but doesn’t know the Lord. Harry has a fascination for electricity and is self-taught. They move to Chicago when Harry is 20, and he works for the Edison company. A co-worker invites him to a Bible conference but there’s no invitation to receive Christ. Harry finally kneels and prays at home. After salvation, he preaches on street corners and at Pacific Garden Mission. He meets Gene and they marry. The first part ends when Harry is asked to be superintendent at PGM.

item.title: 2786 Andrew Barbour
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcoholism, Dyslexia, Suicide
item.itunes:summary: Andy’s parents, addicted to alcohol and prescription drugs, isolate him and he has panic attacks and does poorly at school because of dyslexia. He drinks vodka at sixteen, which helps him socially. In college he marries Susan, transfers to business college and excels. But he must intervene in his parents’ lives, putting them in mental hospitals. His father commits suicide, adding guilt to Andy’s problems. After severe illness caused by alcohol, Andy quits drinking. Seven years later he goes to church and is saved. Now in church ministry to prisoners.

item.title: 2785 Terry Leggett
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcoholism
item.itunes:summary: Terry grows up during the Depression hating alcohol because his father sometimes got drunk. The family of eleven children are impoverished and move to Illinois when Terry is 17. He drinks with buddies, breaking a promise to his sister, then he enlists in the navy, where he becomes an alcoholic. Afterward, he marries Grace and they have six children. He tries to quit drinking but can’t. His brother invites him to church. Terry gets drunk with his uncle, has a vision of Jesus on the cross and cries out to God. He and Grace go to church and go forward. Still witnessing in spite of illness.

item.title: 2784 Barbara Wood
item.itunes:subtitle: Single Mom, Abortion, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: Barbara is raised in strict family and church, where salvation is by baptism. In college she is distracted by evolution, joins the army to please her boyfriend. They marry but are miserable, and she gets a hardship discharge after six months. The marriage fails, and she slips into drinking, pot smoking and promiscuity. She gets pregnant, goes to an abortion clinic but then relents and has the baby. She finishes college but lives an undisciplined and dissolute life until she hears the gospel on TV and prays for salvation.

item.title: 2783 Al Wentzel
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Drugs, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Al goes to church with a friend at age nine. His parents profess faith, but Al resists and begins rebelling: smoking, drinking and doing drugs. He drops out of school, traps wild animals and sells drugs. He’s arrested four times, then charged with assaulting an officer. While serving time in jail, his old drug buddy visits, sharing the gospel. When he’s released, Al finally goes to church and yields to Christ. Now married and an evangelist with prison ministry.

item.title: 2782 Sharon Merhalski Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Polio, Abuse, Incest
item.itunes:summary: Sharon marries Peter and they miraculously have a son, which is life-threatening. Because of her mother’s continued abuse, Peter moves Sharon to another state. They adopt a daughter. Sharon’s health deteriorates and she almost dies of respiratory failure. She bargains with God but cannot keep her vow because of secret fears, then through Bible study gains strength. Her father dies, her mother dies and Sharon learns that her natural father is her dad’s cousin, giving her peace at last.

item.title: 2781 Sharon Merhalski Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Physical, Sexual Abuse, Polio
item.itunes:summary: Sharon’s mother is neglectful and abusive, all the more after Sharon gets polio and needs special care. With a trache tube in her throat, Sharon is unable to attend school. A teacher comes and gives her the love she needs. At thirteen she starts school in the sixth grade. As a teenager, her home life gets worse. Her father stays away, having affairs. A car crash nearly kills Sharon, making her mother more hateful. When Sharon dates, her mother tries to kill her. The first part ends with her mother in a mental hospital.

item.title: 2780 Bryan Stensaas
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Navy, Rejection
item.itunes:summary: Bryan is tormented and rejected in his younger years at school. He has perfect attendance at church. In high school he goes all out for football and is at last accepted; but drinking and smoking are part of that acceptance. He joins the navy to please his father, marries right away and risks his marriage by drinking too much. Based in Spain but flying around Europe, a friend witnesses to the couple, taking them to church where Bryan gets saved. A year later his wife also receives Christ. They and their grown children are missionaries in Uganda.

item.title: 2779 “Mac” Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, Poverty, Personal Evangelism
item.itunes:summary: Sherry Goodwin stops to help a crippled old man who is embittered by having been robbed and left for dead. She gives him money, prays for him and gives him rides to town each week. She eventually goes to the shack, where he lives without electricity and water, then invites him home. She tries to help him materially until she realizes his spiritual need. In time she leads him to Christ.

She eventually goes to the shack, where he lives without electricity and water, then invites him home. She tries to help him materially until she realizes his spiritual need. In time she leads him to Christ.

item.title: 2778 Sherry Goodwin Classic Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Ethiopian, Evangelism, God’s Plan
item.itunes:summary: Sherry is invited to speak at an International Students’ Fellowship Home in Minnesota. The home has 22 students, most from Africa. She gives her testimony at dinner, and a young man named Binyam comes to her room where she leads him to Christ. The students barely have enough to eat, so Sherry buys groceries and prepares dinner. After she speaks on Sunday, Binyam shares his testimony of escaping from prison in Ethiopia.

After she speaks on Sunday, Binyam shares his testimony of escaping from prison in Ethiopia.

item.title: 2777 Sherry Goodwin Classic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Ambition, False gods
item.itunes:summary: Sherry excels in school and is ambitious even after her marriage to Jerry at seventeen. Being a housewife bores her, so she goes to work against her husband’s wishes and is successful in the political arena. She serves many gods: money, power, friends, even “good works” and astrology as her marriage slides downhill. Her godly mother prays for her. An old friend and she work together, and the friend leads her to Christ. The first part ends when Sherry is diagnosed with MS.

item.title: 2776 Vladimir Makarenko Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Persecution, Russia, Communism
item.itunes:summary: Volodya is arrested and taken for interrogation, where he realizes God must exist if they resist Him so much. He defiantly says he will teach the Bible. Then he goes back to the church and receives Christ. Persecution begins at school and continues in the army where he is threatened and even beaten for his faith. Still serving Christ as missionary and church planter in Russia.

item.title: 2775 Vladimir Makarenko Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Atheism, Communism, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Vladimir grows up in a Christian family in the Soviet Union. Churches are burned, Bibles banned and Believers persecuted. Atheism is enforced at school, and he is ridiculed and mocked. He learns to drink from his grandfather, learns about God from his grandmother and parents. But he joins in rebellion, vandalizing and drinking. He goes away to school at fifteen where a born-again cousin talks to him of God and takes him to underground church. The first part ends when police break up this meeting and he is arrested.

item.title: 2774 “Susan Brooker”
item.itunes:subtitle: Disillusion, Deception, Vedanta
item.itunes:summary: Susan’s baby brother is born with Down Syndrome, and the family quits going to church. Hungry for God, she falls prey to a family who practice Vedanta, believe in reincarnation and many paths to God. At college she mocks an evangelist on campus. She breaks her engagement to move to Ohio where she believes her destiny lies. There she teaches school, and a co-worker leads her to Christ.
item.description: Susan’s baby brother is born with Down Syndrome, and the family quits going to church. Hungry for God, she falls prey to a family who practice Vedanta, believe in reincarnation and many paths to God. At college she mocks an evangelist on campus. She breaks her engagement to move to Ohio where she believes her destiny lies. There she teaches school, and a co-worker leads her to Christ.

She breaks her engagement to move to Ohio where she believes her destiny lies. There she teaches school, and a co-worker leads her to Christ.

item.title: 2773 Kevin Smead
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Fighting, Despair
item.itunes:summary: Kevin grows up hearing about Jesus in church and from his grandfather. He goes forward and is baptized twice; but he doesn’t know the Savior. His family quits going to church when Kevin is twelve, and he smokes pot and drinks. His feelings of failure lead him to drink and fight constantly. He wrecks his truck and fears hell. He meets Michelle who leads him back to church where he truly gives his life to Christ. They marry and Kevin is now a preacher.

item.title: 2772 Viorel Ghita
item.itunes:subtitle: Romanian, Alcohol, Thief
item.itunes:summary: Viorel is born into a poor family in Romania, where his drunken father abuses his mother and beats the children. The parents separate, and Viorel begins to run with bad boys as a teenager, drinking, stealing and lying. He meets Mihaela, who refuses to date him. After a drunken fight with his father, he runs away to work on farms, but returns home after a few months. Mihaela marries him, but his drinking ruins their marriage. During a big fight, Viorel throws himself off a fourth floor balcony, but his trousers snag on the railing. He reads the Bible and gives his life to Christ. Six years later his wife is saved.

item.title: 2771 John Reed
item.itunes:subtitle: Rejection, Basketball, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: John grows up feeling ashamed of his controlling mother, who humiliates him. His father goes along with her to avoid fights. John discovers a love for basketball but is kicked off the court by a bully. He practices secretly, becomes a star and finds acceptance. But in college he does drugs and drinks. After graduation, he dates a depressed girl who ultimately shares the gospel. John prays to receive Christ and is liberated. He marries and becomes a pastor.

item.title: 2770 Jesse Glassburn Classic Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Poverty, Moonshiner, Pride
item.itunes:summary: When the church comes to plant his corn, bringing a meal and testimonies, Jesse still won’t go to church until fall revival when seven different farmers come to invite them to church. Finally, he and his wife go and both get saved. Owen, the son and narrator, prays for salvation two weeks later and eventually the whole family receives Christ. Owen becomes a missionary evangelist traveling the world. Jesse dies in his arms.

item.title: 2769 Jesse Glassburn Classic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Poverty, Moonshiner, Pride
item.itunes:summary: Jesse is a moonshiner, barely able to survive as a hardscrabble farmer in West Virginia. Government agents raid his farm but cannot find his still. He is arrested but the sheriff lets him go. He moves his family to Ohio but cannot find work because of the Depression, so he moves to a farm intending to make moonshine again. A neighbor tries to help but Jesse rebuffs him. The neighbor prays, then the whole church comes to help Jesse plant corn as the first part ends.

item.title: 2768 Randal Rodgers Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Quadriplegic, Despair
item.itunes:summary: Randy suffers many setbacks but finally leaves the hospital for a rehab center. After one day there he is rushed back to the hospital where, after two weeks of tests, he despairs of getting well and decides to starve himself. A Christian friend confronts him, and Randy decides to try again. He sees many others suffering and witnesses to one disfigured man. After four months, he finally goes home. Church becomes a lifeline. He tries to return to college but abandons classes because of his poor health. He manages to preach some and write a book.

item.title: 2767 Randal Rodgers Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Quadriplegic
item.itunes:summary: Randy grows up in a Christian family, taught to work hard and finish whatever he starts. His dad becomes a pastor when Randy is twelve. Randy is working his way through Bible college, goes forward to gain assurance of salvation, and marries Tina, also a student. After three children are born, he drops out to pay debts, opens a painting business. He falls from a scaffold and breaks his neck. The first part ends as he survives surgery but faces grueling rehabilitation as a quadriplegic.

item.title: 2766 Ken Duffield
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Anxiety
item.itunes:summary: Ken becomes a Mama’s boy while his brother becomes a favorite of his pop. He goes to church with his mother but rejects the church in high school to hang out in pool rooms. He runs with a con-man, drives drunk and has close calls. Becomes disillusioned with life after an abortive trip to California, tries therapy but efforts to reform himself fail. Pretending to be Christians, he and a friend go to a Bible camp where Ken is saved but the friend wanders away. Ken marries and has a ministry in Mexico. Now retired with disabilities.

item.title: 2765 Christopher Boda
item.itunes:subtitle: India, Hindu, Untouchable
item.itunes:summary: Christopher’s father is the headman of his Banjara village of Untouchable people. A missionary offers to take the children and educate them at a local mission. Christopher learns English. At fifteen he is injured playing soccer. His leg becomes gangrenous, and a Christian doctor presents the gospel and tells him only Jesus can save him. Christopher prays for salvation. When he is healed, he goes to his village to tell them about the Savior, is nearly killed by his father. He marries a girl who first gives her life to Christ. A missionary helps him go to Bible college and he now has a ministry to his Banjara people.

item.title: 2764 Sam Rotman Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Orthodox Jew, Pride, Pianist
item.itunes:summary: Sam is a third year piano student at Julliard when Christians challenge him to read the New Testament and see that Jesus is the Messiah. Sam reads and is astonished at the claims of Christ. He reads the whole New Testament, ignoring piano practice for a week, and prays to receive Christ. His parents disown him. He marries Deborah, competes in several international piano competitions and is acclaimed. When his children are born, his parents soften a bit. He goes into ministry as a pastor and then as a musical missionary, giving his testimony during each concert he performs.

item.title: 2763 Sam Rotman Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Orthodox Jew, Pianist, Pride
item.itunes:summary: Sam grows up in a very religious atmosphere at home, following his religion faithfully yet unable to control his lustful thoughts. He begins piano lessons at age nine, has talent and dedication, wins competitions and a place at the Julliard School of Music. There he discontinues going to synagogue but still prays at night. Part 1 ends when Sam meets and is confronted with the claims of three born-again students who say Jesus is the Messiah.

item.title: 2762 Kathy Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: False Teachings, Legalistic
item.itunes:summary: Kathy has a hunger for God as a child but cannot keep the rules and gives up. Goes to public high school and is exposed to immorality. Begins readings in eastern religion and witchcraft but fear leads her to discard such books. Goes to college, immerses herself in the party life, gets bored with drunks. Starts reading the Bible, doesn’t understand. An old friend tells her to read the Gospel of John, which she loves. Goes to Bible study, tries another party, feels dirty, goes back to her dorm and prays for salvation. Becomes a nurse, marries a mechanic. She and husband in training with Wycliffe.

item.title: 2761 Amy Faber-Beard
item.itunes:subtitle: Lupus, Pride
item.itunes:summary: Although her family drinks too much and doesn’t go to church, Amy has a grandmother whose talk of God’s judgment frightens her. At 17 she is diagnosed with lupus, which devastates her body in many ways. Her grandmother encourages her to thank God for everything, and Amy reads the Bible and is saved. Her sister provides humor and compassion, helping Amy persevere. Amy meets and marries a man when she is 36. Still with lupus, she gives flute lessons.

item.title: 2760 Philip Dougan Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Atheism, Pride
item.itunes:summary: Philip moves into a new rooming house and makes friends with Jack, another atheist. Phil goes out to dinner and is pressured into drinking whiskey for the first and last time. Because he and Jack return to the rooming house late, they are moved into a room with two Christians, considered fanatics. Humorous attempts to discourage the believers fail, and Phil comes under conviction as the two pray openly for him. He and Jack finally go to church and are saved. Phil walks eight miles in the rain to witness to old friends who are also saved. After 40 years of ministry, Phil is listed in Who’s Who in the World.

item.title: 2759 Philip Dougan Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Youthful, Pride, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Phil’s parents divorce when he is nine. His mother rents a home in the country for the four boys. Life is tough and Phil runs away several times. A snowstorm collapses the roof, destroying their piano and his hopes for a musical career. His mother becomes a housemother to a fraternity, where Phil resumes piano lessons. When his mother insists he live with his father, Phil rebels, rents a room and gets a job while going to school. A Christian witnesses to Phil, and the first part ends with his moving to escape the conviction.

item.title: 2758 Saji Lukos Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: India, Abuse, Demonic Oppression
item.itunes:summary: Saji’s father beats him bloody for receiving Christ then kicks him out of the home. Saji returns to college where his Christian brothers help him. He prospers in his work, rents a house and brings his siblings to take care of them, softening his father’s heart. All profess faith in Christ. Saji marries Moni, goes to the U.S., planning to get rich. God puts India on his heart, he goes to seminary, starts a ministry to spread the gospel in India. His whole family now serves as missionaries in India.

item.title: 2757 Saji Lukos Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: India, Demons, Drunkenness
item.itunes:summary: Saji grows up in a nominal Christian home with a drunken, abusive father and a mother with mental problems. Anger and fighting seem to be the family’s chief inheritance. His sister is demon possessed at fourteen. Saji persists in getting his education, goes to live with uncle where a teacher talks about Christ. Then he rents a room near the college just prior to his graduation and two evangelists visit him and share the gospel and God’s love. Saji yields his life to Christ. Part 1 ends as his father beats him severely for his conversion.

item.title: 2756 “Clara”
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Alcoholism
item.itunes:summary: “Clara” is raised in a Christian family where the parents pray and read Scripture. She rebels against a repressive church, goes to nursing school to get away from home. She works far from home in a psychiatric unit, absorbing godless philosophy. Drinking in bars, she ends up living with a man she eventually marries. They adopt children; Clara adopts alcohol and becomes addicted. She has blackouts, DWI, attempts suicide. Her mother comes to help, takes her home where a pastor’s wife leads Clara to the Lord.

item.title: 2755 Jacob and Almaz Mesud Pt 3
item.itunes:subtitle: Ethiopian, Faith Test
item.itunes:summary: Almaz is raised in a prosperous Ethiopian family. From her mother she learns to help others, sacrificing time and money for the poor. The country falls to Communism, and Almaz pursues a career in medicine by going to Russia to study. She hates communism, prays for God’s guidance. Jacob writes her from Sweden, proposing marriage. She asks for a sign: to get her lost passport, which God does; so she meets Jacob in Athens and they marry. Their life is dedicated to sharing the gospel in various countries.

item.title: 2754 Jacob Mesud Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Prison, Refugee
item.itunes:summary: Jacob is arrested during Sudan’s civil war and falsely accused of sedition. He spends four months in prison, then his aunt comes from Saudi Arabia and rescues him. She takes him from Saudi Arabia where he could be executed for apostasy and smuggling Bibles into the kingdom. He violates the Ramadan fast, admits he is a Christian and then goes on the run from authorities. Part 2 ends as he escapes to live in Sweden, praying for a wife.
item.description: Jacob is arrested during Sudan’s civil war and falsely accused of sedition. He spends four months in prison, then his aunt comes from Saudi Arabia and rescues him. She takes him from Saudi Arabia where he could be executed for apostasy and smuggling Bibles into the kingdom. He violates the Ramadan fast, admits he is a Christian and then goes on the run from authorities. Part 2 ends as he escapes to live in Sweden, praying for a wife.

She takes him from Saudi Arabia where he could be executed for apostasy and smuggling Bibles into the kingdom. He violates the Ramadan fast, admits he is a Christian and then goes on the run from authorities. Part 2 ends as he escapes to live in Sweden, praying for a wife.

item.title: 2753 Jacob Mesud Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Muslim, Ethiopian
item.itunes:summary: Jacob is born into a poor Muslim family. His name is Abdulihe and he supports himself by serving as a guide to tourists. His father is Arab, his mother is Ethiopian, and he is hated by both groups. He becomes a guide to two Christians, who give him a New Testament. Reading the Gospel of John, he sees that Christ lets us choose to follow Him. He becomes a believer and his life is threatened. The communists take over Ethiopia, and he flees to Sudan. The first part ends with civil war erupting in Sudan.

The first part ends with civil war erupting in Sudan.

item.title: 2752 Bill Bryant
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Alcohol, Crime
item.itunes:summary: Bill grows up with a succession of fathers and a bad attitude. He smokes marijuana at 11, drinks and gets in trouble. Sent to a detention home at 13, he works to straighten up. Can’t graduate, continues to drink and do drugs. He meets Melissa and they live together, then marry. She threatens to leave because of his wild life with accidents caused by drinking. A daughter is born and he still carouses. She leaves him before Christmas. He sees a movie about Christ, reads the Bible and gets saved. Eventually, Melissa returns. Bill is now in Scotland as a missionary.

Bill is now in Scotland as a missionary.

item.title: 2751 Harvey DeVaughn
item.itunes:subtitle: Abuse, Alcoholism, Drugs, Dog Fighting
item.itunes:summary: Harvey’s dad is an abusive drunk who drives away Harvey’s mother. He grows up a witness to violence, lying and stealing and joins the ranks, getting expelled from school for violence. He has some exposure to Christian love and goes to church with sister; but he is drawn into alcohol and drugs and fighting pit bull dogs. After he nearly overdoses on crack cocaine, he cries out to God, reads the Bible and quits drugs. He is born again in church several years later. Now in music ministry at church.

item.title: 2750 Mavis Donaldson Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Physical Suffering, Faith
item.itunes:summary: In this conclusion Mavis and Dudley adopt a daughter. She continues to have seizures and pain from her lupus. Once she pulls her own tooth because they have no money for a dentist. Then she is diagnosed with ovarian cancer. Chemotherapy fails, so they attempt a bone marrow transplant, which is horrific but seems to succeed. The cancer returns and she refuses additional treatment. She trusts in God to the end.
item.description: In this conclusion Mavis and Dudley adopt a daughter. She continues to have seizures and pain from her lupus. Once she pulls her own tooth because they have no money for a dentist. Then she is diagnosed with ovarian cancer. Chemotherapy fails, so they attempt a bone marrow transplant, which is horrific but seems to succeed. The cancer returns and she refuses additional treatment. She trusts in God to the end.

item.title: 2749 Mavis Donaldson Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Disease, Suffering, Courage
item.itunes:summary: Mavis has a normal life until her kidneys fail at age thirteen. As she lies dying, a stranger says God has a purpose for her life. When she’s a senior in high school, she has a grand mal seizure and is diagnosed with epilepsy. After graduation she’s hospitalized, overmedicated and is put in the mental ward. Finally, the epilepsy is controlled enough that she works in a day care center, sharing an apartment. Another crisis and she’s diagnosed with lupus. A roommate leads her to Christ, and then she meets Dudley and they marry. The first part ends with her pregnancy.

A roommate leads her to Christ, and then she meets Dudley and they marry. The first part ends with her pregnancy.

item.title: 2748 Kermit Hagerman Classic Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcoholism, Guilt, Reconciliation
item.itunes:summary: Kermit’s hard drinking leads to his cousin’s death and leaves him plagued with guilt. He loses a good job and ends up on the streets where he shoots a man during a confrontation. A friend tells him about Jesus, Who will change his life. So Kermit searches for the rescue mission, comes to Pacific Garden Mission and gives his life to Christ. He and Mary are married, and he is still serving God at PGM.

He and Mary are married, and he is still serving God at PGM.

So Kermit searches for the rescue mission, comes to Pacific Garden Mission and gives his life to Christ. He and Mary are married, and he is still serving God at PGM.

item.title: 2747 Kermit Hagerman Classic Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Lack Of Direction
item.itunes:summary: Kermit never attends church growing up in South Chicago. His parents leave him and brother with Grandmother for several years. He steals and cuts school after parents split when he’s a teenager, and he does a year in bad boy’s school. He learns to drink with co-workers. Is drafted and sent to Vietnam where he works to be a good soldier. But back home, drinking controls him and leads to breakup with Mary, his true love. First part ends with his alienation.

item.title: 2746 Jim Bottorff Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Divorce, Deception
item.itunes:summary: Jim continues to try treatment for his alcoholism, but fails. He loses jobs, lies, gambles and commits adultery. His second wife divorces him. He squanders his retirement cache, sells possessions, ends up living with Christian cousin and goes to church, talks with pastor and prays for salvation. Marriage and family are reconciled. Now in ministry.

item.title: 2745 Jim Bottorff Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Failed Marriages
item.itunes:summary: Jim grows up ashamed of his alcoholic father, yet he loves him and does well in college until his dad dies. Then guilt and depression set in and he becomes addicted to alcohol and anti-depressants. He manages to graduate, lands a good job and marries. But alcohol controls him and he loses one job after another, even one marriage after another. The first part ends as he is arrested for DUI’s and seeks rehab.

But alcohol controls him and he loses one job after another, even one marriage after another. The first part ends as he is arrested for DUI’s and seeks rehab.

item.title: 2744 Jeff Watson
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Self Reliance
item.itunes:summary: Jeff’s family is dysfunctional. Dad gone a lot and depressed when he’s home. Jeff is a peacemaker who likes to help others. When his best friend is killed in an accident, Jeff decides to join the Peace Corps. He spends two years in Korea, helping fight TB and leprosy. A leper with faith in Christ prompts Jeff to read the Bible. He helps a missionary with orphan children. When he comes home, he teaches middle school where he’s invited to Bible study and receives Christ. Now works for Christian ministry to the blind.

item.title: 2743 Alma Gerstenkorn
item.itunes:subtitle: German Immigrant, World War ll, Communism
item.itunes:summary: Alma & family live in Poland when Russian army invades. Father sent to Siberia. Family is split up, forced to labor on farms for four years. Then they are reunited and sent to East Germany. Each escapes to West Germany. She meets and marries Fred, and they immigrate to America. Three children, good life, but Alma is empty inside until she hears evangelist on radio and receives Christ. Fred follows in salvation and both serve the Lord. Fred dies but Alma still active in evangelism.

item.title: 2742 Fred Jennings Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Bitterness, Divorce, Forgiveness
item.itunes:summary: After Fred’s eight-year-old son attempts suicide, Fred calls out to God and reads the Bible but he is unable to explain the change to his wife. She leaves, taking their daughter. Fred gets custody of his son but is still bitter. As he reads the Bible, God’s Word teaches him forgiveness and he prays for his wife. She remarries and divorces three times, but Fred remains faithful and waiting, 36 years.

item.title: 2741 Fred Jennings Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Atheism, Fear of Death
item.itunes:summary: Growing up without any knowledge of God, Fred succeeds in college, in the Air Force and in business. A poor relationship with his stepfather makes him a poor father after he marries and has two children. Several close calls as a navigator make him wonder about God and death, especially when his stepfather dies in his arms. Then his eight year old son attempts suicide and Fred cries out to God.
item.description: Growing up without any knowledge of God, Fred succeeds in college, in the Air Force and in business. A poor relationship with his stepfather makes him a poor father after he marries and has two children. Several close calls as a navigator make him wonder about God and death, especially when his stepfather dies in his arms. Then his eight year old son attempts suicide and Fred cries out to God.

Several close calls as a navigator make him wonder about God and death, especially when his stepfather dies in his arms. Then his eight year old son attempts suicide and Fred cries out to God.

item.title: 2740 Steve Tice
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Suicide, Occult
item.itunes:summary: Steve’s parents run many businesses, so home is chaotic. His grandmother takes him to church and he’s baptized; but Jesus seems distant to him. Overweight and with acne, Steve withdrew into fantasy and drugs. Joins the Navy, explores the occult, attempts suicide. He then does well in the military but explores homosexuality and adultery. Drinks heavily. A civilian again he tries education. Disillusioned, he turns to the Bible and meets Jesus, encouraged by his step-sister. Now in prison ministry, hoping to be a missionary to Cuba.

item.title: 2739 Jay Schwab
item.itunes:subtitle: Promiscuity, Abortion
item.itunes:summary: Jay views pornography at age ten, which leads him and a friend to explore their sexuality until another friend is repulsed by their behavior. At eighteen, Jay remembers those events and fears he is homosexual. He becomes promiscuous; his girlfriend gets pregnant several times and has abortions. His newly-saved aunt urges him to read the Bible and go to church. Finally he goes and is saved. He manages to break away from girlfriend and marries the pastor’s daughter. Now in ministry.

item.title: 2738 Mike Sandlin Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Violence
item.itunes:summary: Mike continues to flaunt death, taking a gun to court but God intervenes. He attempts suicide with pills, but his daughter and a former Marine stop him. He moves to Florida where his wife files sexual harassment charges against her boss and the man threatens Mike and his family. Defending them, Mike courts death again. God intervenes. He loses his family, tries cults, then goes to church. Finds believers who disciple him. Now has a prison ministry but an inoperable brain tumor.

item.title: 2737 Mike Sandlin Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Suicidal
item.itunes:summary: Mike rejects God as a teenager, joins the Marines but doesn’t go to Vietnam. He feels guilty at serving. A drug addict in denial, he becomes deputy sheriff, involved in undercover drug investigations. Illness, drugs and death threats destroy his marriage, and he plays Russian roulette. Takes dangerous job as a security guard, but steals drugs. As first part end, Mike is planning to kill the judge. His mother’s prayers stand in the gap.

item.title: 2736 Earl Ray Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Gambling, Drinking
item.itunes:summary: Born in poverty, Earl must quit school at fifteen to help support family. He works 84 hours a week for seven dollars. He marries Essie, takes job as bartender as well, learns to drink and gamble. Nearly dies of tuberculosis, but God heals him. Earl goes back to gambling, cheats brother, runs away to Las Vegas. Family follows, son is saved, Mother still prays for him. Earl again runs away to California, goes to rescue mission, prays for salvation. Serves God at rescue mission.

item.title: 2735 Greg Locke
item.itunes:subtitle: Rapper, Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: Greg Locke’s grandmother loves the Lord and prays for Greg. He needs prayer because he gets addicted to rap music at age thirteen. By then he’s already stealing and has been before a judge three times. Wanting to be a rap star, he does well and has a chance to make a TV commercial. But the court orders his mother to put him in a home to learn discipline. She chooses a Christian home, and while there Greg goes to a revival where he is saved. Now an evangelist.

item.title: 2734 Sandy Schroeder
item.itunes:subtitle: Sexual Abuse, Abortion
item.itunes:summary: Sandy Schroeder endured repeated abuse as a child and then during her marriage. She didn’t know how to forgive the ones who hurt her until she herself received forgiveness. Parental guidance is suggested because of the sensitive nature of this inspiring story of how she was set free.

Parental guidance is suggested because of the sensitive nature of this inspiring story of how she was set free.

item.title: 2733 Ray Peterman
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Alcohol, Jail
item.itunes:summary: Ray Peterman had a problem, one he denied and desperately tried to cover up. Fortunately, he also had a wife who loved him; and with the help of a Friend that sticks closer than a brother, he’s a different man today.
item.description: Ray Peterman had a problem, one he denied and desperately tried to cover up. Fortunately, he also had a wife who loved him; and with the help of a Friend that sticks closer than a brother, he’s a different man today.

item.title: 2732 Stephanie Lane
item.itunes:subtitle: Molested, Drugs, Occult
item.itunes:summary: Living in darkness and fear, Stephanie Lane ran away at fourteen and sought protection in the occult and drugs, which deepened her bondage. Invite your friends to hear the exciting story of how she was rescued and her life transformed, another true dramatization on “Unshackled!”

item.title: 2731 Frank Edwards Classic
item.itunes:subtitle: Feigning Christianity
item.itunes:summary: If you’ve ever pretended to be something you weren’t, then you can identify with Frank Edwards. “The truth will out”, they say. And the truth is what set him free to be real, honest and successful.
item.description: If you’ve ever pretended to be something you weren’t, then you can identify with Frank Edwards. “The truth will out”, they say. And the truth is what set him free to be real, honest and successful.

item.title: 2730 Betty Coon
item.itunes:subtitle: Promiscuity, Abortion, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: In an age of permissiveness and shattered families, how does a young girl learn to say “no”? Betty Coon struggled and failed repeatedly, a slave to her own weak will. Parental Guidance is suggested for this remarkable true story of how Betty’s will and her life were transformed.

item.title: 2729 Ricky Bueno
item.itunes:subtitle: Gang, Crime, Violence, Prison
item.itunes:summary: Gangs seem to offer protection and acceptance to troubled young people. But Ricky Bueno learned they were a trap that dragged him down.
item.description: Gangs seem to offer protection and acceptance to troubled young people. But Ricky Bueno learned they were a trap that dragged him down.
item.content:encoded: Gangs seem to offer protection and acceptance to troubled young people. But Ricky Bueno learned they were a trap that dragged him down.

item.title: 2728 Marjorie Jordan
item.itunes:subtitle: Raised in Occultist Home
item.itunes:summary: Marjorie’s mother was a spiritualist who held séances in the home every Friday, so Marjorie grows up expecting to be a medium. Joining the girl scouts at age twelve, Marjorie learns about Jesus Christ, but falls in with girls at school who drink. As she sings in a church choir, the woman in front of her drops dead, and Marjorie responds to the invitation to accept Christ. Her life is unchanged for two years until she meets Robert, a sailor who is saved. They marry. Mother is furious about salvation, but their kindness softens her. Forty-seven years of ministry together.

item.title: 2727 Christine Crawford
item.itunes:subtitle: Troubled Teen, Broken Home
item.itunes:summary: Christine’s parents divorce, and she is raised by paternal grandparents. Grandmother loves the Lord, and Christine accepts Christ after listening to “Unshackled!”. She goes to live with her father at age fifteen, but he mocks her faith. She joins the Army as a nurse, meets Rob and they marry. He gives up dabbling in the occult to join her in faith. Commitment to Christ antagonizes his family, but her father receives Christ after kidney problems.
item.description: Christine’s parents divorce, and she is raised by paternal grandparents. Grandmother loves the Lord, and Christine accepts Christ after listening to “Unshackled!”. Commitment to Christ antagonizes his family, but her father receives Christ after kidney problems.

item.title: 2726 Wesley Auger
item.itunes:subtitle: Hatred, Search for Father
item.itunes:summary: His father is imprisoned for embezzlement when Wesley is twelve, embittering Wesley and his mother. They lose home and live with relatives, who teach Wesley about God, Whom he rejects. Aunt sends him to Christian camp where he receives Christ. Mother is furious, won’t help him go to Bible school. As an evangelist, Wesley falls in love with Dorothy, who urges him to find his father, which he does. Wesley’s father receives Christ after hearing his son preach.

item.title: 2725 Robert Allport
item.itunes:subtitle: Death of a Child
item.itunes:summary: Robert grows up on farm caring for animals. He reads the Bible in sixth grade but still lives sinful life in high school. A co-worker explains the gospel and Robert prays to receive Christ at age twenty. He marries Deb and they head to Florida for Bible school. Plans are on hold when their first baby is born hydrocephalic. Their faith is tested through three years of medical and financial crises. Baby dies, but God gives them healthy daughter and son.

item.title: 2724 Terry Terrill
item.itunes:subtitle: Self-Sufficient, Baseball Coach
item.itunes:summary: Terry grows up in good home of ten children. Sports is more important than God to him, but he goes to church and youth groups. In college his hunger for God grows and he and a friend seek a good church. They both get saved. Terry studies the Bible and memorized scripture and leads friends to Christ. But he does poorly in baseball and questions God. Terry learns humility and commitment to serving Christ as coach in a small Christian school.

item.title: 2723 Brian Boyes
item.itunes:subtitle: Motorcycle Gang, Crime
item.itunes:summary: When Brian is ten, his parents divorce. Running the streets, he learns to drink, fight and steal. He buys a motorcycle and runs with Hells Angels. He shoots a man in self-defense and is arrested for attempted murder. He spends time in prison for weapons violations. He marries but is unable to change; plans to leave his wife on a cross-country motorcycle run when his wife receives Christ and prays for him. Brian surrenders to Jesus and now has a prison ministry.

Brian surrenders to Jesus and now has a prison ministry.

item.title: 2722 Brad Kesler
item.itunes:subtitle: Youth Rebellion, Search for Father
item.itunes:summary: Raised by his grandparents, Brad grows up feeling worthless because his parents didn’t want him. He makes a profession of faith at age ten, but steals and gets in trouble. As a teenager, Brad searches for his dad and finds him. Brad and his brother go to live with him, but Brad still feels empty inside. He goes to revival and is saved. Learns to submit to his dad’s authority and ultimately leads his father to Christ. Then his father is reconciled to Brad’s grandfather and leads him to the Lord.

item.title: 2721 Andrew Wyzenbeek
item.itunes:subtitle: Holland, Atheist, Alcohol, Inventor
item.itunes:summary: Born in Holland to atheists, Andrew comes to the U.S. at nineteen. The family settles in Iowa where Andrew’s inventive ability keeps him at work as a machinist. “Six dirty Swedes” who work for him get saved and the change is so extraordinary, he goes to revival to see for himself. Makes commitment, buys a Bible and reads about Jesus. Genuine repentance leads to new life. Invents many things but also has evangelical ministry around the world.

item.title: 2720 E. Robert Jordan
item.itunes:subtitle: Self-sufficient, World War II
item.itunes:summary: A sadistic stepmother causes Robert and sisters to run away when he is three. Confined to an orphanage until he is sixteen, Robert wants revenge and becomes a pugilist. He joins the Navy, drinks too much and fights in World War II but stalks his stepmother while on leave. A Christian in his unit demonstrates God’s love and forgiveness, and Robert visits the man’s brother, who leads him to Christ. Robert marries Marjorie and becomes a pastor.

item.title: 2719 Masahiro Ogawa
item.itunes:subtitle: Japan, Self-Esteem, Purpose
item.itunes:summary: Ogawa’s dies of alcoholism, leaving family in hardship. Ogawa dreams of a career in film-making, even stealing from Mother to buy magazines and go to movies. Sister dies tragically, and Ogawa is more isolated. He secures job with Warner Brothers in Tokyo, but is so lonely, he listens to radio, hears Christian message that contradicts his belief in fatalism. He reads the Bible and believes, receives Christ. Ogawa helps launch Christian drama on radio, including “Unshackled!"

item.title: 2718 Bernie Holritz
item.itunes:subtitle: Seeking God’s Direction
item.itunes:summary: At age eight Bernie loses father; but with Mother’s dedication, he grows up wanting to be a missionary to China. Bernie’s love of music distracts him from the faith, but he surrenders to Christ in college. He spends war in Texas teaching radar and doing evangelism; marries Jeanette. After the war, China is closed, so the couple goes instead to Japan as missionaries. Bernie helps launch Pacific Broadcasting Association.

item.title: 2717 Phil Skeba
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Drugs, Immorality
item.itunes:summary: Phil grows up alienated from his condemning father. Clumsiness leads to broken bones and scorn. Phil’s bitterness finds relief in heavy drinking and then drugs. Car wrecks cause him to wonder about God, but he follows the world and has an affair with a married woman. His sister and husband witness about salvation through Christ. Phil quits drinking, then commits his life to Christ. He marries and leads his terminally ill father to the Lord.

item.title: 2716 Jesse Vasquez Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Hispanic, Fear of Death, Coach
item.itunes:summary: As World War II ends, Jesse hopes for better relationship with his father. He starts a produce-hauling business, isn’t satisfied and give the business to family, then goes away to college, wanting to be a coach. Injury ends his dream; he goes to Chicago, is saved at Pacific Garden Mission. He spends the rest of his life in Chicago, running a successful awning business but helping poor young boys learn about Christ. He gives all his time and money to others.

item.title: 2715 Jesse Vasquez Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Hispanic, Athlete, Fear of Death
item.itunes:summary: Jesse grows up in Arizona fearing a God he sees as stern and punishing. His father’s drunken abuse leads to estrangement; but Mother’s love of God softens him. Successful at sports, Jesse dreams of being a coach. He becomes a gunner in World War II, lives through a mid-air collision and fears death. He begins reading the Psalms. Part I ends as Jesse’s mother is saved and praying for him as he prepares for a bombing run over Japan.

item.title: 2714 Tommie Lee Pickens
item.itunes:subtitle: Black, Drugs, Dealing, PGM
item.itunes:summary: Tommy grows up hating his father for drinking that leaves the family on welfare. He quits going to church and hangs out with friends, drinking and stealing. Grandmother’s godly influence ends with her death. Tommy quits school, drifts for ten years, in and out of jail for minor offenses. Then he deals crack and gets hooked. Family intervenes, take him to Pacific Garden Mission where he receives Christ. He finishes Bible college, then gets Doctorate in Theology. Now a chaplain in the U.S. Army.

item.title: 2713 Arthur Amsbaugh
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Child with Birth Defect
item.itunes:summary: Arthur’s family is impoverished by his dad’s drinking. He wastes his time in school but graduates. Joins the Navy but is so immature he’s released in two weeks. Marries his sweetheart but drinks like his father. Daughter is born with cleft in face, nearly dies in later surgery. Arthur promises God he’ll go to church if God saves her. God does and Arthur keeps his promise. His wife is saved and the pastor visits and leads Arthur to Christ. Both he and Dad quit drinking, and Arthur leads his father to Christ.

item.title: 2712 Fred Krauss
item.itunes:subtitle: Germany, Seeking Meaning, Success
item.itunes:summary: Born in Nazi Germany, Fred and his family are trapped in the Russian zone when the war ends, while Dad is in the West zone. Drab life with not future, atheism surround him. Mother leads escape across border to meet Fred’s father. Restless Fred goes to Canada at nineteen, works but has no peace in his heart. Searches philosophies and nature to no end. Hears street preacher in Canada, convicted by Bible verses, goes to gospel meetings. Struggles but prays for salvation. Now an evangelist in Canada.

item.title: 2711 “Doris”
item.itunes:subtitle: Marriage to Unbeliever
item.itunes:summary: Growing up in a godly home, Doris becomes responsible for family at age thirteen when her mother dies. Dad sends her to college, but Doris longs for fun. She marries an unsaved man against her father’s wishes. Husband’s drinking and gambling strain the marriage. Doris gives her life to Christ, and remains in a difficult and loveless marriage for 62 years for her children’s sake. Her children know the Lord because of her faithfulness.

item.title: 2710 Mary Jane Ponten Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Cerebral Palsy
item.itunes:summary: Mary Jane marries Bud, who also has cerebral palsy, and helps him in his printing business. She miscarries twice, so they adopt a son. Then she gives birth to a daughter. Both want to be missionaries but can’t. Bud retires as printer and dies of cancer. Mary Jane begins ministry teaching the church to reach out to the handicapped. Today she travels and teaches around the world, including China!

Today she travels and teaches around the world, including China!

Today she travels and teaches around the world, including China!

item.title: 2709 Mary Jane Ponten Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Cerebral Palsy
item.itunes:summary: Not expected to live at birth, Mary Jane is slow to walk and talk and diagnosed with cerebral palsy. Her parents pray and don’t give up, but teach her patiently. She even learns to ride a bike and does well in school; but she hates being thought of as mentally retarded. Active in church, she wants to be a missionary to China. In Bible school she commits her life to Christ. Not allowed to be a missionary, Mary Jane gets a job but sinks into self-pity for a time. Part I ends as she is about to meet her husband.

item.title: 2708 Christina Alexandra
item.itunes:subtitle: Schizophrenia
item.itunes:summary: Christina’s schizophrenia begins manifesting as a teenager. She has never known her father. Feeling unaccepted by her family, she attempts suicide. Alienated from all social life, she tries psychiatry but withdraws into fantasy world. Reading the Bible, she senses that Jesus is the key, but paranoia sends her to psychiatric hospital where she again tries suicide. Medication and a Christian doctor restore her to normalcy. She hears the gospel on radio, calls the pastor who leads her to Christ. Now married and writing Christian books.

item.title: 2707 Tyler Kirby
item.itunes:subtitle: Drug Abuse, Dealing
item.itunes:summary: Having grown up in a Christian home, Tyler thinks he’s okay with God in spite of being addicted to pornography and drinking. Then he slips into drugs, including cocaine. He dates a girl who loves the Lord and who finally breaks up with him because he is lost and won’t turn to Christ. A friend tells Tyler to talk with his pastor, who leads him to Christ. After he shakes his addictions, his girlfriend and he marry. He leads his siblings to the Lord and today serves in evangelism at his church.

item.title: 2706 Bill Steibs
item.itunes:subtitle: Success, Arrogance, Marital Strife
item.itunes:summary: Bill’s explosive temper results from older brothers who bully him. He quits church in high school and starts drinking. Marries sweetheart, but drinking and jealousy erode their marriage. Puffed with pride, he opens karate school and soaks up public attention, neglecting his wife. He writes and travels but is losing his wife. A client leads his wife to Christ, but after a blowup, she asks Bill to leave, then tells him to invite Jesus into his heart. He does, and their marriage is healed. They now run a Christian ministry.

item.title: 2705 Henry Roberts
item.itunes:subtitle: Truck Driver, Suicide
item.itunes:summary: In high school Henry falls in love with Lois, who loves the Lord while his family mistrusts church and Christians. They marry and he tries church for a while, but the world is more important. As a truck driver, he’s gone a lot, suffers illness, wife urges him to trust in the Lord. He refuses. Children grow up and marriage falls apart. Henry tries suicide, talks divorce. At a truck stop, a man invites Henry to gospel service and gives him a tract. Henry reads, prays and gives his life to Christ. Marriage restored, he’s now in ministry to truckers.

item.title: 2704 Greg & Diane Malanick Pt 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Party Lifestyle, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: His parents’ divorce convinces Greg that children break up marriages. Raised by his unloving father, drugs become his mother. Greg hungers for love and find it in Diane. After their marriage, he spends all their money on drugs and insists she abort their baby, turning her against him. He hears the gospel driving home, and marvels that Diane is suddenly more loving. She is saved. Greg overhears the gospel as Diane and friend have Bible study, and he prays for salvation. Unable to have children, they adopted a baby girl. Now serve as missionaries in New Zealand.

item.title: 2703 Diane & Greg Malanick Pt 1
item.itunes:subtitle: Abortion, Guilt
item.itunes:summary: Rough childhood leaves Diane hungering for love. She meets Greg and wants to quit school, but her dad persuades her to graduate. Diane and Greg marry, but he doesn’t give up drugs. Friends find Christ, and Diane goes to church but Greg refuses. When Diane gets pregnant, he insists she get an abortion. Their marriage fails as her love turns to hate. Then she is saved. First part ends when a friend and she meet for Bible study at home, which Greg hates.

item.title: 2702 Al Pittman
item.itunes:subtitle: Black, Abusive Home, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: What does it mean to be a man? Al’s father is a man’s man who works hard and drinks harder. Al hates his father for getting drunk and beating Mother; yet he loves his father who stands up for Al when he gets in trouble. At age seventeen Al intervenes and hits his dad for beating Al’s mother. When Al’s sister invites him to church, he goes out of curiosity and responds to the gospel. Now a pastor, he sees that man is someone who follows the Lord and keeps His commandments.

item.title: 2701 Tom Varney
item.itunes:subtitle: Australia, Violence, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: An Australian, perceived injustice leads Tom into hatred of authority that focuses on police. Drinking releases his rage. Marriage doesn’t quell his violence. He sets fire to police cars. Arrested, he’s treated at psychiatric hospital. One arson attempts burns him badly and he is confined to a hospital for the criminally insane. Wife stands by him. He escapes, is captured and then an inmate begins reading the Bible to Tom. Released, he is discipled and born again. Now in ministry.

item.title: 2700 Larry Price
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebellion, Crime, Drugs
item.itunes:summary: A teenager during the sixties, Larry becomes rebellious, breaking rules, stealing and doing drugs. Small crimes become bigger and he lands in Florida prison for burglary. Out again, he lives on the streets, eating at rescue missions. Another crime puts him in Georgia prison, and he tries to rehabilitate himself. Strangers visit, sharing Jesus and send their pastor who explains salvation. Larry cries out to God and grows in faith through Bible study. Now married with grown children and in ministry.

item.title: 2699 Steve Sayger
item.itunes:subtitle: Child Neglect, Adoption
item.itunes:summary: Drunken abusive father puts Steve’s mother in mental hospital. Living with Grandpa introduces him to love and fear of God but is short-lived. Poverty and fear are Steve’s lot in life. He runs away at thirteen. Sleeping here and there, he stays in school. Friends take him to revival one night and he wants salvation but is too ashamed. A friend leads him to Christ in the parking lot. His friend’s family adopt Steve. Now married with nine children.

item.title: 2698 Ron Sharp
item.itunes:subtitle: Crime, Prison
item.itunes:summary: His father dies when Ron is ten. Then Ron gets rheumatic fever and spends a year in a convalescent home. Family disintegrates as Mom drinks and kids turn to drugs and crime. Many confrontations with police, ever trapped, scared and risking death, Ron goes to prison at age 25. Hears gospel message and wants to change, but goes back to drugs and crime when he’s released. Sister takes him to church where he is saved. Now serves in prison ministry.

item.title: 2697 James Bentley
item.itunes:subtitle: Pride, Teen Rebellion, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: In spite of a God-fearing, loving family, James is a rebellious teenager who lies, vandalizes and drinks. When a friend accidentally shoots him below the eye, James fears death but is too proud to pray. He survives and carries on as before. God and his parents help him through crises, but James is ungrateful and bitter. Unable to bear his sin, he cries out to God, then talks with a pastor who leads him to Christ and a changed life.

item.title: 2696 Richard Moore
item.itunes:subtitle: Korean War, Disability
item.itunes:summary: Richard grows up in poverty without God. Two brothers have muscular dystrophy. Joins army after graduation and goes to fight in Korea. Christian buddy influences him but back home he begins drinking hard after father’s death. Head-on collision while drunk nearly kills a boy. He joins Air Force, falls in love with woman who loves the Lord. Goes to church with her and is saved. Richard gets muscular dystrophy later but continues to serve God.

item.title: 2695 Marion “Polly” Walters
item.itunes:subtitle: Alcohol, Assaulted, Blinded
item.itunes:summary: “Polly”’s mother is born-again, so he grows up in church knowing about Jesus. His dad is a drunkard, but Polly hates the taste of alcohol until he joins the Navy. Afterward, he drinks too much, even after he marries. While drunk, a stranger offers him a ride and shoots Polly, who nearly dies. Wife receives Christ, Polly is left nearly blind. His drinking worsens until family takes him to state hospital for rehab. There he cries out to God and is gloriously saved.

item.title: 2694 Bill Cole
item.itunes:subtitle: Self-Reliant, Walk across America
item.itunes:summary: Bill stays out of trouble growing up, works at being a good boy until he’s a teenager and challenges the pastor. College and career leave him feeling empty, so he decides to walk across America. Besieged by witnesses of Christ everywhere he goes, he reaches Denver and stops for nine months to work, then walks to Seattle, reading the Bible. Proud and self-reliant, he doesn’t realize he’s a sinner until he lies to Canadian customs. Then he prays a sincere prayer of repentance and is born-again. Now walks with the Lord as a pastor.

item.title: 2693 Willie Norton
item.itunes:subtitle: Drugs, Alcohol
item.itunes:summary: Willie becomes addicted to pornography at fourteen, cocaine at twenty-two. Alcohol leads him to violence and blackouts. He’s arrested but slips by with fines. He lives with a woman, decides to marry and wants his dad to be best man. His dad is dying of cancer, and Willie sees his dad accept Christ before he dies. Willie’s drug addiction grows so bad, his wife issues ultimatum. He goes to see brother, is discipled by Christian, prays for salvation at work.

item.title: 2692 Fred Howard Johnson
item.itunes:subtitle: Music, Success, PGM
item.itunes:summary: Although family is poor, Howard is born with musical talent and he helps support family by playing the piano in burlesque theatres in Chicago. Wine, women and son lead him astray, to the horror of his Christian parents. He marries Ruth, a chaste Christian, but can’t give up the old life. He visits Pacific Garden Mission often for coffee but resists the gospel until his wife issues ultimatum. He goes to PGM and receives Christ as Savior, rejects old life and plays music for Lord thereafter.
